Reviews.Title: “Best hotel behind a gas station ever!”
Reviews.Author: Brusheep
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend gave me a questioning look when we pulled into this hotel adjacent to a gas station parking lot, but he ended up loving it as much as I did. They do an excellent job of soundproofing so that even the Friday night of the block party with music and pingpong just outside our room, we didn't hear a thing. And you have all the benefits of being in town with plenty of yummy casual restaurant choices, coffee bars, shops, etc. I only wish we had checked out the beach behind the hotel sooner. We were off doing and seeing other things around the island and almost missed it. The staff is very friendly. This is a welcome alternative to the generic, Disney World-esque resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else in Upcountry”
Reviews.Author: chartfan
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hub for Haleakala, Hana, and Upcountry. Looked at lots of places and so glad we stayed in Paia and at the Paia Inn. My boyfriend and I are generally low maintenance and don't require much but we like a quiet, clean, comfortable spot at the end of the day. Certainly more pricey than other options in the area, but I picked the Paia Inn because I knew we wouldn't have to worry about anything. The staff is awesome - how many times do you come back after dinner and the hotel staff greet you by your first name because they remember it from the day before. Our room (#2) was small, which I knew when I booked. But we were hardly in our room except to sleep and plan our day. If you are worried about a small room, then go outside - you're on vacation. If I stayed in the room, I would have used the provided AppleTV to watch netflix. We are early risers and Anthony's Coffee shop across the street opens at like 5:30am so we always had amazing coffee (the hotel has complimentary coffee for later risers). We used the free parking lot a block from the hotel so no charges there. We didn't use the private beach access but I overheard that it was redone. We ate breakfast at the hotel on our last day and it was really good. Would easily stay at the Paia Inn again and have no hesitation recommending it to a friend. Notes on Paia: skip Mama's Fish House - so expensive and frankly not that good. Moana's cafe was way better.

Reviews.Title: “island of tranquility in Paia”
Reviews.Author: Marsha G
Reviews.Content: You definitely should consider staying at the Paia Inn. It's a gem! We couldn't have been happier with our stay there. The staff are all very friendly and accommodating, and the rooms are extremely comfortable. Someone was always ready to help. They'll even take your luggage from the car to the room. There are so many little touches that make the difference between having a place to stay and a place to call home for a few days. For example, the inn has a noise machine in every room--not because there are bothersome noises to mask, but just to help make sure guests get a good night's sleep. The bedding, linens and toiletries are all top-rate. The inn has its own beach access and provides chairs, towels and beach toys. The tree-covered courtyard is where custom-made breakfasts are prepared, and they are delicious. The location is great--right on the Hana Highway, in the middle of the business district. The rooms are all in the back, though, so there is no street noise at all. There are two computers and a printer, which was a great help when we needed to print boarding passes. We had a two bedroom suite, and it had a fully-equipped kitchen. While we didn't prepare and cook food, it would be a great convenience and savings for those who want to do that. We appreciated just having a nice big refrigerator with cold water and ice, with room to store fruit, beverages and restaurant leftovers that we could reheat the next day. The small living room had only a three seat couch, however, and the kitchen table sat four. This was adequate for us (three people) but might be a problem for bigger groups. The bedrooms were small and didn't have much space for storing clothes or even leaving an open suitcase, but the beds are super comfortable. There are flowering trees everywhere. It is serene!

Reviews.Title: “On the pricey side, but a nice break from cookie cutter resorts”
Reviews.Author: pourtant
Reviews.Content: I retreated to Paia for a couple days after a week in Wailea/Kihei. I just wanted to stay someplace that didn't feel like a typical resort. The Paia Inn definitely fit the bill. The boutique feel was a welcome change from the other accommodations I'd just experienced in Maui. My room (1) was small (and without a window), but the bed was comfy, the furnishings nice, and the bathroom felt pretty luxurious. The staff was super friendly, too -- as was every person I spoke with in Paia. There's no elevator, but they'll help you with your stuff. Parking is tricky in town, so you'll want to snag a spot in the designated parking lot down the block. The beach access is nice, although it was overcast and drizzly for most of the day I was here, so I didn't get to partake much. My one quibble is that the price is really high for what you get -- which is a small room -- and because it's an inn, they lack some of the amenities that the resorts offer. That's not a bad thing, but it doesn't really feel like the best value. Still, when I travel, I like to visit unique places, so I'd definitely spend a couple nights here again. Paia was my favorite town on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, great amenities, gorgeous property, superior staff”
Reviews.Author: Susan J
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 days in Maui; four nights in Lahaina (never again), three nights at the Paia Inn, three nights in Hana and our last night at Mamas Fish House. We wish our last night would have been back at the Paia Inn. We absolutely loved it there. The inn is amazing! Perfectly located on the island. Close to airport, not too far of a drive to Wailea and Lahaina, and a convenient trip to Hana. The town of Paia is super chill with friendly people, great shopping, beautiful beaches and excellent restaurants. The inn is top notch. Service is of highest quality, with a super friendly staff that genuinely cared about our comfort. It was very obvious that the staff loved their jobs and took pride in their establishment. Owners were there and were super helpful and friendly. Room was very spacious and comfortable with high end furnishings and fixtures. Very quiet and peaceful location! We can't wait to get back to Maui and will definitely be staying at the Paia Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stopover spot for a few days on way to Hana and beyond”
Reviews.Author: fitnfancy
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this spot! Clean and pretty rooms with just enough amenities, pleasant courtyard, close walking to wonderful shopping! Close to nearly deserted beaches too. I got outfitted with new swim suit, flipflops, excellent seafood dinner and yoga, all set for the rest of vacation. :)

Reviews.Title: “Tried hard but not quite up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Moezzz
Reviews.Content: Likewise as other recent reviewer, we stayed in room 9 (mini suite). Would love to give a great review as we really liked the people and they try very hard to make the stay wonderful. However have to agree with all that the other reviewer said - many areas not very clean, no counterspace in bathroom, terrible Internet connection, etc. Plus the cushions on the loungers by the beach were covered and stained with bird doo-doo and we needed a towel to cover them. On a positive note, liked the fact that it wasn't cookie-cutter style accommodations, had character, very comfy beds, very nice people, great location, nice touch to have towels and cold beverages down by the beach area. The omelette was delicious in the morning but would have liked to have our complimentary wine the night we checked in in a wine glass, not a plastic cup (small detail). Overall was a neat experience but rather pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, will be our lodging of choice when we return to Maui.”
Reviews.Author: Polar_Caver
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Maui, we did the Kaanapali resort experience the first part of the week and enjoyed that, but the human touch that this inn provided was what made the second half of our week. We had a junior suite with the town view. Super nice room with a great bed, a nice shower (with great hair care stuff) and an extra room to just hang out in (with pull-out). The street view would have been a bit much since it has it has street noises that accompany it, but they had thought ahead and had a sound machine in the room which was great. The private beach entrance and the chairs and boogie board, you could borrow, were great. We really enjoyed this Inn, the town and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect reflection of Paia Town”
Reviews.Author: Missmarthab
Reviews.Content: We actually own place on Hana Hwy - but stayed one night here before flying home...love love love it....we have recommended to people based on other peoples word and now know what they mean. Beautiful Tina, beautiful room, amazing beach, beautiful property, delicious breakfast, Great computer, lounge, reading room. Felt completely taken care of. Room decorated very nice. Bed super comfortable. Woke up to the smell of Flatbread pizza ovens warming...great place to eat btw...we love this area (obviously) and highly recommend to stay here...I know we will treat ourselves again! Try Fish Market accross street. Great shopping too! Sophia Grace for handmade jewelry. Visit the prayer wheel blessed by the Dalilama...

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: NWlivin
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel!! It was our favorite hotel during our stay. The staff was amazing and our room was magical. The beach was easy to get too and we had calm waters. Paia has the best food and atmosphere for our style and this place extended everything we loved about the city. It is a little expensive but after comparing to the other hotels, it was worth every penny. Our friends went after our trip and it was their favorite as well.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel in Paia, Maui, HI”
Reviews.Author: wisetrek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paia Inn for just one night on the way to Hana on Maui. This is a small boutique hotel that just sounded so quaint online that we decided to try it. We got their least expensive room because it was the cheapest, even though it looked quite small in the photo and the hotel itself suggested we might want to upgrade to a slightly larger room. But we figured for one night it didn't matter.....and it didn't! This little hotel was delightful! Paia is a tiny town known for its "hippie", laid back style, and is a tourist draw so it is always very crowded. That was true at the hotel also. I think they only have 6 rooms in total, and very little space to park in back so it is OK to park behind the person who got there before you, and you just give your keys to the person at the desk so they can move the cars around if need be. The room was small but just fine for the two of us. Tiny little bathroom, just big enough for a toilet and shower. Bed was probably just a double but fine for the two of us and VERY comfortable. Little touches everywhere, from the classy furnishings to the paintings on the walls everywhere. Tina, the beautiful young lady at the desk (in the back of the building, not the front) helped us with our bags and made us feel right at home. It is just a short walk out the back of the building down to the beach with its spectacular views of the north shore of Maui and we even saw a whale spout off in the distance. The next morning in the cute little patio out back, the good-looking chef cooked up a great spinach omelette for us before we hit the road for our two day trip to Hana. This hotel is not cheap, but nothing in Paia is cheap, so I would splurge a bit and try this out.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Exceeded”
Reviews.Author: kmh200886
Reviews.Content: The property is exactly as advertised. The staff are warm and helpful. Our room was truly wonderful, beautifully decorated and clean. My boyfriend loved the AppleTV! Breakfast was amazing. The beach was steps away from our room, down a little pathway. The ocean itself is a bit cold and wavy, so we didn't really get in (we waited until we arrive at the beaches in Kihei and Wailea for some real water time). A great base to do the road to Hana and beat the crowds. An abundance of great shops, terrific restaurants (don't miss Milagros, Cafe Mambo, Paia Fish Market and Flatbread Co.), excellent coffee shops (Paia Coffee Co. just West of PI had the best in town, and we tried all of them) and one of the best health food grocery stores I've ever been too (rivaling those in L.A.), Mana Foods. Paia is a charming Bohemian town and I highly recommend it. Would definitely split my time between here and one of the resorts in West our South Maui to get the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Chumlee1
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean, good size and nicely furnished. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Beach out the back was beautiful and town is very cool. A short drive to Mama's Fish House, a great place for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a lovely inn!”
Reviews.Author: pc_seattle
Reviews.Content: I was trepidatious initially, coming from the 4 seasons, to this little inn. However, once I arrived in the town of Paia, I was instantly set at ease! This place was amazing. So the downsides first: on a busy street (Hana Hwy), and next to a gas station, which inconveniently a gas odor will occasionally waft over to the hotel. The pros: adorable rooms, GREAT value, FREE/fast Internet (unlike the 4 Seasons I might add), a gorgeous beach with access to a long2-3 mile stretch of beach-- including the most beautiful turqouise waters and really fun/big waves for surfing/swimming etc. I'd say that Paia is more for the adventurous traveller. The town is a little hippy-ish meets wealth-- there is "lululemon" store just a few feet from perhaps the best organic/co-op grocery store I've been to. The restaurants have great fare-- lots of locally grown, organic health options at a good price. The breakfast at the hotel is delicious. In general, this is a great inn in a great town! Definitely would come back here, especially if traveling with people that like to hike/swim/surf. This is not the place for you if you want to lay on a beach chair and snap your fingers for a waiter to bring you chair-side cocktails, but if you love beautiful beaches, not too crowded or very developed town in a great-value cozy inn, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Here we go again and again and again!”
Reviews.Author: vancouvertamsin
Reviews.Content: We have, once again, booked at the Paia Inn in Maui...our little slice of paradise! My hubby and I were often on our own whiling away the hours basking in the sun and surf and reading our favourite books on the Inn's pristine private beach. The breakfast area is cute and cozy and the service extraordinary! The lovely energetic young ladies are a pleasure to deal with and the place is kept in immaculate condition. We honestly could not have asked for more! This will be our fourth visit with hopefully, many more to follow! If you are in season (the end of December was lucky for us) book the whale watching tour as it was absolutely spectacular...several humpbacks breached next to our boat and we saw calves and dolphins as well! Also, try Charley's (across from the hotel) great burgers and entertainment by local bands...we were extremely fortunate in spending New Year's Eve 2009 with Willie Nelson and his son Lukas...spent several hours grooving to the music...hardly able to believe how fortunate we were! We can hardly wait to return and this year, we are planning to learn how to surf!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lomarlomar
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic property in a fantastic town. If you don't mind small rooms the real value is in the petite room. It's tiny but all you'll be doing in there is sleeping and showering.

Reviews.Title: “One "Hip Hotel"!”
Reviews.Author: TexCin51
Reviews.Content: I booked all of our activities and accommodations totally using Trip Advisor as my guide. The reviews for the Paia Inn were excellent so we decided to spend our last two days in Maui at the Inn. When we drove up looking for a place to park we were greeted by the owner, Michael. He showed us where to park and walked us in to the lobby. That was the tone for our entire stay. I have never experienced customer service that the staff at the Inn provides. Nina, Tina and Carly were all so cheerful, helpful and fabulous ambassadors for Maui. We were a bit â€œneedyâ€� a few times and within moments these wonderful ladies took care of us. The Inn itself is an adorable boutique hotel. We had a garden room that was beautiful. The room was small but the furnishing and art work are extremely nice and we never felt closed in at all. We loved drinking coffee while sitting in the garden area by our room. You have great restaurants, shopping and a great beach to watch the surfers at all within strolling distance. If you need an umbrellaâ€¦they offer it...and wineâ€¦and coffeeâ€¦driving instructionsâ€¦.This hip hotel is full of Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Best experience...ever”
Reviews.Author: brooklynboogie
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough wonderful things about the Paia Inn. My wife and I stayed from Christmas Eve to New Years Eve in the 1BR guest house. The guest house is about a 5-10 min walk from the hotel. It felt so luxurious to have an entire house to ourselves. We used the private backyard, the hot tub and the grill. In fact, when we first tried to use the grill we noticed it was dirty and had no propane. When I called the front desk, they apologized and sent a couple guys over. I thought they might come clean it but they brought over a brand new propane grill! The breakfasts were fantastic, the service was impeccable, and the accommodations were perfect. Oh, and they have their own private beach, which we visited every day. When we left, we forgot our cell phone near the beach. I emailed the front desk from the airplane, and they looked for it, found it, and said they'd ship it to me. I'd recommend Paia Inn to any and all people considering going to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem on Maui's North Shore”
Reviews.Author: WDTVancouver_Canada
Reviews.Content: My teen-aged daughter's first words when we walked into our room were "this is the coolest hotel I have ever been in". Our stay at the Paia Inn got better from there. The rooms were clean, well furnished, and charming. Our suite included a small kitchen, and enclosed lanai. When we booked the room, we asked for a "garden view" room. In my experience, garden view rooms usually mean you have a window or door that looks out onto small garden used by everyone in the hotel. We were most pleasantly surprised to find that our garden view actually looked out onto our own private garden complete with picnic table, chairs and banana trees. We were invited to help ourselves to the banana's if they were ripe. The hotel lobby and a few rooms are in a two story building that fronts on Paia's main street. The majority of the rooms and suites are located in what appeared to be converted dwellings that stretched back from the lobby to the beach. At the very back, overlooking the beach, is a 3 bedroom beach house. The hotel has a private beach access (the beach itself, is public) that runs the length of the property, surrounded by high wooden fences and bamboo. Beach chairs, towels, water and boogie boards are provided for hotel guests at no extra charge. Granted, the weather on Maui's north shore tends to be cooler, windier and a tad wetter than in the tourist oriented areas of Wailea and Makeena, but this is more than compensated by Paia's proximity to the Hana Highway, Ho'okipa beach, the uplands area or Maui, and the airport. Even better, one is in the middle of Paia and its charming shops. The Paia Inn does not have a restaurant of its own, but some of Maui's best restaurants are a few minutes walk from the hotel. For the units with a kitchen, the local grocery store has some of the best prices of any grocery store on Maui, as well as fresh baked pasties each morning. The bedrooms of our suite were a little on the small side, and it required some thought to store our clothes and suitcases such that we were not tripping over them. However, this is a minor quibble. The Paia Inn, as charming as it is, may not be to everyone's liking. If you go on holidays expecting your rooms to be utterly posh, with room service, fully stocked bar and every conceivable amenity within arm's reach at any given moment, you best try one of the resorts at Wailea. (I am not being cynical with this comment, as I have friends who will quite openly state such expectations of an hotel.) On the other hand, if you like something a little different, and your activities in Hawaii will consist of more than lying by a pool frying yourself, you cannot do much better than this hotel. One further word, the service is incredible. To a person, the staff at the Paia Inn are friendly, helpful, efficient and obviously take pride in their work. I have stayed at hotels all over the world, including many famous, top rated hotels and resorts, and can say without reservation that the service at the Paia Inn is absolutely world class.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SheIsKelsey
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel! My husband and I have stayed here twice now, and every time we go back to Maui we will stay here. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The beach is a very short walk away, and the breakfasts are delicious! The staff is always accommodating and will do everything to make your stay better. The one downside is that the parking can be kind of scarce, but the staff are very helpful telling you all the different parking options. I highly recommend it! Worth every penny! And make sure to visit Anthony's coffee across the street and the Flatbread pizza restaurant a couple doors down!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Pexster
Reviews.Content: There is only one other comparable property on the North Shore -- The Inn at Mama's Fish House. They are both great, fairly equal in price, both offer outstanding service and a genuine aloha spirit. I would stay at either in a split-second . . . BUT Mama's is several miles out of the town center, and at the Paia Inn, you don't even need a car to walk to breakfast, lunch, dinner, gelato, the beach, etc. AND one of the nicest front desk and back office support staffs you will ever meet. (Not to mention the owner!) Personally, I love Flatbread, the Fish Market, Moana Cafe, and actually EVERYONE in Paia so much that this is a "no-brainer." Go there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, friendly and hip.”
Reviews.Author: 1951Rob
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here, but would have enjoyed staying longer. Only concern for us was the Murphy's oil cleaner on the wood floor which made a sticky and sandy surface for us to walk on with our bare feet, especially after visiting the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Truly magical”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the wonderful courtyard of the Inn and were greeted with such a warm welcome we new we had found something special. The staff, especially Nina and Tina treated us like family. Our suite was amazingly unique and comfortable. The suite had an open air bathroom and every morning we would wake up to find fresh Plumeria flowers that had fallen from the trees onto the floor. Steps to the beach, shops and restaurants made it a perfect location. Definitely the place to be if you want to avoid the hustle and bustle of the typical resort scene and experience the true aloha spirit in authentic Hawaiian style. We had a chance to spend time with the owner, Michael, and found him to be completely charming and an amazing tour guide.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: sjw125
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at this hotel so that we would not have to drive the road to Hana after a very early morning drive to the airport and a long flight. I found it on Expedia and expected just a very ordinary hotel. When we arrived, they showed us some wonderful, large suites. We picked one with its own courtyard, where we sat until late at night under an almost-full moon. Note that the suites do not show up on Expedia, and they are incredible bargains, at just $50 more than the regular rooms. The staff could not have been nicer. They treat you like family. The town is delightful, like no town we've been to in Hawaii. There's nothing fancy, but cute little restaurants and an amazing grocery store, where we bought dinner to have in our courtyard. It seemed like we had gone back to 1950's Hawaii. There's a small semi-private beach that was beautiful. Next year we will spend 3 nights here before going out to Hana. My wife was not happy packing up our bags the next morning after just one night in such a wonderful hotel. Oh, and the breakfast cooked to order at the hotel must be well-known around town. You would not know it was there from the street, but people kept coming in who were not hotel guests. It was one of the best omelettes we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “The Paia Inn is incredible!”
Reviews.Author: BGMandJAM
Reviews.Content: Outstanding rooms and service. The staff was simply the best we have ever encountered. Paia is a great little town to relax in and call home during a vacation on Maui. Central location, great restaurants and shops, and just far enough off the beaten path. This is the place to stay if want to experience what the real Maui is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoser_71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the first couple of days after arriving in Maui. We arrived late, but they had a note on the door and called us to let us know that their night manager would let us in. The facility is a small, hip hotel right on the beach in Paia. The people working there were extremely helpful and gave us some great recommendations. The whole place is laid out to be helpful. There are tips and advice throughout their grounds. They have their own maps and sightseeing guides for Hana and the area, and beach gear to use. They even offered to let us use their cooler, towel's, and chairs for our trip to Hana even though we had checked out. We had a small room that was very clean and in great shape. It's basically a hut and kind of small, but I found it just the right size and put together well.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish place + Great staff”
Reviews.Author: victorb134
Reviews.Content: The Paiai Inn is a stylish remodel right in the middle of Paiai. It has an inviting and appealing vibe to it. The beds are fantastic - super comfortable. The rooms have exactly what you need. And the staff is super friendly and helpful. Morning breakfasts were really enjoyable with food made to order by a chef who takes tremendous pride in his work. You can always tell when the owner of a property has a tremendous eye for detail and it shows in this place. The only downside, which is also an upside, is that it is right on the main strip in Paiai, which means traffic can be loud on Friday and Saturday nights - wasn't a big deal to us, they have those nature-sounds machines in the room, but it's something to be aware of. Of course, the flip side is that the fantastic "Flatbread Company" is a 20 second walk :-) Any future trips to Maui will undoubtedly include the Paiai Inn.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: mgatl75
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for part of our honeymoon!! It was fantastic. The staff is wonderful and the location is great. We stayed in #9, a garden room, and loved it. It has a full kitchen, but the only downfall was the ac was not great. I highly recommend Paia Inn Hotel, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: PinkHydrangea
Reviews.Content: We had an incredible stay at the Pa'ia Inn. It was exactly what we were looking for: charming, romantic, boutique-hotel feel, at the water's edge, and in a great town with lots of places within walking distance to eat. When we booked our trip to Hawaii, we wanted to find a place slightly off the beaten track and not in the main resort areas. Pa'ia Inn satisfied all of these prerequisites. A few things really stood out: 1) the service: when we arrived, we were greeted by Tina, who helped us throughout the rest of the stay. Tina's service went above-and-beyond multiple times to ensure our comfort. 2) Breakfasts and the dining area: the Inn has an adorable, small, enclosed patio that is perfect for breakfast or an evening drink. They also have a chef (Situs) on-site who will whip up delicious, tropical concoctions for breakfast (not included in the room price, but well worth having a few times...or every day, in our case). The omelettes and pancakes were our favorites. 3) The rooms...choose one with an outdoor shower! 4) Location: both the town of Pa'ia, the slightly-more rugged coast, and the access to great hikes along the Road to Hana made it very attractive to us. We would definitely return again! If you are looking for something a little different than the big hotel/resort/Wailea experience, check out Pa'ia Inn in Pa'ia. There's a reason it's TripAdvisor rating is so high!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paia Inn Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnthegoGram
Reviews.Content: Paia Inn Hotel is a perfect little gem in a cute surfer town on Maui. We booked the Junior Suite, room 9, and it had a cute, private lanai entry, large living/bedroom area and full kitchen with appliances as well as the bathroom. Hairdryer, ear plugs and great soap, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion were supplied. Beach bag with beach towels, lots of beach equipment for your usage and a great little beach too - the amenities were all great. There is a cute courtyard for breakfast (which isn't included in the price of the room), with a chef there preparing your order. Complimentary coffee and tea are available all day. The staff was always very friendly and willing to help in any way. Management responded quickly to any issue that arose; they care about their guests' comfort. Quiet, charming and with a wonderful staff - Paia Inn is a real find on Maui and about 4 miles from the airport on Hana Hwy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Babymoon/7th anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Erin M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paia Inn for our babymoon, in room 6. The room was perfect in every way, from a small kitchen where we ate fruit & cheese to save money, to a small lounge area outside the bedroom, to a great travertine shower. The staff was incredible as well, making sure we had everything we needed and not minding when I took handfuls of chocolate from the front desk :) The snorkel trip they booked us on was great as well - very personal, with good food and not overcrowded. We even got to sail! Breakfast at the Inn was really good - I usually had fruit and yogurt or a Belgian waffle, and my husband had eggs with sauteed veggies. Both of us would down a glass of delicious fresh squeezed OJ, too. If you are looking to avoid the impersonal resort experience, Paia Inn is for you!

Reviews.Title: “total relaxation in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DLiz
Reviews.Content: Paia is the perfect location on Maui in terms of accessing so many great places to visit; Haleakala, Hana, Makawao and Paia itself. (and only 10 minutes from the airport) The Paia Inn was truly a highlight of our vacation. We loved our room...our own lanai to relax on every night, sounds of birds chirping, swaying palms, a waterfall and the ocean surf in the background. Great beach access as well as fun, inexpensive restaurants all in walking distance. Mama's Fish House is a short drive away and another Maui highlight. The staff at the inn was great from the moment we booked our room until the moment we drove away. Breakfasts in the courtyard were outstanding...great coffee, delicious omelettes and fruit, beautiful presentation.This is a lovely spot. We would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Katelyn P
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing! We had an amazing time and loved everything about the Paia Inn! It was in a perfect location to see Maui. We felt like we were right in the middle of the island so we could drive to the west side of the island easily and also were really close to the road to Hana. The beach was perfect; nice waves, not crowded at all, and absolutely beautiful! All of the staff was nothing but wonderful, they were friendly and were always willing to help you at any time. The courtyard was a great place to have a drink at night or for breakfast! I would recommend this to any couple!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: tysoncl
Reviews.Content: Paia Inn is charming in a funky way. The hostess was lovely. Our room was clean although the towels had stains. The room was large and the furniture was adequate. The air conditioner did not work very well. The bathroom is small and motel like. Outdoor furniture is worn, especially the chairs. The beach is lovely and the hotel has a direct path to it. But if you are elderly or fragile, the path is slippery with no bannister. All of this is fine, except the price was too high for what was offered. We paid over $200 and that is not a funky price.

Reviews.Title: “The Aloha Spirit is Alive at the Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: Aloverofgoldens
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we knew we had made the perfect choice by staying at the Paia Inn. Our room was spacious, comfortable, and a short walk to a beautiful private beach -- close enough to hear the sounds of the crashing surf! More importantly, it was the people behind the Inn that made our visit so memorable. Nina, Tina, Carly and the rest of the staff were wonderful -- offering suggestions, giving directions, making "killer" breakfasts, and more.They even set up a surfing lesson for us, which was the most fun we had on our entire vacation. Thank you Kiva Rivers! Paia is a great location offering fun shopping, a range of restaurant options, centrally located for traveling the Road to Hana, visiting Haleakala Crater, and close to the airport. If you are looking for a resort hotel experience, this may not be the place for you. But, if you want personalized service and a feeling of being part of the community this is it. Maui is a beautiful island to visit and we look forward to traveling there again, due in part to our stay and experiences at the Paia Inn.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Andrea M
Reviews.Content: when we arrived we got an upgrade & one of the "small" but wonderful gardenroom with nearly everything we needed (could have used more space for our equipment). the staff was allways friendly & helpful, the free internet useful, free coffee, muffins & fruits great as was the breakfast. paia inn is very centrally located, but because of the constant wind we luckily didn't hear a lot of street noise. the beach is very close, the beach amenities like chairs, bodyboards & cold drinks just super. we can really recommend that place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Yoga on the beach at sunrise”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to see our life long dream of yoga on the beach at sunrise turned into a reality with the help of the Paia Inn team. They just got it. Under the leadership of Dominique, our glorious Haiku based yogi, we were able to take our dream to an unheard of level. As we flowed from pose to pose, with heightened senses reveling in the luxurious texture of the sand underfoot and the sound of the surf breaking at our side, nature crowned our experience with a gentle misting followed by a glorious rainbow. The road to Hana has never seeing such smiling faces.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of nice features and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Recoveringlawyer
Reviews.Content: Great location, private beach access and private garden area. Room was attractive, with nice furnishings and a fridge(if you slide the honor bar stuff around a bit). Stayed in room 15. If you are heading to Hana, stay here the night before and you'll get a good start on the drive without getting up at crack of dawn.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but still a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: I really REALLY didn't want to write a negative review. The staff at the Paia Inn truly are friendly and helpful, and did their best to be kind and helpful. But I feel I should offer a bit of balance since the other reviews, which we relied on to decide on the Paia, now seem overly gushing in their praise. First for a few of the other positives (in addition to the great staff), which are undeniable. The Inn is nicely located in a small town on the North Shore of Maui. Through the rear of the property it is possible to reach the beach, and most visitors will rightly appreciate this. We were given a suite on the ground floor behind the main building, which was quiet and pleasant. The furnishings are comfy and modern. What's not to love? Unfortunately, we found the rooms to be rather cramped or poorly laid out even in our otherwise large suite. Not really a big deal, but for the high price ($360/night), I think we should expect not to bark are shins getting in and out of bed. This was a minor problem in truth, however. Most regrettably of all, I must report that the rooms were not as clean as they ought to have been. We like to walk barefoot, but the floors were in need of a good scrub and our feet became dirty walking about the kitchen area. There was sand -- beach sand to be sure, but not just a little in our shower when we checked in. The shower could not have been properly cleaned beforehand and it wasn't while we were there either. Overall, this wasn't a disaster. If you stay at the Paia you will be happy, but you might spend a good deal less for something just as suitable and cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet, chill, comfortable, lovely”
Reviews.Author: Matthew Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights for our honeymoon, and loved it. The people who run the hotel were super-nice, very helpful (they booked us an amazing massage and gave us great recommendations for places to go that were not in our guide book, all of them terrific), and it was the perfect place to check out all the amazing parts of Maui, from the road to Hana to the little towns in Upcountry to the Haleakala crater, and also close enough to all the amazing beaches on the West and South sides of the island. We stayed in one of the suites which was very affordable and also had a kitchen so we could occasionally cook. Paia is a great town, with Mana Foods and the Paia Fish Market restaurant where we ate just about every night, it's also close to Mama's Fish House (great view but a little overrated) and the totally NOT overrated Haliimaile General Store. If you are looking for the classic beach vacation in Maui we suggest you do that but also stay at least a couple of nights here, it's really a much more interesting and amazing experience, plus the little beach they have behind the hotel is gorgeous and intimate! Oh, and the breakfast is wonderful, whoever wrote that the food was bad is crazy, they cook it right in front of you and it's very well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn was our first stop in Hawaii and ended up being our favorite. The staff was wonderful and the little town was awesome. Recommended for anyone who wants get away from the "big city" and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great for honeymoon and couples”
Reviews.Author: Listenupsucka
Reviews.Content: Dumb luck and a friend led us to this fabulous place. We wanted to go to Maui to relax and hang out without being around the resort crowd or tons of kids or teenagers. We were not disappointed. No pool, pa or butler service, but this is what we wanted. Peace and comfort. Paia Inn and Paia itself are special places. Two days into our week stay, we decided we'd be back to Paia Inn. I selfishly don't want this place to get too popular, soooo, ignore this review :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Klovestravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Paia Inn on our island-hopping honeymoon in Hawaii. Honestly, after our stay in Paia we reconsidered moving on to Kauai. The Inn was charming, laid-back (yet stylish), and so much more our style than the big, impersonal resorts. We loved it. We cannot say enough about the staff. They were exceptionally helpful and friendly. Tina showed us around when we arrived and gave us excellent recommendations for stops along the Hana Highway. Please heed her advice and try the banana bread at Aunty Sandy's on the Ke'anae Peninsula - amazing! She also pointed us toward awesome, local spots (the flatbread pizza was yummy). By far the friendliest staff of any of the hotels we visited on this trip. Our room was perfectly appointed and we loved the little garden patio. The room had a "zen" feel and was a calming respite after a day at the beach. We appreciated the small touches - such as eco-friendly products and a hand written note upon our arrival. Overall, our stay at the Inn was the highlight of our honeymoon. If you're looking for a mega-resort experience with multiple pools and restaurants, this isn't your place. If you want a cool, laid-back vibe with lots of personal touches, we highly recommend it. We're already planning a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little inn”
Reviews.Author: Inspectorj
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Paia Inn and wish we could have changed the trip around to stay longer! This was my first trip to Maui (wife was there 15 years ago). We were going for a family vacation in Kaanapali and decided to arrive on the island a few days early for some alone time before everyone else came in. We arrived in Maui on a Friday and went straight to Paia. We did one night in Paia and then drove to Hana for two nights at the Hotel Hana, then to Honua Kai in Ka'anapali for a week with the family. I'll get reviews of the other places up soon. The Paia Inn Hotel is 100% my type of place. It's chill and relaxed. The staff was super friendly (more so than the other places we stayed). The vibe is pretty much the opposite of those big crowded resorts. Our room (a Junior Suite Garden View) was perfect - bigger than a couple needs with a super comfy bed, a kitchen, a nice sitting area and a somewhat small bathroom. The beach is a 2 minute walk and the hotel provides beach toys for free and a cooler near the beach with free juice and water. There's no pool, but again, the beach is right there. Did I already say how helpful the staff is? They helped us get situated in Paia, plan our trip to Hana, and give us ideas for other things to do during the week. And the other thing is that you get to stay in Paia. It's a great little town (2 blocks really) to walk around, with a few good restaurants, a nice beach and easy access to Haleakala.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place and awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: mybeau
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night, but we wanted to stay longer. The staff was so friendly, nice and helpful. Enjoyed a nice room upgrade! We would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Cute rooms but expensive, noisey & breakfast was a joke”
Reviews.Author: nojakeno
Reviews.Content: The rooms and staff were all cute & friendly but the noise level was awful even with ear plugs that they provide. The breakfast was all Costco - nothing fresh - only the coffee was good; fruit so-so. I'd go to the hippie market to get awesome breakfast burritos to bring back. Someone was onsite making omelets but they weren't worth the price when again, you could go to the market & buy something better tasting for less. The smoothie was very expensive & watery. If you are young & into the hippie scene, this is the place for you but otherwise, you won't get much of the flavor of Hawaii. Plus, WiFi was next to non-existent & couldn't print from the computer provided for guests.

Reviews.Title: “The most charming place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: jessieapple
Reviews.Content: We loved loved loved it here! I have told everyone if they ever found I have runaway, they can find me at the Paia Inn. It is decorated beautifully and has so much character. We had a room with a front lanai with lots of foliage and cute bench seating. I took a ton of pictures of just the inn!! If you do not want to stay at resorts and want a break from the Maui beach scene, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and friendly”
Reviews.Author: CliftonCampers
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable couple of nights at the Paia Inn. The staff are fantastically friendly and the rooms have everything you need. Unfortunately our room wasn't particualrly clean when we arrived and there was still used coffee in the cafetiere from the previous guests. Apart from that we would recommend Paia and the Paia Inn for a couple of nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we'd booked more than one night.”
Reviews.Author: iheartdorks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paia Inn on our first night in Maui - we choose it for it proximity to the airport and as a good starting point. We were exhausted when we arrived and greeted by the sweet staff with a beer, an upgrade and a plush, cozy inviting bed. We were allowed to leave our luggage there and access the beach and amenities after checkout. We had a lovely 2 week vacation in Maui but no accomidations compared to this lovely inn!

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic little bed-and-breakfast with a great atmosphere in a great part of Maui”
Reviews.Author: ansonj
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Paia Inn now twice, and both times it's been welcoming, fun, and located in a fantastic part of Maui. The Fish Market is right across the street (mmmm, fish tacos!) and a beautiful beach is right behind it. The rooms are comfortable, and the decor is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “The real Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Dancingdoll14
Reviews.Content: Paia inn is conveniently located in the heart of a small beach town which mostly consists of locals. I loved that the area wasn't jam packed with tourists and commercial hotels. Our room was lovely; very private and peaceful! There is a nice beach right behind the inn, though it does tend to get a bit windy in the late morning/afternoon. If you don't mind walking, there are a couple more beaches to the left of the inn including baby beach (Practically a swimming pool!) There is a nice breakfast every morning (muffins, juice, fruit, etc.) which is good but not very filling. The staff is really helpful and quite cheerful as well! Paia inn was a great find and we will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “great inn!!”
Reviews.Author: torywoods
Reviews.Content: awesome inn in a great location. rooms were clean and cozy and the staff was incredible. access to the beach was nice and there is plenty to do in walking distance. I definitely recommend the Paia Inn to anyone and I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Paia Inn...what to say...simply THE best place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: LHutton
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paia Inn for a few nights during our honeymoon on Maui, having travelled up from Hana and on our way to Lahaina. Paia itself was fantastic, but Paia Inn has really stayed with us. Why? - The personable and friendly staff on arrival who went above and beyond to make us feel welcome - The style of the inn: as far as 'boutique hotels' go, this place is way up there. The rooms are modern and welcoming, the beds comfy, the bathrooms high-end...right down to the living space in the upstairs of the main hotel which is for use by guests and comes complete with internet access, books, games and aftersun) - The location is perfect for exploring Paia, and is right opposite Anthony's Coffee House (an absolute must visit, the coffee and food is great) and lots of boutiques to nose around - The hotel's beach access... Paia provides towels and sun loungers for guests and the stretch of beach accessible from the hotel is just stunning and perfect for lazing on the beach, taking a dip in the water, or just watching the surfers - Breakfast...most important meal of the day and Paia Inn's doesn't disappoint. Sitting outside in the glorious sunshine, the breakfast was delicious (I had my first ever waffles there) and the fruit smoothies were so fresh. We also met the owner on the last day who was just as welcoming and hospitable as his staff, helping us to get our luggage to the car ready to head to our next stop. Completely can't fault anything about Paia Inn, and we fell in love with Paia as a beach town. Some of our fondest honeymoon memories are there. We can whole heartedly recommend this place. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service great location!”
Reviews.Author: drw3910
Reviews.Content: we were on our babymoon and ended our trip in Paia. We arrived to the most welcoming staff at the hotel, the owner and front desk gal even carried our luggage up stairs. The room was a bit smal but so beautifully decorated and updated it made up for it. No window in the main room but in the bath without any type of view, we found the air conditioning was nice for sleeping. The hotel owns all the properties from town to the beach so you get the best of both worlds. Continental breakfast was great, local pastries, instant oatmeal, fruit and tea. Highly recommend this beautiful modern hotel, we will be back to rent the beach house with our new baby!

Reviews.Title: “Loved loved loved the Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: newlywednyc
Reviews.Content: I have never had such wonderful staff at a hotel. They remembered our names, which I thought was really cool. They greeted us whenever we returned, were quick to answer any questions and offered great suggestions for things to do in town. They even have a Paia Inn guide for the road to Hana. Also - if the Times reviewed it, you know it must be good http://travel.nytimes.com/2009/05/24/travel/24checkin.html. Even so, I was skeptical before we booked it since it looked like there were power lines in the picture, but that's just part of the town and part of Maui - I guess you have to get power somehow! The only weird thing about the location was that is was right next to a gas station, but it didn't matter at all - you're in the heart of Paia. It's a PERFECT location for shopping and eating in Paia and for going on the road to Hana. They have easy beach access and chairs and bogie boards for guests to use. The only thing I missed was a pool, but we stayed for two nights and spent the rest of our trip at a large resort on the west side of Maui, so I got my pool time there. The beach is great and swimable. We stayed in a standard room and it was small, but sufficient. You don't spend much time in your room and there is great communal space. I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in every way”
Reviews.Author: ErinolaLA
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Paia Inn. It has a lovely, relaxed, comfortable feel; friendly and welcoming staff; a tasty breakfast in the courtyard; a terrific location and clean, easy-to-be-in rooms. And the beach access! We spent lots of time on that little crescent of sand and water building castles, splashing in the waves, exploring tidepools. Mahalo, PI. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: evilred
Reviews.Content: To be close to the airport we spent our last night on maui at the Paia Inn. The staff,(sounds way to formal for the Paia)showed us around, the patio,the rooms(we stayed in room 9 beautiful) the yard,the beach all are fabulous.The town is great for walking and eating.We have already decided to return and stay at the paia Inn the entire time.The pictures on the website don't really do justice to the experience.Very convenient for visits upcountry,road to Hana,Haleakala.No airport noise.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed by Paia: authentic town, cool accomadations, laid back beach”
Reviews.Author: Nycnora
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn far exceeded our expectations. We had a sweet room with an entrance draped in vines just a few steps from the beach (via a private path just for Inn guests). One of the best things about Paia is the food options (especially compared to other towns like Hana). Just next door to the Paia Inn is the excellent Flatbread Pizza Kitchen (organic, local produce, super fresh veggie-loaded salads). Down the road from the Inn is the health food wonderland of Mana Foods, which has all you need to create a delicious picnic lunch. Tip: skip the overpriced, mediocre Mama's Fish House and stay in Paia for your meals. On the weekends the Paia Inn has a chef who will make you an omlette, pancakes, or waffles to order...Enjoyable al fresco on the Inn's lovely patio. All in all - if you want to feel less like a tourist and more like a local, the Paia Inn is your spot!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Way to Escape the Resorts”
Reviews.Author: Missoulagirl73
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui and, frankly, our expectations were not incredibly high. I was under the unfortunate misapprehension that all of Maui would be really commercialized and touristy. Then we came to Paia and the Paia Inn. It was a completely heavenly oasis far from the mega-resorts and the thousands of tourists who fill the mega-resorts. The super secret pathway to a basically deserted beach was wonderful. Then the staff upgraded us to a gorgeous "junior suite" with a perfect little patio, spacious kitchen (with full-size refrigerator), and incredibly comfortable king size bed. I think I slept for 10 hours the first night. The staff was very friendly and laid back. The location is great too-- an easy walk to fabulous restaurants (Flatbread and the Fish Market were huge hits with us) and a quick drive to the beautiful up-country. Could not have asked for more. And we loved Paia and the Paia Inn even more after the second leg of our trip included 2 nights in Wailea. All we wanted to do was go back to Paia.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable staff, good value, beach access, w/ friendly locals”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKevin88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for our 2nd aniversary and had a wonderful time. I found this place thanks to tripadvisor. Only 15 mins from the airport. Staff was great, extremely happy, and seemed geniune, maybe because they get to live in Hawaii. They provide a continental breakfast that you can eat at their outside patio. You can buy a special breakfast on the wknds, that was delicous. Their own beach access made it great, plus they provide anything you could imagine for use at the beach including chairs, bugie boards, snorkel gear, & I even saw sun tan lotion. Rooms are a little tight, but clean, and you're not going to Hawaii to hang out in the room during the day. They had a computer in the common area available. Gave us a glass of wine for our aniversary. Made great food reccomendations. Free parking. You can drive to all the big touristy areas. In a great little town that you can walk to shops, bars, and restuarants. Not a big nightlife scene, but good crowds at happy hour w/ nice deals around town. For food, go to the Paia Fish Market across the street, amazing fish sandwhiches or the little sandwhich shop connected to the hotel. Only slight negative, is it can get a little warm in the rooms upstairs at night. Great place and value. If I ever make it back to Maui, we'll be staying at the Paia Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff Make Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: porsche74s
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights. Enjoyed the town although it can be a little crowded and the traffic on 36 is pretty heavy at times. The best thing about the Paia Inn is the staff, who do anything possible to make your stay a pleasant one. We especially liked Carly, who was charming and attentive each contact we had with her. The Inn consists of several buildings, older construction but nicely renovated, and our room was a little small due to the age of the buildings. In Paia you don't spend that much time in the room, so it really doesn't matter. The restaurants in town are good, particularly the Fish Market which is across the street and down a block. There are quite a few locally owned stores so shopping is good and the merchandise is generally high quality. If we stayed again we'd rent one of the larger rooms which are available at the Inn. In a word, Paia Inn is charming.

Reviews.Title: “Casual elegance and charm make this boutique hotel a MUST stay in the trendy town of Paia”
Reviews.Author: owehay2
Reviews.Content: Can't get much closer to paradise than the island of Maui and the Paia Inn surpassed all our expectations of capturing our lil piece of paradise while staying at this small, quaint boutique hotel. There is a charm about the town and the Paia Inn that is hard to capture in pictures or by words alone. I don't like to be over dramatic but all I can say is that I'm dreaming of the day we get to go back to experience this lovely place all over again! My highest compliments to the owner and staff at the Paia Inn!

Reviews.Title: “A delight”
Reviews.Author: OpAPI
Reviews.Content: It's the opposite of a resort, but that's what is nice about it. Clean but smallish rooms. Very friendly and professional staff. No restaurant but that's OK - there are lots of options in Paia. Steps from a secluded pristine beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CalGirl435
Reviews.Content: We really like the Paia Inn. The design and decor and landscaping were extremely well done. Loved the two courtyards and the small nook/patio outside our room. Loved that the neighborhood cat greeted us every evening! The location is perfect if you want to avoid feeling like you're in a "tourist ghetto". The staff was very nice and responsive. There are several fantastic restaurants nearby and a killer grocery store. The hotel has coolers you can borrow so you can gets snacks and drinks and bring them to the beach! Rooms were comfortable, a little small but well laid-out. Only drawback of staying here is that it seems like the weather is better on other parts of the island. Paia was a bit windy and overcast when other parts of the island were sunny.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: tripadvice2011
Reviews.Content: Imagine European charm in paradise; you have found it at the Paia Inn!! It lived up to everything I researched and more! The only place to stay on Maui!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: South_Pacific_Seas
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Maui from Oahu for a personal business trip. I had a meeting upcountry- Makawao on Friday afternoon and flew in from Oahu. The Paia Inn was a very short drive from the airport and then a short drive to Makawao. I have never stayed here but knew it would be different when I checked in. We were greeted with Aloha and escorted to our room. We were shown the grounds, the trail to the beach (which we did not have time to enjoy on this trip) and were told of the hotel's amenities. After our meeting in Makawao we came back to enjoy dinner at the Flatbread Company and then watch the Merrie Monarch in the sitting room of our cityview junior suite. The bed was very comfortable and the room gave us plenty of space. We enjoyed breakfast in the courtyard the next morning and talking with guests and the owner. They pay attention to detail and all of the employees are looking after the interests of the guests. We were able to see some of the garden cottages and made a promise to be back. I am partial to the north shore and upcountry areas of Maui and the Paia Inn has a great location, great people and will make you feel at home (with someone else taking care of you). I recommend it for anyone that wants to see the less crowded side of Maui. Personally, A Hui Hou.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paia and the Inn was great”
Reviews.Author: Bostontravels
Reviews.Content: We really loved this place. After almost two week in big resorts, we wanted our last few nights in Hawaii to be more low key. The Paia Inn had a great stretch of beach, a great location and great staff. We stayed in the 3 bedroom suite with kitchen, living/dining room and large verandah. It was a huge amount of space though before checking in I hadn't realized there was no air conditioning. I thought I'd miss it, but the air cooled down every night and sleeping was great. The kids missed having a pool but appreciated the excellent gelato at Penguini and at Ono Gelato. We all loved the food at Flatbread Pizza and Mama's Beach House. The Paia Fish Market was also great. We spent most of our down time on the verandah so we didn't have much contact with the staff, but every time we saw them, they were helpful and very friendly. If you stayed in the front building, you'd probably see them a lot more. The little courtyard off the reception area was a shaded, cool place to grab some coffee or a drink. Paia is a kick, a fun town where we probably saw more locals in two days than we had in the previous two weeks. We ziplined on the island and went up to Makawao (another fun, eclectic town) and just hung out. The beach was beautiful and the water was mostly calm while we were there. I'd like to say we did a lot at the end of the trip, but we mostly just enjoyed the vibe and relaxed. I'd especially recommend the Paia Inn as a great place to start or end a vacation as we left at 3:15 for our 5pm flight and were able to drop off our car, check in and get to our gate in 45 minutes, hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible customer service”
Reviews.Author: DavidLPortland
Reviews.Content: The inn includes several different structures, the rooms in which vary a good deal. We had a room in the "historic" section of the hotel which ultimately meant that the room was not a good fit for our needs. Once the hotel staff learned about these concerns, their response was amazing. They did not just do everything they could to address those concerns, they went far beyond anything I have ever expererienced in terms of wanting to make up for any discomfort we experienced (including comping our entire stay). I travel more than 150 days a year, and have done so for 20+ years, and have never experienced more commitment to customer service and customer satisfaction than the staff, and the owner, of this property demonstrated. Truly impressive. The lesson here is that if you have ANY concerns -- tell them, and they will move heaven an earth to resolve those concerns to a level that exceeds any reasonable expectation.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: UKexpatNewYork
Reviews.Content: First a quick word about Paia which is a quiet little surf town about 5 miles from the aiport, which makes it convenient for pretty much anywhere else on Maui. Unlike Lahaina and Kihei, there are no high-rise hotel blocks and no tacky souvenir shops, so if that is your thing stay elsewhere. If, like us, you hate over-commercialisation and over-development, Paia could be a good bet for you. It's very small (you can walk everywhere), there are some good local restaurants and upscale art and clothing stores and everyone is very friendly. Paia Inn Hotel is a small boutique hotel with beautifully decorated rooms, private access to the beach and very happy, helpful staff. We were comped one night because we had no hot water for about 24 hours, and the owner himself came to apologise. The room (14) was in a small separate building shared with one other room. The bathroom was partially outside with a roof and thick foliage for privacy, and the bedroom was small but very nicely furnished and decorated. The hotel is right on the Hana Highway in the centre of town, but traffic pretty much died away at night so we weren't disturbed by the road noise.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place on the island”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl91030
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Maui with my niece, 27 and daughter, 16 and we stayed in Bungalow 7. It was the perfect spot for us. We enjoyed the privacy of our bungalow, the private beach and the location of the inn- we could walk to everything! The staff was amazing, especially Tina and our chef, the beds were comfy and the amenities great. We started and ended our vacation here, and after traveling around Maui for ten days, the Paia Inn turned out to be our favorite place on the lsland! We really relaxed and enjoyed our down time. We will be back next year for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Paia Inn - Paradise away from the resorts and business of Maui”
Reviews.Author: HMcT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take our "babymoon" on Maui but we didn't want to stay in a resort area with thousands of other people. At 7 months pregnant, comfort and relaxation was key in choosing a place to stay. We chose Paia Inn because the location more exclusive feeling, romantic, and private. We were not disappointed! The staff at the Paia Inn is fantastic. Carly, Nina, and Tina were phenomenal hostesses taking an interest in our comfort and happiness the entire week. They offered excellent advice on day trips, gave us a full tour of the entire property so we knew where everything was (beach chairs, etc) while we were there, and offered a friendly "hello" with a smile every time we saw them - you can tell that they really love what they do and that joy spreads to everyone around. The rooms and common spaces at Paia Inn are tasteful, comfortable, and very well kept. The beds are very comfortable, linens are high end, bath products are spa quality and paraben free for you pregnant Mom's out there, and there are flat screen tv's in each room. We stayed in both a standard room and then were upgraded to a junior suite for our last two nights which was a lovely and unexpected gesture by the staff. Both rooms were fantastic. The standard room was cozy but comfortable and had a small refrigerator with mini-bar treats and drinks as well as room to put your own drinks and food, should you choose to keep some on hand. The junior suite has an additional sitting area with a microwave and dish ware as well as a small refrigerator. We were able to use WiFi while we were there with no problem though if you prefer to travel laptop free, there is a MAC in the common area for checking email, printing boarding passes etc. Breakfast is available consisting of fruit, muffins, scones, and pastries - if you require or prefer some protein, there are plenty of places on the surrounding blocks to get a cooked breakfast and there's an excellent grocery store as well with many vegan, vegetarian, and diabetic options. The area around Paia Inn really DOES have everything one might need and the town is very safe, friendly, and just plain happy. There is a pharmacy, grocer, several cafe's, lunch, and dinner spots in the area (within walking distance) as well as lots of treats like gelato, cocktails, shaved ice, yoga, jewelry, gorgeous clothing, art galleries etc. If you have a rental car, parking is free in the private hotel lot just around the corner from the building that houses the Inn. There are security camera's so you don't have to worry about car break ins. Last and certainly not least, Paia Inn has private beach access across the lawn from their beach house which is also available for rental (highly recommend checking it out as an option). Though the beach itself is not private, it is very secluded and not busy at all. The sand is clean and the beach is very clear of rocks. There is a small rock pile to one side so there are plenty of little tide pools to view small fish, starfish, etc. - perfect for the kiddies to explore. We had a great time watching sea turtles swim in the surf... we couldn't believe that they come so close to the beach! It was a treat to see them.

Reviews.Title: “Wellington”
Reviews.Author: CaspianIevers
Reviews.Content: With it's own secret path to the beach Paia Inn Hotel is a lovely treat. The suite we stayed in was roomy, with a super comfortable bed and AppleTV/Apple Alarm Clock (if you can't quite get away from it all!). It could have better noise insulation (we were worken by footsteps from the room upstairs) but it in no way impacted on our stay, the garden side is very peaceful. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Paia beach has some pretty heavy surf, which is worth noting. Swimming becomes quite adventurous at some times.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Want To Leave!”
Reviews.Author: xjenn311x
Reviews.Content: When planning our honeymoon we picked Paia Inn after the many rave reviews and it did live up to it! The staff went beyond our needs and treated us so wonderfully especially Tina and Carly who helped with restaurant choices and our road trip to Hana. Upon arriving we were upgraded to the One Bedroom Suite and TRUST me, we did not want leave at all!! The room was beyond what we expected and we had a lovely time on the private beach. The town people were very friendly even though it was a bit hippy-ish but for the hotel itself is what will make us want to return again! I highly recommend staying here even if it's just for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “True spirit of Aloha- but I wouldn't call this place a hotel or an inn”
Reviews.Author: pauloregon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels and B&Bs and inns, so when I sat down to write about the Pa'ia Inn/Hotel, I had to think hard about how to describe the experience since it's unlike anything else. Pa'ia is a small "hippie" town on the main road to Hana, just 4 miles from the main Maui airport. Pa'ia has two gas stations, some yoga/tattoo businesses and a few good restaurants. It's the anti-Wailea. I like that since Maui has changed over the past 30 years and I'm not sure it's a good thing. If you look at the Pa'ia Inn on the surface, you see an old main street storefront with a yoga shop and gelato/sandwich place around the side, next to a gas station. The entrance is not even in front of the building, it's around the back. What???? Parking is in a tiny lot behind the building where cars double-park. Three other buildings make up the additional "rooms" of the Inn with one complete house available for the ultimate experience. A collections of building in a hippie town, why would anyone (other than hippies) care? This is the point where worlds collide as multiple sensations attack your senses at once. If you have just arrived on the island, it's a bit jarring. Once you find the entrance and park your car, the real spirit of Aloha hits you hard. Walking into the entrance of the Inn, you pass through a large courtyard of shade trees and other people (guests?) relaxing, drinking beer or wine, eating fruit provided by the hotel. You look at them ("who are these people?") as they point you to the refreshments. You suddenly feel overdressed, over stressed and very out of place. About then, one of the hotel staff greet you in the most informal/friendly way. A lovely brunette girl/woman who you imagine will go surfing after work. A young man from Spain who happens to be the breakfast chef. Smiles, welcomes, good vibes. It continues this way during your entire stay. After a few hours, a meal and some time to relax, you melt into the place. New people arrive, you feel a need to say "join us, relax". The staff rotates but the service is amazingly friendly. Restaurant recommendations? Path to the beach? Best places to buy swimwear? No problem! We had just one night at the Pa'ia Inn since our condo wasn't ready until the next day, but I've got to say that next time I have to stay longer in Pa'ia. When the staff called me a few days later to follow up and ask for feedback, I felt like I was hearing from an old friend. I actually missed their friendly demeanor after a week of dealing with the crazy tourist strain on the west side of Maui. Since this is a review, all I can say as a warning is that the rooms that face the main street in Pa'ia should be avoided if you are a medium-to-light sleeper. Truck traffic is heavy and the noise was disruptive to us. Otherwise, the room we had (#3) was comfy and well maintained. It wasn't a large room, but then you won't want to spend time in the room at all, you'll want to be on the beach or in the courtyard with new friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but delightful”
Reviews.Author: Oldhanwellian
Reviews.Content: There are good things and less good (but definitely not bad) things to say about the Paia Inn To get the weak points over first: it's on a main road; we didn't find this a problem as far as noise is concerned, but f you're looking for delightful views from your room, this isn't the place. The 'Junior Suite' in which we stayed was oddly arranged, with a bedroom, a shower and loo in one room and a 'sitting room' with a big sofa and TV set, plus the washbasin, a fridge and a microwave. There was a distinct shortage of hanging space unless you're under two feet tall. But these minor drawbacks were thoroughly offset by the whole atmosphere of the hotel - very charming and helpful staff, an attractive little courtyard where breakfast was served (free continental breakfast or you could pay for a cooked one) and the secret path to an almost deserted, palm-fringed beach. Paia is a slightly flakey New Agey town, not like anywhere else we visited on Maui, very pleasant and laid back, with some good eating places. Would recommend both the town and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Destination”
Reviews.Author: Whidbey50
Reviews.Content: We loved the Paia Inn. We loved the location, the Aloha spirit, and our special room. We stayed in Room 10 which has a patio and a kitchenette. We lived outside on our lounge chairs and it was just a short walk to the beautiful beach. The hospitality is A+. The girls that work there really care and will do everything to make the best trip possible. My husband said that "they make it so you have to come back!" If you are more earthy than fancy you will love the Paia location. If you like big, fancy, tourist hotels, this will not be your choice. If you want to enjoy the Aloha spirit this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: cubvolfan
Reviews.Content: What a great place! We were there for a babymoon and were looking for some much needed RR and thawing out from the harsh winter. Paia and the Inn met the challenge. We stayed in a standard room which is really all you need in Paia. Large, gorgeous bathrooms, very comfortable queen beds and other extras more than met our expectations. Mostly quiet except for some occasional street noise. The staff is awesome. Carley went out of her way to make our stay perfect. The morning breakfast of fresh fruit, coffee, yogurt and pastries was a great way to start the day. There is private access to a wonderful beach to enjoy the sun and local surf action. At night, the quaint little town offers up some great local eats. Just ask the staff for their favorites and they won't steer you wrong. When we go back to Maui, we will definitely go back to Paia and stay at the Paia Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, friendly, comfortable and a great location”
Reviews.Author: bethann7150
Reviews.Content: We read about Paia Inn on Trip Advisor. When we planned our trip to Maui we booked it. The staff were wonderful. They were helpful in every way...always with a smile! The Inn and the staff lived up to the great reviews. We can't wait to go back to Maui and Paia Inn! We stayed in a one bedroom suite. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Want for Nothing”
Reviews.Author: ebusher
Reviews.Content: Have never stayed somewhere so thoughtful and friendly, the staff is very warm and open, they have thought of everything you might need, and they are open to bringing you anything else you might conjure up. The decore is beautiful and elegant, the food service is very generous and yummy. So nice to have private parking! We would stay here again any time...

Reviews.Title: “Cool & Comfortable, Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Jersey2KeyWest
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 14 in January 2011, whale watching season. Never stayed here before and I am very impressed with the service. I have stayed at 5Star Resorts on the island and was not as impressed I was with this little boutique hotel. Customer Service is top notch! The outdoor shower in room 14 was very romantic and charming.

Reviews.Title: “A lifetime memory I will never forget”
Reviews.Author: cwilcoxson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I could not have picked a more perfect place to stay at on our 20th wedding anniversary than at Pai Inn. The staff was incredible. The location was extremely convenient to all of our activities that we had planned. Thank you so much for making us feel so welcome! Carol & Doug Wilcoxson

Reviews.Title: “"Bohemian Boutique in great location!”
Reviews.Author: ForesterCat
Reviews.Content: Loved it, wished we'd gotten the house overlooking the water. Ocean was a bit rough, beach smelled like dog feces everywhere, but not really related to the Inn. Would surely go back and spend a long trip there. Great locale!!! Next time would like to spend more time hanging out with my wonderful spouse!

Reviews.Title: “A vacation that was actually a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Vroom3
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted a relaxing vacation of just us. We did not want a vacation with 200 strangers at the Four Seasons pool/resort beach. We rented the Beachcomber House at The Paia Inn on Maui's famous North Shore. It was perfect. We had our own house with a beautiful yard for sunbathing, a deck for playing cards, an outdoor grill and indoor full kitchen for cooking, and a very helpful staff for anything we might be missing or want to know about what to do in town. And our private house and yard were RIGHT on a beatiful beach only used by locals from this very small town. And while the staff (Tina, Nina and Carly) was great about giving us our privacy, they could not have been friendlier or more helpful when we needed them. This is not a five star hotel. What this is is a really great and romantic place in a beautiful location staffed by very friendly people. The rooms are great. But the house is the best and a great value. Run, don't walk to stay at The Paia Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem......”
Reviews.Author: jc222
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something different from the usual resort experience then the Paia Inn Hotel is for you. Located in Paia, a small town on the way to Hana it is ideal for those who want a quiter time with all the advantages of having everything at your finger tips. The Hotel is located on the main street with easy access to the beach as well as cafes, shops and other points of interest. The cafes and restaurants in Paia are outstanding and there is a good selection to choose from - make sure you try Cafe Des Amis, outstanding - and the people are really friendly. Paia is a really laid back place and is a good base to get to all of the spots of interest around Maui with the added bonus of easy access to the airport. The hotel staff were ever willing to assist and nothing was too much trouble; the hotel was quaint and rustic and we stayed in a self contained one bedroom cottage.
