We had privacy and the location was ideal. One minute to the beach and thirty seconds to the cafes and shops - ideal !! The Paia Inn Hotel is highly recommended, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kab2828
Reviews.Content: We can not wait to return to the Paia Inn!!! I'm only sorry we didn't have more time there! It is an adorable boutique hotel. We spent a week at the Grand Wailea before our stay at the Paia Inn. They are two totally different experiences. But one was not better than the other. The Paia Inn is super-personal. We so enjoyed meeting Carly, Tina, and Nina! The inn is located in a funky town and the beach is absolutely gorgeous! The room was beautiful, great products in the bath, and I couldn't resist a purchase at the boutique. It is an amazing little place!

Reviews.Title: “The Paia Inn Just Gets Better and Better---Love it! A total Gem”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerAsia
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from my third stay at the Paia Inn, and I have to say---it just keeps getting better. The staff is fantastic and caring (as you will read over and over and over and over again) in TripAdvisor Reviews. And they love offering suggestions about things to do. The location in Paia Town is great. Paia is a town that makes you really feel like you are in true Hawaii, not some developers creation of it. The stores, the restaurants (Love "Flatbread Pizza!") in Paia are worthy of discovery. And I love the beach at the hotel. Unlike some of the bigger hotels, I can leave my room and be on the sand in---what--1.5 minutes? (one minute if I'm particularly ready to dive in the ocean). To alleviate a previous parking challenge, the Inn just added a new parking lot which is two minutes walk from the hotel--try getting from your car to your room in most big hotels in two minutes. And don't get me wrong. I love some of the bigger hotels on the island and have stayed in all of them over the years (I even got married at the Four Seasons Maui), and I love the water slides at the Grand Wailea, not a fan of the walk from the rooms to the beach at the Ritz Carlton. But I've simply come to prefer the Paia Inn. So there's a place for the big hotels---but---if you want a true island experience, in a fantastic town, in tastefully decorated rooms, and want to feel as if the staff really cares about you---go stay at the Paia Inn. And P.S. It's very social on the patio in the morning where you end up meeting the other hotel guests. P.S.S. And go have a meal at Mama's Fish House.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for personality, convenience, and service - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: kim39604
Reviews.Content: We LOVED Paia Inn. We stayed here for the first three nights in Maui and then moved to the Grand Wailea. We purposely wanted to experience a less commercialized Hawaii AND wanted to be in a good location for some tourist activities at the beginning of our trip. We were upgraded to unit 8, a suite. It was the coolest! The bathroom was indoor/outdoor (tree in the middle) and the decor was lovely. The beach is a cute little walk away (like 2 minutes) and it feels very private. There is a very small continental breakfast in the morning but it is nice. We paid extra for the yogurt, papaya, macadamia, honey concoction - delicious! We did the road to Hana (the Inn provides great notes and directions), Haleakala, Mama's Fish House, Ho'okipo beach, Makawao, Surfing Goat Dairy Farm, and Haliiemaile General Store - all very easy from Paia. The Flatbread Pizza Company had the best mango/barbeque/pork pizza ever. We also enjoyed our stay at the Grand Wailea (the grounds are unbelievable) but it was much more impersonal. The Paia Inn, little shops, beach, and overall location were awesome. And all the reviews that talk about the staff ?- SO RIGHT!! Thanks especially to Tina and Nina!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great people, beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: Noonze
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paia In twice. Our stay was impromptu as we were walkins. Tina did not bat an eye and showed us some of the available rooms and accomodated us immediately. Both Tina and Nina were unbelievablly gracious, fun, always smiling and responsive They are incredibly patient in answering our questions and giving us ideas where to go and visit. We thoroughly enjoyed this inn and felt it was like home. We have already started to recommend this inn to others on the mainland!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Maui”
Reviews.Author: AmyGoes211
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn is the best little boutique hotel my husband and I have ever stayed in. We stayed for 2 nights in the standard room and were kicking ourselves for not staying longer when we had to check out. The front desk service was always super friendly and helpful. They were always able to happily answer our questions, provide us with advice about what to do inside and outside of Paia town, they offered us drinks in the evening, and they were just really friendly! We also had the opportunity to speak with the owner on our last day and we let him know how much we loved our stay. He seemed genuinely happy to talk to us and hear about our positive experience. The ambiance of the hotel is classy & cool. The lobby always had (good!!) music playing and sometimes displayed the itunes playlist on the big screen TV. The patio is a beautiful place to relax over breakfast or an evening drink. The upstairs common area has a computer for your use, books and games, and a little ipod player with more good music to listen to. The private beach is really beautiful with a lovely view, and you have use of the Paia Inn's chairs/snorkel stuff/boogie boards, etc. The best part about the beach was the HOT SHOWER to rinse off in before going back inside. They even have shampoo/conditioner/soap at the outdoor shower. The room itself was beautiful and classy with a relaxing color scheme. We had a nice view of the main street through Paia, but it was never noisy. The bed was comfy and they provided an iHome machine to dock your ipod, and a sleep noise machine for those who enjoy such things. The bathroom was very nice and the toiletries were high quality. We stayed at the Paia Inn about six months ago, and we are fairly certain that we will return there next summer, it was just that good. If the big resorts aren't for you, or if you just want to stay somewhere smaller and friendlier than the big chains, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and personable stay”
Reviews.Author: Lucy60785
Reviews.Content: We stayed the Paia Inn as the last part of an extended stay in Maui. The folks are very nice, and go out of their way to be accessible and friendly. The rooms are furnished with nice, clean and hip furniture as well as with little extras, like beach towels, and a cash mini bar. The beach access is close - you walk through private residences and then down some lava rock to the beach. We had no problems, but could be tricky for some. The food in Paia is fabulous - the best on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great End to the Trip”
Reviews.Author: jsaintly
Reviews.Content: Being on Maui for about 10 days, we decided to round out our girls trip with a stay in Paia for three nights. It was awesome. Carly and Tina were who we usually ran into, and they were so helpful and always friendly. The town is a great transition from the chaotic children filled resorts in Wailea and has great shopping, as well as, a super eco-vibe. Loved the Paia Inn. Also, check out Mana Foods for sure. It is probably one of the greatest grocery stores I have found. AND Mama's Fish House is super close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beach access / Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Karastar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon, and we stayed at the Paia Inn on our last night of the trip... and we are so glad we did! The friendly staff (Carly) showed us to our room (a nice upgrade!) and helped us with our bags. We really enjoyed the nice, spacious room and the outdoor shower was a fun treat! The beach is GORGEOUS - and really close to the hotel. We wish we could have stayed longer, but we will be back! Definitely plan some time for exploring the shops and cute restaurants. Definitely recommend Cafe Des Amis!

Reviews.Title: “A true little piece of heaven in Maui. Everything simply beautiful!!!â€¦ A unique stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mariadele75
Reviews.Content: Everything simply great: location, room, service and atmosphere Intimate atmosphere â€“ a very very cute boutique hotel, small and intimate, run by a family, with a friendly and very charming atmosphere; a cozy and magical ambience, easy and extremely fascinating Excellent service - very lovely people, smiling and super friendly, great fresh breakfast, a nice boutique inside Fantastic room - I stayed in really beautiful room, I think it was n. 10; a junior suite, hidden in a little garden and with a spacious bedroom and patio and with an amazing outdoor shower Idyllic location - in the middle of the lovely and small town of Paia (the best in Maui), but secured from any street noises (you will sleep with the sound of the waves), and a second walk from a beautiful beach (one of the best beaches in Maui) One of the best hotels ever if you look for a relaxing stay in a cosy place with a charming atmosphere; an oasis just off the beach, coffes/shops and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful oasis in charming Paia town”
Reviews.Author: MNnortherner
Reviews.Content: After spending several nights at the Westin Moana Surfrider in the heart of busy Waikiki, we intentionally booked a room at this Inn in the little town of Paia for contrast on Maui. After reading the skepticism voiced in the forums, I had some trepidation as our stay approached, and promised to write an objective review upon our return. So here it is . . . If you need the large resort and hotel amenities, you will be disappointed. if you need an expansive view of the beach from your room, you will be disappointed. However, if you want attentive, personalized service, thoughtfully appointed rooms, and a convenient launching point for upcountry and Hana activities, the Paia Inn is perfect for you, as it was for us! Two of our three days on Maui involved upcountry activities and the Road to Hana, so we appreciated the shorter "commute" by having our homebase in Paia. Also, you can't beat that 10-15 minute commute from the Kahului airport. If you want to spend a lot of time on the west side of Maui, then you have more drive time, but the day we did explore that part of the island, we enjoyed stopping at the Maui swap meet Saturday morning, then making a brief stop to wander the paths at Iao Needle, and finally going on to Lahaina, which perhaps was 45 minutes from the Inn. A lovely drive, but happy not to have that extra 1-2 hours of drive time tacked on to my Road to Hana day, which involved enough driving from Paia! It is frankly hard to evaluate the value of the pricing -- it is a not a "cheap" room, but there is nothing comparable in Paia itself within walking distance to the charming shops and numerous (reasonably priced!) restaurants, and i really don't think you can compare it to the overwhelming choices on the west or south side of Maui where price competition can be stiffer and you can perhaps find a bargain. I don't think for the money you could find as lovely a room as the Junior Suite we stayed in -- very spacious, eclectically decorated, and we were very impressed by the numerous thoughtful details in the bathroom, the kitchen, and elsewhere. We were located in a separate building toward the back of the property, so had no issues with street noise, and got great nights' sleep. It was relaxing to spend time in the room itself, as well as on the Inn's fenced patio area that featured a great mix of tunes streaming in the evening. Appreciated the free wi-fi (with either their computer in the common lounge area, or using your own) and use of their printer to print boarding passes. We were too busy to do more than take a peek at the beautiful beach a short walk from the back of the Inn, but if you need beach time, it's just a pathway away. We took advantage of borrowing a cooler from the beach toys closet for our day on the Hana Highway, and my husband commented how the Inn had a lot of nice equipment for the beach to check out but the closet was a disorganized jumble. The luggage storage was a little disconcerting, as you were given the combination to another storage shed on the premises (not in the main office building), which who knows how many other people had access to, but our luggage (including my laptop which I locked to my suitcase handle) was just fine after a day of exploring before our flight left that evening. The parking is free, but with the expansion of lodging offerings at the Inn, there may be more guest cars than parking spots. It is first-come, first-serve, so if the lot is full you have street parking or the public lot a block away. You drop your keys at the desk if you block someone else's car in, so that your car can be moved if the other guest needs out before you do. The parking situation can be viewed as somewhat a negative feature of the Inn, but it worked just fine for us with our rental car, and the staff was very helpful and eager to make sure it wasn't a hassle for you, as much as they could. While continental breakfast was included at the time we booked our room, it is no longer an amenity, although paid contenental or hot breakfast was available on-site in their patio area. While there is not a fitness center on-site, you have access to the local fitness center as part of your stay, with a pass provided. The service and friendliness of the staff was what others had noted it to be - - a sincere desire to help you enjoy your stay at the Inn and in Paia, with helpful recommendations for area activities, dining choices, etc. It is a big plus mark for this Inn, and my husband and I commented on how much friendlier and attentive the Inn was to its guests, in contrast to the impersonal (but very stately/beautiful) Moana Surfrider. Another huge asset for the Inn is the town itself -- we loved it the minute we drove into it. No need to dress or shower again before dinner -- we went straight from hiking to dinner at Milagros down the street. We also enjoyed our dinner next door at the Flatbread Pizza Company. And for that special dinner on Maui, Mama's Fish House is only a mile or so down the road. We found the shopping in Paia diverse enough along with the shops a short drive away in Makawao to meet our needs, such that Lahaina was a touristy let-down for us -- both dining and shopping-wise. We enjoyed Paia much more. Many of the restaurants/bars have evening music and while the shopping shuts down relatively early, there were plenty of places to hang out and have a cocktail or listen to music if you wanted a later night out. So, in closing, we would highly recommend Paia Inn for your vacation homebase if you are looking for a laid-back slice of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Dutchman9
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Paia Inn - we booked here a few nights for our honeymoon following the raving TripAdvisor reviews. We had a great time, but when I left I felt that the Paia Inn somewhat under delivered considering its price tag. The Pro's: -The staff: very helpful, attentive and friendly. -Decoration of the rooms: very stylish -Location: town Paia is strategically located, close by the airport, on the road to Hana, next to the beach. The beach on the north shore is famous for surfing. Paia is a fun town with quaint eateries, like the organic pizzeria next door. -Some reviews mentioned noisy rooms - I did not experience any issues with that at all. The Con's: -The weather on the north shore can be prone to more rain outside the summer -Value: our Deluxe room was not overly large, I would estimate 250 sq ft. Just enough room for 1 shower - not a bath. Remember Maui has the highest room rates of Hawaii, but for $270/night (incl tax) the room did not live up to my expectation. As the photo's on the hotel website show, the deluxe room is set in a wooden unit that has sort of a "wooden shed" look and feel to it - I did not like the wooden panels on the walls and ceiling personally. -There are 8 parking spots (free parking) for 15 rooms which sometimes means you'll have to look for streets side parking - not a huge issue. Overall I think the hotel was good - but I don't think it lives up to it's price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Inn with great people, neat town, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: bornanbredinBabylon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 days at the Paia Inn after 3 days in Waikiki. There simply was no comparison. Waikiki was very commercial and busy. The Paia Inn was welcoming, cozy and very memorable. We enjoy staying in boutique hotels because of the intimacy and ambiance. Very different from the larger chains. The town of Paia is very close to the airport which really can make a difference in setting the tone for the trip. The staff was wonderful especially Nina. Nothing was a problem or issue. It just was resolved. Not that we had any problems at the Inn. The breakfast was very nice. If you wanted something more than the complimentary breakfast of delicious fruit and pastries, the chef was there to make you anything you wanted. The couryard where you could eat had such a relaxing and tropical feel. Even the reception area was decorated so nicely with the local artists prints and Pier One furniture and accessories. Great Look! We stayed in room 7 which was very nice. The bamboo flooring, travertine shower area and furniture were nice also. It felt like a very upscale beachy type inn. We would have like a little more room in the bedroom. With the suitcases in the room it became very small but after a while we figured out a workable system. Althought the shower area was very nice it was small. However the water pressure for washing off the remaining sand was great! As was the amount of hot water, which tends to be a problem in hotels. The AC was nice to have when you came back from the beach and the room was too warm. Now the beach. How cute the walk to the beach is!!! You meander thru some of the common outdoor areas to the other rooms and down two long passageways lined with art pieces on the fences. You can pick up your gratis chair, boogie board at the end and it opens up to a BEAUTIFUL private beach. Clean, beautiful crystal clear water. It is not tranquil however but fun trying to get back on the beach thru the waves. Could have stayed on the beach the whole time. Mesmerizing. The town of Paia is great. Eclectic shops (and people). Loved Flatbread Pizza, Gelato, Charley's for breakfast a must and Cafe Mambo. The shops are great and you could spend a couple of hours just wandering thru them. Not only your traditional touristy things but some very unique items also. Great location for taking the Hana Highway trip since it is the beginning of it. All in all a great not so little town with a great location, nice people, cute shops and a GREAT Inn. Thanks to Trip Advisor. Would highly recommend Paia and the Paia Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: AlejandroG G
Reviews.Content: Small but tasteful and by an amazing beach. Must visit Paia Contemporary Gallery www.paiacontemporarygallery.com Also, very cute restaurants and amazing Pizza at Flatbread. Paia is great town!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome. Awesome. Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_Joi
Reviews.Content: Paia Inn is an awesome hotel. Right in the heart of Paia and just steps from the beach, Paia Inn is a must stay. For our girls' trip, we were looking for a boutique hotel that offered something uniquely different from the standard hotels without being bed & breakfast type accommodations (more difficult to find in Maui than you'd think). The town of Paia and Paia Inn exceeded expectations for our girls' trip. Paia Inn is boutique/chic without being stuffy, laid back without being lazy, charming without being painfully quaint. Paia Inn seems organcially unique without even trying. The staff is beyond friendly. Nina, specifically, made our stay especially great. Nina was always welcoming, always accommodating, 100% service oriented, and had helpful suggestions for area activities. Nina provided spot on customer service. I'm glad we did our research on Trip Advisor before booking the Maui trip; otherwise, I'm not sure we would have thought to venture to the town of Paia and Paia Inn. Awesome town...awesome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!”
Reviews.Author: melissamce
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Paia Inn for the afternoon before a 10:00 flight home. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They gave us shopping and dining suggestions in this hip liittle town. Although it is not on the water, the hotel has access down a path to a beautiful stretch of beach. They provide nice chairs, boogie boards, service on the beach, etc. It was a great place, 10 minutes from the airport to enjoy our last day in Maui. We enjoyed a meal and a shower before heading out. I came from the Four Seasons, so I could not warrant 5 stars. Overall perfect for what we needed!

Reviews.Title: “It's own little world!”
Reviews.Author: Tailback
Reviews.Content: Just got back to the mainland after 7 day's in Paia-5 at Paia Inn and 2 next door at Nalu Kai lodge. Paia Inn is so eclectic,simple,layback,that you will feel that you,re staying with family and friend's. There's this mellow vibe to the whole town and Paia Inn has their finger on the pulse of it. Read trip advisor review's about this place for quite some time, and now I know why it is 99% recommended. It should be! Just a quaint little place, with superb staff, neat art work, and beautiful beach. Bottom line, special place,special people. I can't say anything about this place that has'nt already been said-just add it to all the other glowing review's. Trip Advisor, the most helpfull, informational site on the internet. Thank you for making the travel experience so much easier, fun, and reliable. Will continue to turn other traveler's on to you're website.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Paia!”
Reviews.Author: Ltdkr
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly located and Bohemia little lodge. The inn is not the cleanest and not the newest but it is a totally amazing place to stay. We were happy with the room and it has many features that make the this a great value. We stayed two nights and loved it all. The hotel is totally paia and is a must anyone wanting to stay in this little surf town. They have amazing access to a beautiful beach and you are in the center of the town. Parking, Internet and breakfast are all included. They also have the most friendly staff ever!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing place to relax unpretentiously”
Reviews.Author: elyette
Reviews.Content: Our suite had a courtyard with a fountain. How relaxing! Each unit is different. Staff treated us like family, joining them at their beach house on the ocean. If we mentioned anything, by the time we went back to our suite, it was done! Amazing. Good Lord, they separate guests' garbage to recycle it! They are very committed to a green lifestyle. They "walk the walk." The decor is simple but attractive, modern and tasteful. How refreshing! There isn't anything I didn't like. However, this hotel is not for folks who want to stay in a hermetically sealed air conditioned, brass, glass and marble box. A friendly cat wandered through our courtyard and a salamander or two. I loved it, but some folks don't. And then there is the funky town. Many reasonable little restaurants with good food. If you like healthy food, check out Mana Foods which is one of the most extensive health food grocery stores I have ever been in. The townsfolk are friendly, low key and unpretentious. We felt very at home with them. But again, I recognize that other tourists prefer a mini-Riviera kinda' thing. The hotel and Paia are quiet, comfortable but unpretentious. My teenage son and I both agree that the hotel and the town were some of the best things about this trip. This little paradise is close to everything and only 7 miles from the Kahului airport.

Reviews.Title: “So much more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: ttrjulie
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? This place and the town of Paia are amazing... We landed in Maui after dark and got to the inn about 9pm. We walked in, weary from the day of travel and Carly asks - are you my California Couple? She was expecting us, and offered a glass of wine while we checked in - I knew then that we were in good hands with this crew and inn. This was just the perfect start to an unbelievably great stay. We stayed in a deluxe room (with an outdoor shower you shouldn't miss if you have the choice!) for 5 days before moving to Hana for a couple of days. During this time, Paia Inn served as a great home base for everything from day trips to swim in freshwater holes, hikes, trips to the westside, and exploring the upcountry area. The beach at the inn is phenomenal. Seriously - what more do you need than powder white beaches and clear blue water? Swimming... boogie boarding (they supply them! and beach chairs/umbrellas)... lounging... and more lounging... this beach is perfect for all of these things. Not crowded. We also took a stand-up paddleboarding lesson one morning that i would highly recommend. Every thing about the inn is just amazing - but the staff is probably the standout. The owner Michael, Carly, Nina and the rest of the girls (and guy!) at the inn were nothing but completely enthusiastic and helpful during our entire stay. And the complimentary breakfast we were treated to every morning was way, way better than average! We even decided that we'd come back after our trip to Hana and they booked us two more nights on our return. This time though, the only rooms they had available were above the reception with street facing windows...it's a good thing we weren't in that room for the 5 days before because truthfully, i think we would have been disappointed had that been all we'd experienced. But by the time we got back from Hana we were ready for a little noise (you'll know what i mean if you stay in Hana!) and didn't mind the noise in the morning and the lights at night. All things considered, it was a fabulous vacation experience staying in Paia and at the Inn, if you're looking for relaxation, with the option for a little adventure thrown in from time to time - this is the place. If you're looking to stay on the island and not have to deal with all the resort stuff - this is the place. If you're interested in doing a little exploring in the area and need some personal recommendations from some of the coolest hotel staff ever - this is the place. As if our experience wasn't mind-blowing enough...my boyfriend tops it off with a marriage proposal on our last night, during a sunset picnic on the beach! (with an inn-supplied cooler of course). I know right? Could the stay have been any bettter??!! I think not. And we have Paia Inn to thank for it all.

Reviews.Title: “Fun & Chic”
Reviews.Author: Kpowdub
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn was a fun change for our last 2 nights in Hawaii. We spent 2 weeks between Kauai and Maui and stayed in B&B's and vacation rentals the entire time, so this inn was a nice change of pace. It's located right in the middle of the busy, bohemian town of Paia, that was a bit loud at night, but we were fine with it. The bed and room was comfortable, though small, and could have used a few more hooks. The room was also very clean, but when we checked in they had just finished cleaning and the odor was very strong and bothered us a little. We cracked the window and had it cracked the entire time we were there but the smell never really went away (I am very sensitive to smells so this may not be an issue for others). This was also the only place we stayed that had air conditioning and we could have done without it. The layout and design of the place is fabulous and it's just a short walk to a lovely beach with private access and an amazing outdoor shower. The courtyard has great ambiance is a perfect space to sit and relax with a drink. The staff was super friendly and very accommodating and it's evident that they work very hard. They were more than happy to let us hang out for a few hours after we checked out before our flight left. Overall a great place that could compromise a little hip for more practicality, but fun and comfortable nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious but pricy”
Reviews.Author: RMCTucson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room for one night because we wanted a place to relax the day before our flight back to the mainland. The hotel is not far from Kahului airport which made it convenient for that purpose. The room was small but very well appointed, with a large flat screen TV and comfortable bed. The ceiling was very low in the room, which meant there was no ceiling fan. The air conditioner was too noisy for us and the windows did not provide enough ventilation. There was some noise from the surrounding neighbors, but it quieted down at night. (The hotel provides earplugs in the room for "light sleepers".). The beach was an easy walk, but it is very windy in the afternoon (this area is famous for windsurfing). Parking was unusual (cars are parked in a small tandem lot) but not a problem. Since we needed to leave early in the morning, we left our car key with the valet who moved our car so that we would be able to get out in the morning. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall a nice place to stay but the luxury comes with a high price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: AgileTraveller
Reviews.Content: Summary: The Paia Inn is one of the best hotels I have ever been at, worldwide. Details. I was there for work and even though I needed to travel to the resort-ish parts of the island for meetings, we chose to stay in Paia due to its lack of big-box hotels. We stayed in room #9 which is off the main road and has a full kitchen, 42" Vizio LCD (no HD channels at the time of this writing), a very comfortable king size bed, a private lenai and a nicely appointed bathroom. As you have read or will read in other reviews, they have forgotten nothing. The toiletries are first class, the sheets are super soft, the pillows are great, and it is a short (30 second) walk to the beach. The waters there are clear and crystal clear. There are a variety of restaurants and bars within walking distance, as well as a nice specialty grocer, Mana foods. There are many small boutiques that my wife loved, but be prepared to bring some cash. Our favorites: Anthony's for breakfast/coffee. Flatbread, Moana Cafe, Maligros for dinner. Green Banana for frozen yogurt, Maligros and Charleys for the bars. All in all, this is a wonder place and we will be back for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED the Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: Jackie1124
Reviews.Content: We have nothing bus amazig things to say about the Paia Inn. Each room is very unique. We stayed in Room 10, the 1 bedroom suite. Our living room and kitchenette was actually outside. We found the suite to be very comfortable (TV, IPOD Dock, AC, King Size bed). It had one bathroom and an outdoor shower, which is part of our private outdoor suite. The staff were so amazingly helpful and friendly. My husband and I frogot our passports in Hana, and the owner who was also staying in hana at the time picked up our passports for us so that we wouldnt have to make the 3 hour drive again. We found the price to be a little high, but it was well worth it for the amazing suite we had, free parking, and complementary breakfast. The Paia Inn is located in the super cute hippy town on Paia. The Inn is about a 30 second walk to a private beach with golden sand and clear water. It is also very close to the airport, so it was an idead place to stay for the last ngiht of our honeymoon. We will definitely stay here again during our next trip to Maui. Also if you stay here you gotta try Mama's Fish House. Its fine dining and a little pricey, but sooooo good. Also, the fish market acress the strees has great fish burgers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice vibe in Paia.”
Reviews.Author: BigScooter
Reviews.Content: Staff were very polite and helpful. We didn't have a car for our 5 night stay, so they arranged rides for us to dinner and to the airport. Junior suite had a disconnected bathroom, which my wife wasn't crazy about. Outdoor shower option was nice after the beach or a workout. Perfect location. Short walk to the beach with chairs and boogie boards provided. Small town so everything is walkable. We loved shopping at Mana Foods. Mama's was good, but expensive; we also enjoyed Milagros. I rented a bike and rode with Donnie at Go Maui Cycling for two days - definitely worth it if you're an avid cyclist and can handle a 3-4 hr ride with some elevation gain. Good yoga at Paia Yoga. We'd stay here again. Great hotel, great staff, great location in a cool mellow town.

Reviews.Title: “The Paia Inn is the essence of Practicing Aloha!”
Reviews.Author: ThomsonTripToMaui
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Maui and we were traveling from the East Coast. Some of our friends asked why we would travel 14 hours, when Maui is basically the same as Florida for the west Coast set. Undeterred, we set out on a mission for authenticity and a locale that would justify our lengthy travel time. We found exactly what we were looking for in Paia Town from a perfect base at the Paia Inn, in a two bedroom suite towards the back of the property. It's the kind of place where the gorgeous staff remember your name and smile when meeting your requests. we spent five nights at the Paia Inn, two nights in Hana and a week on the West coast in North Kapalua, which is beautiful, but the Florida reference was starting to make sense. We had a late flight home, so I arranged a room back at the Paia Inn, where we enjoyed the beach, had a last dinner at Flat Bread Pizza and had an overall feel that we were back where we belonged. We tend to seek out more intimate small hotels (Jake's in Jamaica is also a fav) and the Paia Inn filled the bill perfectly as a tropical oasis that reinforced why we came to maui in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: DStrom
Reviews.Content: Very attentive staff, nice room, great location â€”just a few yards to the beach and within easy walking distance of many eateries, cafes, etc. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing end to a Magical Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: BeantownPrincess
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn rocks. Plain and simple. We stayed in Kauai and Maui and booked the Paia Inn for the last night of our honeymoon and couldn't have been happier with the last night of what was the most amazing trip of my life. We arrived tired, with luggage in tow (main reason we stayed in Paia our last night was its proximity to the Airport). Nina, a manager at the Inn was amazing. She stowed our luggage while we went off and explored the Road to Hana. She even offered to ship our snorkel gear back to the mainland if we had too much carry-on baggage! This place is NOT a resort. Its a tiny little hole in the wall but what a nice hole it is! Very Modern Hawaiian (loved the decor). The room was gorgeous - like staying in a fabulous old friends place. Nice bed, tv, fridge, AMAZING shower with Maui-made products in a cool dispenser - my husband even commented! Cute common area with a computer and I-Pod rockin' some tunes. I will say if you are looking for a place to crash for a few nights while you explore the Road to Hana and this part of Maui this is the place to crash. If you are looking for a huge resort with pools/restaurants etc. this ain't it. If you do stay here, Mama's Fish House is just down the road and one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at. However we are glad we saved it for our last night in Hawaii. All in all a great little boutique hotel that created a fantastic memory of Paia and of the last night of the best trip of our lives. Mahalo, Paia Inn...thanks for the memories and keep doing what you are doing! We hope to return someday to your little paradise....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a great little town”
Reviews.Author: jb1789
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Paia Inn on our honeymoon. The staff is the nicest and most accommodating hotel staff I have ever dealt with. When we arrived Tina gave us a choice between 2 rooms and even offered us a glass of wine. We stayed in a deluxe room (#14) that had an outdoor shower and was completely quiet. It was far enough off the street that we could not hear any outside noise. The beds are super comfortable and the shampoo/conditioner is amazing. There is a quick private walk to the beach and a huge supply of stuff to borrow,...chairs, boogie boards, beach mats, coolers, snorkel gear, etc. Breakfast is provided by Penguini and had plenty of options. There is even a little store inside the hotel lobby in case you forgot something or just want a new outfit. Michael, the owner, is very visible and super friendly. The staff is so laid back and friendly that you feel like your hanging out with your friends. The hotel location is awesome. Right in Paia town with TONS of restaurant options and a quick drive from all the other parts of the island. We had an awesome week and hope to be back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: adventureCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The rooms here were awesome. They were large, modern, and had a full kitchen. The walk to the beach was easy, and the town of Paia was filled with great restaurants. I really like the flatbread pizza place next door (they also make gluten free.)

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and accomodating staff, noisy and cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: mcfliege
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few days at the Pa'ia Inn in May. Upon arrival, we received a â€œfreeâ€� upgrade to the junior suite (in the main house streetside) which was a bit bigger than the original room due to the extra little living room, but it is a very cramped space in general, especially the bathroom area (clean and modern, thoughâ€”really loved the locally-made toiletries that are also sold downstairs in inn shop). A couple beefs: Even though the hotel claims to be green, the radio was constantly playing in the empty upper lobby. Breakfast was supposed to be ready on the back patio by 7 (they should correct the in-room bulletins that say as of 6:30am), so we waited around for breakfast to be delivered from nearby Anthonyâ€™s CafÃ© across the street. Unfortunately we had an agenda for the day, so when it hadnâ€™t arrived at 7:30, we left to just get breakfast on the way somewhere. The same thing happened the next day, so we were very disappointed with the breakfast set up. The worst part of our stay was the noise from the street. The Inn is next to a Chevron gas station, not to mention located on the main street of the town, and they love diesel trucks there. Loud vehicles were roaring through every few minutes, night and day. Plus, some adjacent business, I think the gelato shop below the inn, was obnoxiously blasting loud music throughout the entire day. Even with the windows, blinds, and curtains closed, the noise was unbearable, and we got little sleep the 3 nights we were there. Although we had booked for a whole week, we needed to go somewhere more tranquil. WARNING: the garbage truck comes at 4am in the morning! Unbelievably, this little inn in a bohemian beach town was louder than our big city apartment back home, so we headed to one of the more cookie-cutter resorts near Lahaina, which we were much happier withâ€”6th floor, ocean view, huge peaceful studio, and 40 bucks cheaper per night. Best part of the Paâ€™Ã­a Inn: the hospitable, always cheerful, helpful staff, who did try their best to make us comfortable and happy, but in the end, we just required a different type of hotel for maximum relaxation. They did have a gorgeous beach behind the inn and plenty of equipment to be loaned for water activities and recreation. The parking situation is limitedâ€”only 4 or 5 spaces available for 6 or so guests, so there is some valet tag to play if the spots are all occupied. You leave your key with the staff, and they move the cars around. However unlikely it is, I think itâ€™d be worth tearing down the gas station to provide a small parking lot. In the end, the price did not match the value: for $240 a night, one must be able to count on a good night's sleep, at least!

Reviews.Title: “This place was great all the way around...”
Reviews.Author: savemyfish
Reviews.Content: This place was great all the way around. It's exactly like the website describes and more! The rooms were very nice and super clean. It was great to have a chest full of beach stuff to use for free! The only issue I could see is that paia itself is somewhat far from the "touristy" areas. We had tickets to a luau in Lahiana and the drive was a long one. The town of paia was much nicer and so much less of a tourist trap than the other towns we visited on Maui. This place is great for the road to Hana and Haleakala - both fun but nauseating drives!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well appointed inn caianveniently located smack dab in the center of Paia.”
Reviews.Author: marleydog_10
Reviews.Content: Loved the separate cottage out back with its outdoor shower, but we would have been happy in one of the cozy main inn rooms as well. Great staff and well appointed rooms. Intimate but charming.

Reviews.Title: “Two night stay at Paia Inn to start vaca”
Reviews.Author: Parasti
Reviews.Content: Service was great right from the start, very close to the airport. Great place to stay before starting out for a Road to Hana trip. Staff was very helpful with info/points of interest about Maui. Private beach was the best - free use of beach chairs, body boards, etc. -- my wife and I pretty much had the beach to ourselfs. Would recommend for couples and not so much for families. Overall very happy with the Paia Inn - if your looking to get away from the busy hotels this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: Jlcliff
Reviews.Content: This is a small, private hotel in a part of Maui that most tourists just pass through. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful. Quick access to a beautiful and uncrowded beach. Plenty of great places to eat within walking distance. A nice change from the mega-resorts, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “the cottage is like staying at your cozy & chic friend's house”
Reviews.Author: wkgmama
Reviews.Content: after staying at a big resort in Kaanapali for a few days, i was relieved and happy to arrive at the Paia Inn. we had a big group of us traveling and we were very comfortable in the beachfront cottage and one of the junior suites. BOTTOM LINE: we loved it here. i had high expectations from all the rave reviews, so a few small annoyances bothered me more than they would have if i had gone expecting it to be more like my friendâ€™s house. PROS - i love how INTIMATE AND PERSONAL the place feels. don't expect cute mini bottles of shampoo and conditioner, but instead, a basket full of sunscreens and other toiletries (see photo), left by previous travelers, that make this place feel more home-y and less hotel-y. - i love the ECLECTIC STYLE, with an antique rickshaw in the courtyard (see photo), weathered teak furniture and southeastern asian touches. - the COTTAGE YARD is bliss. reclining on the chaise, glancing up from your book to see the majestic view, listening to the waves and the kids laugh....ahhh, now thatâ€™s what i call a vacation. - during low tide, the TIDEPOOLS on the beach (see photo) directly in front of the property is a paradise, especially for small kids. there is even a small stone wall upon which you can recline while they explore. during high tide, the beach waves are a bit strong for little ones, but it is wonderfully secluded. - Nina and the other inn staff WORK HARD. - the owner is very RECEPTIVE to suggestions for improving the place. for example, there's no AC in the main rooms of the cottage and it was hotter than outside and he said heâ€™d be installing a new unit. - Paia is an AMAZING LITTLE TOWN. the only place i've found on the island with chic little shops (wish there were a Puka Puka boutique and Mana Foods where i live!). CONS - in general, i'm not shy about requests, but here, the FRONT DESK always seemed so busy attending to the more important needs of other customers that i didn't bother with small stuff. on one occasion, Nina had been dealing with an unhappy customer by the time i asked her for help printing out our boarding passes. she was quick to assess the issue as not her problem but a problem with the airline. i suspect if she had been in a better head-space or if she had more help, she would have been more helpful. - the cottages' private beachfront grassy yard is so lovely, but during our stay, there was a strong CHEMICAL ODOR - like spray paint or polyeurathane. we suspect one of the neighbors was working. i heard a few people complain, and though it's not the Inn's fault, itâ€™s helpful to remember that this is not a giant resort where they have total control over their environs. - there's NO POOL. but who needs a pool when you have the crystal clear waters of Maui? try telling that to your child, i guess...

Reviews.Title: “Paia Inn, worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Josh4023
Reviews.Content: What more can be said about this place? It is neat, hip, fun, and a great place to stay. I gave the location a 4 out of 5 only because it is next to a gas station and you can hear the cars and road noise sometimes. Never mind that, because you'll hardly notice it. You'll be so busy pondering how lucky you are to have scored a reservation at this place, that you'll forget any negatives about this hotel. What the location is GREAT for is staying at on a day you are either arriving or leaving Maui, because it is so close to the airport. Also, you may want to consider this hotel for days that you are driving The Road to Hana or visiting Haleakala, because it is convenient to both. I won't gush anymore about the service, cool outdoor area, or the great boutique feel, because it has all been said before. What I will say is, don't waste another minute looking for another hotel in the same area. The Paia Inn is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “I loved everything about this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaPage
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this place. From the awesome staff to the perfect start breakfast, everything was beyond expectation. They provided every little detail even items like beach chairs and boogie boards. They make you feel like such a celebrity. There beach was one of the most beautiful we visited on Maui and was very secluded. The hotel itself is oozing character and the location is in the heart of the best town on Maui. The shopping is prime and the restaurants are very unique and delicious. It is also at the start to the road to Hana and a great beginning to Haleakala. I wouldnâ€™t stay anywhere else on Maui. This place gives you the full experience with luxury. No resort can say that.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing Alternative to Big Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ca_reviewer_08
Reviews.Content: We traveled with two small children, and felt Paia Inn was a wonderful choice for us. Our room had two bedrooms and a living area and was a good amount of space for that many people. We originally had a one br, but they let us know about an upgrade opportunity for $20 more per night, and we jumped on it for 2 br's. The Inn is lovely, with warm touches everywhere. Great toiletries. Comfy beds. Clean. Location is superb, and it was refreshing to not be in a big expensive resort hotel with hidden fees. Before reading this next part, know I still highly recommend the Paia Inn...so book with confidence. A few weeks before our stay, I called them to cancel the first out of three nights since our travel plans changed. I spoke with a very nice woman who said it was no problem and they'd take care of it. When we arrived for our stay, we were questioned about being "late" and not arriving for the first day of our stay. When I mentioned that I did call to cancel the first day weeks prior, I was told it "wasn't a problem" but then in the same breath that it's "nice to know if someone's not coming so they can use that room for someone else" (even though I cancelled). Then they apologized and said that next time they'll make sure to take better notes when someone calls to cancel - but then in that same breath - I was told a story about a "guy who once said the same thing but later on admitted he never called to cancel". I didn't know if I was being apologized to, not taken seriously, or understood. Just confusing and a little annoying. The staff was still wonderful to us, besides that (even that same person). *On a side note for Paia Inn - I did get a nice voicemail from them the day they thought we were supposed to come in. Unfortunately, I didn't get it until after the trip since I just got the new iPhone4 and hadn't yet set up my voicemail retrieving.* Only a couple other slightly negative things - - no pool, but you do have a wonderful beach within a very short walk. - no view from the room, but the rooms are great and ours had a cute porch - our a/c in one of the br's made a strange noise so we couldn't use it, but there was another in the living room area which sufficed - lovely breakfast foods are said to be ready by 7 am, but it was a little later when everything was always set up. 7 am might be early to some on vacation, but I'd imagine most come from the mainland and there's a time difference which makes you get up early! - sending out an email after our stay to thank us, but then a link to Trip Advisor. Makes all the reviews feel a bit pushed. - we found and demolished a roach on the floor (BIG ONE). I imagine most places on the island may face the same battles, though. Tips - - Stay here for a couple nights when first flying into Maui since it's close to the airport. - Stop at Costco along the way and buy your drinks/food since there's a full fridge. - Easy to do the Road to Hana from this location...get a boxed lunch from across the street at the coffee shop (great coffee!).

Reviews.Title: “Paia Inn, What you need to know first! Long.”
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I have been to Maui many times. I have stayed at many first class resorts and I have stayed at some economy hotels as well. My choices have been determined by what the trip was for. Romantic getaway with my wife, a resort is needed. Dive trip with my son, anything will do. This trip I was traveling with my son and his wife. Twenty somethings. The IPhone generation. And my wife. This was the "kids" yearly vacation so first class resorts were in order. Our plan was to stay at different locations on Maui, and explore each one. Our first stay was at the Paia Inn for three nights. Paia Inn review. So where do I start? No. 1 Maui Hotel? No, sorry it's not. But it was the best for .......... The road to Hana. If you turn around at 7 Pools Oheo gulch past Hana then head back staying here saves a bunch of time. Haleakala. A sunrise trip to the top is murder from Kaanapali. I know Iv'e done it. From here it's much shorter. Paia it's self. This is a great town. With great places to eat and shop. And you are right in the center of it. There are many small towns/places close nearby that should not be missed. Makawau is a must. Try to see the lavender fields. And the Goat farm is also close by. I don't think the Paia Inn can be beat for this side of the island. But you need to know some things first. I believe the Inn's high rating is due to the people that work there. The girls that work here are the best. Hands down the best customer service you will find on the Island. Where the Inn lacks is in it's rooms. And the they don't lack much. But! This IS the highest rated hotel on the Island! The 3 bedroom suite we stayed in had only 1 bathroom. Do not stay in this unit if there are more than 4 adults. The Bathroom also has not been remodeled as some in the website show. Do you NEED an air conditioner? Our Suite Had ceiling fans only. While it is on the 2nd floor, and the breezes are good here, a fifty+ year old woman with hot flashes will have some problems. Or so I'm told. The view was limited from the Lanai. It's only partial Ocean. The only bbq is reserved for the cottage and we were not allowed to use it. Make sure when you make your reservation to ask all the questions. Some reviews have dogged the beach here but we loved the beach here. Great snorkeling about 200 yards out. However it is not for the young or timid. Paddle Boarding is also awesome here. So would I stay here again? YES! But I'm sorry to say that there better places on the Island. We moved on to the Aston Mahana and Wialea Marriott. Reviews will be posted.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MrFairGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3nights in late June in a room in the in the main building. The previous reports describe the excellent quality of accommodation, the great location and the helpful and friendly staff and the ratings are fully deserved . The only negative aspects of the accommodation were that there was some noise from the road at night and that the rooms can only be described as adequately sized however they are of a very high standard indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Quality is Job One at the Paia Inn Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: denonweaver
Reviews.Content: My wife & I decided to spend an extra day on Maui near the end of a week long stay on the Island. I found this wonderful hotel using the map function of my iPhone & realized it was just across the street from the fish market where we were having a late lunch. The quoted rate seemed a bit high compared to lodging in Lahaina & Hana we'd utilized but we walked over to have a look. The facility was immaculate! The rooms were well appointed with quality fixtures & were decorated smartly. There was a problem with WiFi reception in our initial room which required a trip to the lobby for usable bandwidth & later I discovered our room refrigerator was inoperative. The host on duty moved us to a much larger cottage without hesitation (at the same rate) & the rest of our visit was quite pleasant. It's a 30 second walk to the beautiful beach with all sorts of toys provided free of charge to the guests. A very green facility utilizing biodegradable plates & cups for the satisfying breakfast. We had a late flight on our departure day & although we weren't able to keep the room (without paying 1/2 rate for 3 extra hours or full rate after 3pm) the staff allowed us full use of the facilities ,including parking, until we departed for the airport that evening. I've never felt so completely welcomed at any hotel! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The staff exceeds the highest expectations”
Reviews.Author: travel2b
Reviews.Content: On arrival we decided the nice 3BR suite we had reserved was too much room and asked for a downgrade. Michael, the owner, couldn't have been more accomodating, even though he could have charged the higher rate. He did not, in fact after we selected our room he invited us to use the suite to "hang" as long as we wanted! The asst managers were all nice young ladies who were sincerely interested in our comfort and were helpful with suggestions for dining and activities. One evening we returned from dinner at Mama's Fish House (a must!) and were met at the car by Michael and Tina(?) with umbrellas as it was raining. Where else would you have that happen? The continental breakfast is a nice touch. The rooms are quite different in size, so ask in advance. We found the Deluxe to be a bit tight although a younger couple might not have any problem.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location / great beach / activity recs were top notch / beautiful staff”
Reviews.Author: wartenaufgodot
Reviews.Content: wanted something different besides the same resorts at wailea - this was quite the find! - our 3 bedroom place in the back could not be beat - beautiful lanai with ocean view and day bed - town is perfect to hang out in and check out the shops / restaraunts - you just want to hang out there and FEEL THE VIBE (front rooms on the street may be a little louder?)

Reviews.Title: “So awesome, we're going back for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: StephenPDX
Reviews.Content: We loved our first stay so much. So, once we decided on Hawaii for our honeymoon destination, we knew right away we would be spending our time on Maui under the roof of the Paia Inn once again. Everything was as we hoped. The Paia delivers first class service, easy access to a quiet stretch of pristine south pacific beach, tasteful furnishings, beautiful design aesthetic and all in an atmosphere that reminded us of relaxing with friends!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Restful”
Reviews.Author: maui151
Reviews.Content: The inn overall was great. I did think it was a little expensive depending on what room you got. Some were very large and others not so-just make sure you are specific when making a reservaton. Nina the manager is great-friendly and helpful. THe rooms were cloean. I would definately stay there again-although if you are looking for a sit down breakfast this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Captivating ambiance laced with sincere staff who help effortlessly”
Reviews.Author: KMO211
Reviews.Content: We landed in Paia when Hana's accommodation requirements were too stringent. From online search, we located the Paia Inn and booked our room, later upgraded with a private bath from very helpful and concerning Inn contacts. We had no expectations, just more than happy to be on Maui. The staff at the Paia Inn were so easy going and helpful, truly interested and engaging. We're pretty low key and chill, and yet everyone at the Inn wanted to be of help - so that our time was the best. We walked into our room, and it was so clean, elegantly decorated yet understated. We appreciated the eco emphasis and how everyone lived the talk. This could not have been a more luxurious experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end a trip to Maui”
Reviews.Author: Thumper1223
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Maui with my husband and parents for 10 days. We stayed at the Paia Inn for the last night of our trip in order to be close to the airport for traveling out the following day. Tina was great, super helpful checking us in and getting our car situated. I agree with the majority of the reviews here. The hotel was charming, very nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. We stayed in room/suite 12, which had a huge balcony that spanned the entire length of the building and faced the ocean, complete with rocking chairs, other seating and a table and chairs. It was super relaxing to sit out there and listen to the palm trees blowing in the wind. We had originally reserved a 2 bedroom suite, but Nina upgraded us to the larger one which was great. The complimentary wifi access was nice, as was the breakfast complete with strong coffee. The town was really charming and nice to walk around. We had dinner at Flatbread Company, which was delicious, and lunch the next day at Milagros, which was also fantastic. The town is full of great boutiques featuring the work of a lot of local artists. As everyone has said, the beach was a 1 minute walk away, and was beautiful and not very crowded at all. The next day, my parents departed earlier than my husband and I, and Nina was great setting up our luggage in a locked area and also arranging a taxi for us after we had checked out. I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pomarina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paia Inn for two days in a large studio. I liked everything about this trendy boutique hotel. The stuff is excellent, the owner and his family are super nice, room was super clean and the decor is fantastic. We had a little private patio with a water piece to enjoy coffee in the morning. Hotel has their own path to the beach and you can get a beach chairs on your way to the beach. We will definitely stay there our next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paia”
Reviews.Author: Mauimagnatism
Reviews.Content: The ambiance of this little boutique-type inn surrounds you from the moment your arrive. Located in the very heart of downtown Paia, you are sure not to miss a thing, unless of course you want to! The staff and management are exceptional. A best kept secret is the private beach, not to be missed. Also, the oh-so comfortable beds! A good hike in the morning to nearby Baldwin Beach will delight you, and goes perfectly with a cup of hot coffee and delicious continental breakfast served every morning on a charming patio. Paia Inn will capture your heart people. I cannot wait for a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Maritimeca
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days in May, had a junior suite, It was actually 2 separate rooms, comfortable bed, small couch that is a sofa bed in the other. Small bathroom, shower and toilet, the sink is in the room with the couch. We were worried about the noise since it's right on the street but the soundproofing was great. Perfect beach with with, chairs, boogie boards and towels. The staff was wonderful, always very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: SnorkleBob52
Reviews.Content: On our third trip to Maui we decided to stay on the east coast and picked the Paia Inn. What a great choice!! It's right in town and we could walk to the beach, restaurants, and shopping. Our 2 bedroom suite was actually nicer than we expected from the pictures. Everything was brand new and very well maintained. The staff was incredible. Very friendly and extremely helpful about everything. The beach was about a 2 minute walk from the Inn and for the most part was very private. It's on a beautiful cove with mild waves and sandy beaches. Plus the Inn provides boogie boards and chairs for free..with an outdoor warm water shower. It's located on Hana Highway so a road trip to Hana was required. A beautiful drive down the east coast. The town of Paia is a trip in itself. Eclectic little town with several restaurants and shops. If you want to get away from the standard commercial resort stuff, you can't do better than a stay at the Paia Inn. - a happy Inn customer 5/2010

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jay081
Reviews.Content: I was impressed both by the helpful staff from the manager right down to the housekeeping staff. Helpful and Friendly. The room surpassed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: blackbettyrocks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of spending our first two nights as newlyweds at the Paia Inn Hotel. Tucked in a wonderful, artsy community, the hotel was welcoming and friendly. Complimentary breakfast and wine was a a pleasure on our honeymoon. The staff was enthusiastic about making sure our stay in Maui was an enjoyable time. The complimentary soaps and lotions they provided smelled too good not to take home with us, and the brick oven pizza restaurant next door was organic and delicious. The BEST part about the hotel (argh, don't want to give it away, but it really was amazing) is the private beach access. We stayed in Lahaina for the first part of our weddingmoon and loved the beaches. But the Paia Inn has a private entrance to a stretch of gorgeous, serene beach with soft soft and very few people. So romantic and relaxing! They even offer complimentary beach chair, towels, coolers, and more. The rooms and beds are on the smaller side, but we didn't mind. Needless to say, we'll definitely be making reservations here the next time we visit Maui.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST place to stay on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Hflack
Reviews.Content: Exceptional staff, fabulous location, comfortable rooms, great access to beautiful beaches. Nina, Tina, Carly and Sylvia are awesome! Would love to see those delicious Anthony's muffins @ breakfast again (thanks for accommodating our expectations!) Looking forward to in-house sushi bar next year. Everything was perfect. Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: alwoh
Reviews.Content: We had the smallest room in the place, but the ambiance and location topped everything else. The employees must be hired on the basis of excessive cheeriness and incredible desire to assist. Their restaurant and menu (!) recommendatios were spot on. The iput on the Road to Hanna was very helpful. Their private beach and the beach walk from that point were lovely - although we did not have time to enjoy that until day 3!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Spot to Be”
Reviews.Author: wadephillips
Reviews.Content: We found the Paia Inn on Trip Advisor and were pretty much thrilled with the place and the people who own and manage it. It offers easy access to a nice beach and walking distance to a number of very good restaurants. It is a re-do of an older (by western standards) motel that is made up of a series of small buildings located 1 in front of the other, between the main street and the beach. They are beautifully decorated and many offer kitchens and covered outdoor living rooms that are delightful. Architects will really like this place. Customer service is a priority. It is hard to imagine a more pleasant group of people. It felt like we were visiting friends but with all the privacy one could want.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Gem”
Reviews.Author: CMJ20
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent one night stay at The Paia Inn. The staff was more than attentive and genuinely friendly! Our studio suite was perfect. Every room was fresh, inviting and most importantly, relaxing. Our housekeeper took us on a tour of "how to get to the beach" when we arrived and we loved the dreamy paths to get there. We appreciated the beach bag with towels. The outdoor shower off the back deck of our studio was a smart addition to rinse off the sand. The kitchen was well stocked with appliances, dishes and utensils. The master bathroom was lovely and the living area well furnished. We loved the back deck complete with table and chairs and a lantern. The bed was beyond comfortable and we slept like babies! We will definetly return to this hip gem with great vibes!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Spundiferous
Reviews.Content: When we were trying to find the Inn we were a little confused when our GPS directed us to a Chevron station on the busy main street of Paia but when we stepped into the Inn they managed to create a whole different world. Carley was fantastic! So spunky, welcoming and helpful. I loved hte art and the interior design choices too. This is not the place for you if you want a resort feel or a traditional hotel experience but if you like spunk and character you will love the Inn just as the other rave tripadvisor reviewers have. It was a totally membeorable, unique and lovely inn!

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo for a Super-Cool Maui Introduction”
Reviews.Author: MarcsMilitary
Reviews.Content: So many great reviewers have given all the studious facts you'll need so I'll not go into all the what-to-do's. I just want to thank the staff for a great surprise 10th Anniversary trip, first Hawaiian for both of us, and for the laid back atmosphere that made 7 days pass in the blink of an eye. Mahalo nui loa!

Reviews.Title: “you are in for a treat, this place is so good for your soul”
Reviews.Author: droctogon
Reviews.Content: The Good 1. Front desk staff is unbelievably happy, super-cool and friendly (seriously, how are people this happy all the time?) 2. low key vibe of paia 3. The beach is a short walk through a path. Surfing was okay, knee to thigh, powerless waves, fun, no crowds, one turtle 4. Unbelievable fish sandwich at paia fish market The Not-So-Good 1. Room was small and overpriced 2. Our room faced the street making it noisy from the cars and bright from the street lights. 3. Parking was king of a hassle 4. Breakfast was depressing Would I stay there again? Absolutely Would I recommend to a friend? Absolutely (just ask for a room not facing the street)

Reviews.Title: “The reviews don't lie”
Reviews.Author: oatj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Paia Inn at the end of March/ beginning of April for 7 nights. The staff is immediately friendly and helpful, and the owner (who is always around) ensures that you are enjoying your stay. The rooms in the actual Inn are very clean and "chic", perfect for a one or two night stay. If you are going to stay for a longer stretch of time I recommend looking in to one of the suites on the property. We stayed in room 14, which is not yet on the website. It is a one room bungalow with an outdoor shower, which for some may not be ideal, but for us was amazing. I would definitely recommend calling and speaking with one of the staff to choose your room as they will do everything they can to make sure you are getting the best available. The beach is a short walk through a path, and is pristine. It is never crowded, and after driving all over Maui going to other beaches, I can confidently say it is one of the most beautiful on the island. Make sure you eat at The Flatbread Co. and get gelato at Penguini. Cafe Mambo has great breakfasts, and here you can also "rent" a CD for the road to Hana for a deposit that you get back when you return it. Stock up for the road trip at the local health food store "Mana" which has a great selection of prepared food and fresh fruit. Paia is a great little town, and the Paia Inn makes it an even better vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but no Shangri La”
Reviews.Author: Vesparado
Reviews.Content: To be #1 on Trip Advisor, a hotel should be off-the-charts amazing. The Pa'ia Inn is nice, and the staff was outstanding, but this is far from Shangri La. We had a two-bedroom suite (#11) that was not in the main building, but rather in the back of the hotel in a separate building. While the Internet photos featured a middle room with a couch and tv as the suite, we had no such thing. Our "suite" room was an outdoor patio. It was pleasant, but not what was advertised. As a result, the only TV was in one on the bedrooms. Had we been two couples instead of two people, this would have been borderline unacceptable. Speaking of bedrooms...the bedrooms were barely big enough to contain the bed. One of them had no windows - - just a French door that led to the kitchenette. The "window" was a door with a window in it that was blocked so you couldn't see the storeroom that it led to. This suite also is right next to the garbage dumpster. Nothing like being woken up by a garbage truck at the crack of dawn while you're on vacation to relax. And then having a non-working coffeemaker. (They have coffee in the patio outside the office, but sadly, no tropical fruits, just muffins and Washington State apples). Also, housekeeping forgot to clean our room one day (given that there are seven rooms, that seemed a bit absurd) and also left the doors unlocked two days. The safe for the room was at the bottom of a closet, making it near impossible to read the operating directions. Fortunately I'd used this type of safe before and knew the codes. One final minor thing: is it really necessary to hang up a Trip Advisor review of the room in the room? Geez. Also, the beach is a bit of a ways away and it was unswimmable the entire time we were there because of rough waters and high winds. Not their fault, but if you're going to Maui and want to hang out on the beach, you're going to have to drive 30-45 minutes each time you want to do it. On the other hand, Pa'ia is right on the road to Hana, has a couple of good restaurants (Pa'ia Fishmarket was awesome), and isn't nearly as traffic-y and touristy as other parts of the island. All that said, this is a nice funky place that's a nice alternative to the mega-hotels on the island. Recommended but certainly not five stars.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Wowtravels
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here at the legendary Paia Inn, the #1 hotel in Maui and all of Hawaii. We had very high expectations considering the rave reviews. Never the less, we had a great stay at Paia Inn. Does it deserve to be the #1 hotel in Hawaii, Yes - I think so! The town of Paia is a funky place to visit before you head of too Hana, with neat little shops, great restaurants and has a unique vibe, all of its own. The Inn is located in a nice part of town, close to the beach, shops and restaurants. I did find that their where more homeless people around then I expected. Itâ€™s a town in transition and to me it didnâ€™t seem terribly friendly. The Paia Inn has great staff that are cheery and always seemed upbeat. No request was too big for them to ask of. We book the best room, or should I say suite in the Inn, the one-of-a-kind Veranda Suite with great views of the ocean and the surrounding foliage. The suite was very comfortable and had a homey feel with a large up to date kitchen, lots of windows, a nice living room with a great TV, good size bedrooms, small/simple yet functional bathroom and had lots of charm. We had a few minor housekeeping issues, but the hotelâ€™s staff went above the duty of call to make us happy and satisfied. The staff totally made up for the minor housekeeping issues with their charm and gracious hospitality. The beach was great, very nice sand and huge waves to swim or even to gaze at during sunset. The outdoor shower was neat too, right by the ocean. We would highly recommend the Paia Inn and would love to stay here again, if we ever comeback to Maui. Happy travels, Maui is a wonderful and truly magical place to visit and we hope to return someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: margielulu
Reviews.Content: the paia inn is a gem! the staff is incredible - very helpful and friendly! we traveled with 3 boys ages 6, 9 and 12 and they loved it and already are asking to go back next spring break. the wind can be strong on this side of the island but the waves for surfing and boogie boarding are great and a calmer beach is a short distance away. the inn is in a great location - right in the adorable town and close enough to day trip to haleakala crater, the goat farm, hana, etc... i would return again and again. we stayed in the 3 bdrm. veranda beautifully and simply decorated with full kitchen and gorgeous porch overlooking the ocean. great nights sleep, amazing muffins and fresh squeezed juice and access to chairs, boogie boards etc... all made for the most relaxing vacation. check out the amazing penguino gelato right on the grounds. love this place - the vibe is low key and relaxed for being a first rate accomadation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to come 'home' to after the road to Hana”
Reviews.Author: ClaireSleboda
Reviews.Content: Service is everything...We have stayed at four other hotels in Maui, the staff at Paia were the best. Nina and Tina were cheerful, helpful and knowledgable. Check in was a breeeze. The rooms were small but very clean and nicely appointed. The bed was very comfortable. I was given my choice of rooms; I might pick one in the back next time because there was some street noise and a light that flashed all night. Didn't matter, I would go back in a minute. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful inn - BEST SERVICE anywhere”
Reviews.Author: BYUCougarTX
Reviews.Content: This inn was very nice, in a very interesting little surfer town that is the starting point of the Road to Hana. We stayed in a deluxe room, which was nice and very comfortable. But, the best part of this inn was not the room, but the absolutely FANTASTIC staff who were just amazing. The service was beyond friendly, and we felt like we were at home with family. Much of our interaction was with Carly, who was terrific ... but, it truly was the service that will bring us back to the Paia Inn!! BTW, some great little places to eat in Paia, and a fantastic family place in Wakawao (the Steakhouse) that is worth the drive up the road. We will surely make this Inn our "home away from home" the next time we travel to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “well thought out quaint location”
Reviews.Author: sandsandMaui
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem that provides guests with a variety of rooms and a unique style. Great for surfers and shoppers, and just for those who want to relax. They think of everything from lawn chairs to a beach bag in the room. Hot coffee from Anthony's Coffee shop is also free and available in abundance in the mornings :)

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to spend 2 relaxing days in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: togaice
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 2 nights of our honeymoon at the Paia Inn, and they were two of the most relaxing days and nights that we had the whole trip. I'm so glad my wife talked me into heading here as we originally planned instead of going back to the 'big resort' for the last couple days of our honeymoon like I wanted to. There are so many great things to say about Paia Inn. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The town of Paia is a very cool little spot with great shops and some fantastic restaurants (don't miss Flatbread and Paia Fish Market!!). The Hotel itself is awesome. The rooms were super clean, beds were very comfy, location is perfect, coffee and muffins in the morning were great to munch on while walking around town, and we loved the private beach access along with the beach chairs and toys available for hotel guests. It didn't work out for us due to some cancellations with other activities, but this would be a great place to stay when doing the road to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Great counter culture vibe in a boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joenbrenda
Reviews.Content: If you are a fan of the mega resorts where you are just one of the herd fighting for a pool chair, Paia Inn is not for you. Paia Inn is for adventurous travelers who want to find that secret special place the masses dont know about.... yet! We originally booked a junior suite and while it was very nice and tasteful, we opted to upgrade to their lovely 2 br beach house. Best upgrade we ever did! We loved waking up to the sound of the ocean outside our window. We couldnt ask for a better place to stay. The staff goes out of their way to make you feel like a true guest in their home. From the moment we checked in, we felt like valued guests rather than just a dollar sign. Thats rare these days! Paia is a lovely town that is a throwback to the old Hawaii. Cute boutiques, organic grocery stores, and delicious restaurants all make the entire Paia Inn experience one of our best trips ever.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wine_Lovers25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paia Inn between our trip from Hana to Lahaina. We stayed in the one bedroom, which was more like a small apartment, that was very nice and a great size. Full kitchen and patio area was an unexpected addition. The staff is friendly and even made dinner reservations for us. The only thing that i would suggest to management is fixing the fan in the bedroom, it was louder than normal fans...but we could have just put the A/C on which the rooms comes with.
