Reviews.Title: “Love the Paia Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug3CO
Reviews.Content: Wow! I had been wanting to try something different during my stay in Maui and this time I did. I have always loved Paia and saw other travelers reviews and had to try it for myself. Boy am I glad I did. From the first phone call to make a reservation and each contact once we arrived the service was fantastic. We had the petite room which is quite small, but it was lovely and functional. The artwork displayed throughout is amazing and the location is perfect for Paia. Right in the heart of town. This boutique hotel is the perfect place to relax and unwind after a long flight. Be sure to get a cup of complimentary coffee and a muffin and walk down the cool path to the beach for sunrise, What a great start to our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rachelbertsch
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Hawaii with a number of my friends to attend a wedding. We stayed in our Ocean View Veranda unit and couldnt have been more pleased with our stay. The staff was amazing, the unit was clean and beautiful as well. I took a bunch of your brochures on the way out so I can recommend to all of my friends. I think you have a wonderful place and we all felt very special that we were able to stay there. I am looking forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, funky, fun & great staff”
Reviews.Author: HelzBelzOz
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night after travelling straight from Australia via Honolulu, we wished we had stayed longer. Paia is great town, lot of traffic but we had expected that, the Inn is located right on main street walking distance to beach & restaurants. Very clean, great nights sleep and lovely little courtyard to sit for breakfast. Parking is very limited so you leave your keys with the staff & they juggle the vehicles around so not to much of a problem. The staff were fantastic, we could not have asked for more, spent some time with one of the girls who gave us a great fact sheet they had prepared themselves with all the "must sees" for the trip to Hana which made our trip all the more enjoyable. Would recommend & would definately stay again as base to explore both coast & "upcountry".

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: HT0375
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay in Maui... Almost booked at one of those resort (The Ritz Carlton), but so glad I didn't (The Ritz although ritzy didn't have nearly the charm that Paia Inn and Paia town offers). The staff was wonderful, super helpful in giving us recommendations on where to eat, and where to go to make the most out of our stay on the island, and every single recommendation was spot on! We had a wonderful stay thanks to Carly, and the other team members at Paia Inn! Totally worth it, the experience was so much better than staying at a resort. Plus being situated right in the middle between West Maui and East Maui and the South Shore, it was great to go from one end of the island to the other. If you come to Maui, this is the best to stay! We checked many of the resorts while on the island and none of them matched the charm and genuine feel of Paia Inn. Just beware that the rooms are a little on the small side... but the staff and location greatly makes up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Paia Inn Is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: NASA2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Paia Inn between when our timeshare week ended and the day of our flight home. As soon as we checked in we wished we had opted for more nights there. The inn is perfectly located on the main drag in Paia Town and is within walking distance of, well, everything! We especially love Flatbread Company which is almost next door. We stayed in one of the suites which was wonderfully decorated, immaculately clean, and very comfortable. We were welcomed with a glass of wine and a short tour of the (beautiful) beach area. The bed was comfortable, the suite was air conditioned, the patio area was nice, and a business center was provided - so useful for checking email, printing of boarding passes etc. There was a nice continental breakfast the next morning -- and check out is not until 12 noon! The staff was very welcoming and helpful during the entire stay. They know all about (and love) the area. We would have skipped the Iao Valley if not for their advice that we could easily make the trip there and back before our flight. It was a beautiful way to end our time on Maui. We will definitely include a longer stay at the Paia Inn on our next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, the Perfect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeniandmike
Reviews.Content: We began our 8 day honeymoon by staying here at the Paia Inn. It was the perfect "welcome mat" for an absolutely perfect vacation. We arrived late and the staff stayed around to make sure that we were comfortable and checked in. They were so helpful and they owner himself carried our luggage up to our room. Although the room we got (basic room) was small, it was filled with little touches that made it so very special. Flat screen tv, gorgeous bathroom, glasses of white wine, mini baskets of chocolates...so quaint and relaxing. The hotel has a large property that has it's own private beach which can only be described as paradise. This hotel offers friendly staff, local artwork on the walls, internet, shopping and restaurants within walking distance, private beach, coffee and muffins in the morning, and a wide range of room options. From the basic rooms to the beach house you will feel like you made the right choice when you stay here. Thanks to you guys...we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back and First Rate”
Reviews.Author: CaWestcoast
Reviews.Content: From the time of booking, to the call a week before our stay from Tina offering us a free upgrade from a junior suite to a 2 bedroom suite, we knew this place had the right feel; but did not expect for the overall experience to be so incredibly perfect. As I drove up to the inn, parked and walked inside, there was a note saying something like :"I have stepped away for a second, please call this number and I will be right back." I called that number and someone really did immediately show up. Tina welcomed my wife and me like she had known us for years. I have to say that these days, while checking into a resort, hotel or inn, the reception is all too often "indifferent." After Tina greeted us and gave us a brief overview, she walked us to our suite. During check in, I asked her where I could go to watch the super bowl (of course her suggestion was right on). The funny thing was, a couple of minutes later, Tina was knocking on our door. She came by to remind my wife that they had private beach access and offered to show my wife where the access was in case she did not want to watch the super bowl. How often does that quality of service happen? After the game, we came back to the reception area and Tina had already departed (as she informed us she would) and Carly had taken over. Again, the same type of very warm welcome. She gladly walked us down the private access path to the beach....forget the west side of Maui, this beach just incredible...very soft sand, clear water and pretty empty. As Carly could tell, my wife and I wanted to take a walk on the beach. She invited us back to the lobby when we were finished for a glass of wine (of course we took her up on that offer). As we sat on the very comfortable sofa, sipping wine, talking to Carly, I remembered that I saw somewhere that one of the perks of staying at the Paia Inn was that there was some sort of free health club access. I asked Carly about this and she went to grab a pass but realized that they were out. No problem, she would print us a new one. She pulled out the laminate machine and preceded to carry it the front door of the lobby so we would not be affected by the small of the melting plastic as she laminated our guest pass. I know I am going into great detail but wanted to sincerely highlight the above and beyond approach both Carly and Tina take in their interactions with the guests at the inn. The suite had a full kitchen and the whole unit had been recently remodeled. There was every kitchen appliance needed and the kitchen was fully stocked with glasses and utensils. There was a very nice, extremely large private courtyard with beautiful vegetation, lawn, organic garden, picnic table, furniture and a fountain. Back to the inside. The beds were so comfortable and the bedding was of very high quality. We both had the best night sleep we had in a long time. The AC was also very welcome, although not very hot, most of the places on that side of the island (including Hana) do not have AC. The location could not be better. It is literally steps from one of the most beautiful beaches I have seen and right in the middle of down town Paia. I had never really spent any time there, but there are dozens of great, unique restaurants and shops and the people working there and and around town tend to not treat you like a tourist like "those other" areas of Maui do. I have always just driven through Paia on my way to Hana but never imagined that Paia in itself would be such a great destination. I have to say, based on the amenities, the comfort of the room, cleanliness, location and the incredible level of service, I can not think of a better place I have ever stayed. The whole purpose of our trip was to stay in Hana, but stay just one night near the airport to relax before heading out to Hana the next day. Needless to say the Paia Inn was by far and away the best part of our stay (and we stayed in a pretty nice place in Hana). Whle in Hana (our old favorate location), we kept wishing we were back at the Paia Inn. Of everything else I mentioned above, I just cannot properly put into words how relaxing the the Paia Inn is and how comfortable the entire staff makes you feel. My wife and I have been traveling for a long time and have stayed in some pretty nice places. Overall the Paia Inn is one of our favorite, if not our most favorite places we have ever stayed. We just booked a five night stay in September and are already counting the days. Before last week, I would never have thought that the town of Paia and the Paia Inn would be our # 1 destination in all of Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Paia”
Reviews.Author: emaock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paia Inn for our last night in Maui. It is a hip, cute, boutique hotel. We own an even smaller boutique hotel (6 rooms) in my home town in Virginia and I am very picky about hotels. I based my rating on this hotel comparing it to my own. (We own the Suites at 249 - - you can see it right here on TripAdvisor.) Carly greeted us and was extremely helpful! No, the staff isn't on duty 24/7, but if you want that, stay at the Holiday Inn. When you have such a small hotel it's hard to justify the cost of round the clock staff. The shampoo, soaps, and lotions were beautuful! I should have bought some when I was there. The location is the best and Baldwin beach was beautiful! The Paia Inn is not perfect, but it's well worth a stay if you want to be close to the airport or close to this charming little town. Here are my reasons for 4 dots instead of 5. Cleanliness: one towel in the room did have a big stain on it, I read about that in another rating and thought the management would have taken care of it. It's a pretty easy fix . . . Management: FYI - it was a hand towel. Rooms: The beautiful silk curtains at the entrance to our room had a big stain on it also. Again an easy fix. Sleep quality: There was another guest, above our room that was doing laps at about 7:30 - 8:00 am . . . and our room, was right next to a storage closet full of boogie boards, snorkeling equip., etc that was for the use of all hotel guests. Actually our headboard was against the wall that was shared with the equipment room and whenever a guest decided to get out some equipment, we could hear it banging against the wall . . . at 8:00 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “"SPECIAL PLACE"”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful boutique hotel last November. The place is so cute. The staff are super friendly. The location is perfect for anything you like to do on Maui. The amenities in the room are very nice. Being a hotel owner myself, I recognize a great place when I see it, and this one is just that. Great! We hope to see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Paia Inn won our hearts”
Reviews.Author: mitzi08
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Paia Inn during the last week of Jan 2010. We were originally to stay two, but it was such a great place that we extended our stay by an extra night. We were greeted by very helpful staff who offered us a welcome glass of wine after our very long flight to Maui. The service continued to be spectacular during the entire stay. The front desk staff were incredibly helpful, often helping us plan our day's activities and pointing out not-to-be-missed spots. After spending a day out and about, we often talked of returning "home", by which we meant the Inn. We stayed in a junior suite, and while the bedroom itself was pretty small, it was more than enough space. The location of the inn had its plusses (right in the heart of Paia and a quick walk to the beach down a private access path) and minuses (we were woken up early by street noise one morning). The complimentary breakfast of fresh pastries, coffee, juice, and fruit each day (delivered from the excellent coffee shop across the street) was just what we needed to start our day. The hotel also provided beach chairs, boogie boards, and snorkeling gear if needed. After we left Paia, we spent four nights in a high-end resort in Ka'anapali. After spending a night or two in the touristy Ka'anapali, we really missed the laid-back atmosphere of Paia and the Paia Inn. The Paia Inn felt like home to us, and we missed that feeling the last four nights of our trip. If (when) we return to Maui, we plan to spend all of our time in Paia and avoid the touristy megaresorts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Paia”
Reviews.Author: MellanzaneMadman
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn, located directly in the middle of Paia on the North Shore of Maui is a perfect place to stay when in the area. The rooms are excellent (we were upgraded to #6 - a one bedroom suite with full kitchen and back porch area), the service is fantastic, and the beaches nearby are amazing. There is a private path that leads to the beach from the Inn - they provide chairs, towels, beach equipment, etc. Just a note - the waves in North Maui can be ROUGH, so be careful. The town of Paia is a nice little town with a strong surfing / laid back feel to it. Some nice restaurants, shops, etc - all within easy walking distance of the Paia Inn. Our favorite attraction was Ho'okipa beach, where you can see people surfing the biggest waves I've ever seen. It's about a 2-3 mile drive from the Paia Inn. The inn provides free parking which is also a great bonus. Overall, if you're going to Paia for surfing, hitting the road to Hana, or just want to check out a town that's a little different from much of the rest of Maui, then you can't go wrong staying at the Paia Inn. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A rare find in Maui”
Reviews.Author: TracyK31
Reviews.Content: We chose the Paia Inn because of its proximity to the airport and the convenience when arriving so late in Maui. The hotel and the town of Paia far exceeded our expectations. Both are small and quaint, unlike Wailea or Kaanapali, and not as remote as Hana. We had reserved a 2 bedroom but the day before we were told we would be upgraded to the 3 bedroom. The staff was very friendly at check in. The room was basically a 3 bedroom apartment. It was very clean with a full kitchen and living room. A large balcony/porch wrapped around the whole unit and could be accessed from the bedrooms as well. Our unit was not directly beachfront although we could see and hear the ocean from the porch. A short walkway took us to the beach and the hotel provided chairs. Fresh coffee and muffins from the coffee house across the street were set out in the morning on the patio next to the front desk. For its size, the town has many shops and restaurants. I would recommend the Paia Inn to anyone wanting a less crowded option in Maui. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Set the mood for our entire trip”
Reviews.Author: remvet
Reviews.Content: We went to the Inn directly from the airport. We were immediately and graciously greeted and upgraded to the most fantastic living area in this one of a kind, truly Hawaiian Inn. We stayed in the Veranda suite which was immaculate and perfect for a family of 4 with two small girls aged 10 and 4. There was very close access to a beautiful beach with the Inn supplying any and all accoutrements. We learned about the Paia Inn from its internet site. We were very nervous as we had no direct knowledge or even indirect knowledge of the Inn. We were taken aback by the service, the beauty of the suite and the town. Everyone gets those moments on holiday that are sublime, moments that are always treasured, but they are few and far between. The Paia Inn will always be, for me and my family, one of those moments. We had extreme romance, loads of family fun and one of a kind experiences all because of the Paia Inn. I must apologize for not writing sooner. It was selfish. This place is one of those pearls that you wish you could have for your own. However, like a good wine, it should be shared. For any traveler to Maui, a stay at the Paia Inn should not be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Easy going”
Reviews.Author: travlingjules73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paia Inn the staff was fun and friendly. The Inn was very clean and located in the Heart of Paia was so easy getting around. We had a great time on there beautiful beach so much fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms -- FANTASTIC service with Aloha :)”
Reviews.Author: lttlredd
Reviews.Content: From the second we arrived at this hip hotel, we felt welcomed, at home and relaxed. The staff, especially manager, Nina, were full of aloha -- warm and friendly, going above and beyond to accommodate our every wish. I'm a frequent traveler to the islands, and Paia Inn has crept to the very top of my list for Maui accommodations. First, an awesome and convenient location. Second, the rooms were so stylish, well-appointed and private. Third, a great deal for what it offers, with very nice touches throughout -- awesome coffee from Anthony's across the street, a free business center, beach access and free parking (a big deal in Paia). Only regret was not staying longer. We are counting the days until we return.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: guitarjunky
Reviews.Content: This is our first trip to Hawaii (Maui) and the Paia Inn our first stop, It is by all means just perfect. Very well located next to great beaches and a the funky little town of Paia. The staff is very friendly and eager to help in any way. The room we had (no 6) is well decorated, clean and very comfortable. In a nutshell, we would come back any time!

Reviews.Title: “A must in Maui”
Reviews.Author: MVZanetti
Reviews.Content: Pai'a is the best town to stay in Maui and this is the best place to stay in Pai'a. Very conveniently located - central in Maui and just a few steps from Paia's best shops and restaurants - this boutique hotel has charming rooms and an amazing staff, always kind and helpfull. Great for a romance trip and for those who care about autenticity!

Reviews.Title: “Very simply the best.”
Reviews.Author: VideoGame_guy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Paia Inn over Thanksgiving. We had been working very long hours at our jobs and decided we needed a break. I choose the Paia Inn pretty much based on a gut feeling. My roll of the dice payed back some serious dividends. I have stayed in 5 star hotels with astronomical nightly fees, but none of them were as nice nor relaxing as the Paia Inn. The staff are incredibly competent and genuinely friendly (to the point where I would consider trying to hire them myself.) You can tell they love working there. That's not a surprise considering how cool the owner Michael is. We spent a wonderful 10 days there, and we are so pleased that we are planning to go back for the holidays next year. We got engaged down the road at one of the numerous nearby beautiful sights, Twin Falls, and the owner gave us a bottle of champagne to celebrate. Our whole trip he went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure we had a great time. An extra bonus is "Penguiny", the inn snack spot. Melissa a.k.a. Penguini herself is awesome, she creates wonderful gourmet food you would not expect in a small town, such as truffles and fresh gelato made from local fruit daily. My fiance and I both highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Paia Inn is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Utahnloves2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before being able to use our condo in Lahaina. To our surprise we were upgraded to their 3 bedroom partial oceanview suite. The accomadations were perfect with great bedding, etc. They had prearranged a dinner reservation for us too. Beach was beautiful. Would highly recommend this inn on you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Cute trendy clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: happypo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way to Hana. We had previously stayed at the Ritz Carlton the night before, so we were (just as the last reviewer wrote) planning for a place that was a step down. But, this place is very cute and friendly. I had trouble finding the driveway to the parking lot and when I had called, the receptionist offered to walk outside and find us instead. We were also upgraded to room 6, which has a nice kitchen and living room area. The breakfast is just muffins and oatmeal packets, so nothing fancy, but adequate. We also had free wireless, which is a plus. The beach is awesome, make sure you make time to check it out. The perfect place to stay, as it refueled us for our trip! :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: jrb44
Reviews.Content: After coming from the Four Seasons in Wailea, I was prepared for a step down in quality and service but Paia Inn greatly exceeded expectations. The staff was outstanding, I was upgraded to a great room (#9) with a full kitchen, huge LCD tv, softa/sitting area and cozy outside patio. The room was as big as most studio apartments in NYC. It was also great to walk out the door and have all the restaurants and bars right there and the beach a very short walk away and yet the room still be very quiet and relaxing. The staff has thought of everything - they've got a beach bag (so cute I bought 4 of them) ready to go with beach towels, beach mats, chairs, boogie boards readily and freely available and an upstairs lounge with free internet access. The great coffee and pastries from Anthony's for breakfast in the courtyard is a nice extra touch too. Paia is a great chill town and between the great vibe and my extraordinary stay at the Paia Inn I think I liked it better than my stay at the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Great for "in-town" visit”
Reviews.Author: RandR_NY
Reviews.Content: Paia is a youthful, trendy and fun town to visit. This hotel is perfect for a short town visit, with it's location in the center of town yet steps from a fun beach. Rooms are small but neat and nicely decorated. Free internet access is a bonus. Breakfast was sparse but excellent alternate options across the street and around the corner. Streets bustling during day and evening but very quiet over night. Very convenient to rental car drop-off and airport. A good place to end our visit to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away”
Reviews.Author: LittleDeal
Reviews.Content: I walked in and they called me by my name. My fiance and I were greeted with smiles and asked if we would like a glass of wine and a tour of the inn as well as the beach access. I don't want to ruin the complete experience by writing a long review, but I do want to say that customer service is king when you stay here. If you're looking for a different feel in Maui, aside from the resort hotels, I would definitely urge you to give this place a try. Also...try the pizza place next door.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back next year”
Reviews.Author: Buzkill
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for anything more. After spending a week in Hana this was the perfect place to get acclimated with civilization. The staff was wonderful and very helpful, by the end of our trip they felt like old friends. We took full advantage of all of the beach toys they had to offer. Everything felt so familiar though we had never been here before. I guess you could have called it DÃ©jÃ  vu, but we called it just plain awsomeness

Reviews.Title: “Maui Wowie!”
Reviews.Author: KGandGSPhilly
Reviews.Content: This was the second leg of our honeymoon, and the first review that I have ever put down in favor of a recommendation from Trip Advisor. This place is so great that the world needs to know. Paia is a perfect little town and a nice contrast to the 'built up' feel of Maui. We enjoyed our stay because of the staff, plain and simple. They were courteous and interesting people, never hesitating to show you the route to the beach or paying for your breakfast when you're checking out before the breakfast provided at the hotel. Even though we only spent two nights there, they were the best two nights on Maui. The only teeny, tiny downside would be the room size. That being said, the room size is clearly advertised, so you know what you're getting...which is a value!

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply a superb hotel, where nothing is too much trouble for the fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Cornichons
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights in early December and I am so glad that I chose Paia as a town over the more touristy resorts of Lahaina etc. My stay in Paia was made all the more pleasurable by the Paia Inn. The staff are some of the friendliest people I have ever met at a hotel, especially Carly. The rooms are lovely and the artwork in the hotel is vibrant and different to most hotels. Location-wise, Paia Inn is great, it is on the Hana Highway, and is only a 10/15 minute drive from the airport - yet you don't notice the planes taking off and landing. It also has it's own stretch of private beach, which is better than a pool any day!

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air”
Reviews.Author: arizonamauilover
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place. We are frequent visitors to Maui and have stayed in a number of places on Maui, but the Paia Inn combines small boutique hotel ambiance and great location with terrific service and a staff that is truly happy to see you. Every single staff member we met went out of their way to make our stay a great one. It was a wonderful experience and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, but accommodations are small and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: wordCO
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn is centrally located in the cool, little town of Paia. The front desk staff at the Paia Inn is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms, however, are small and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “The personnel at this hotel thought of everything to make you feel comfortable!!!”
Reviews.Author: pheclark
Reviews.Content: I recommend Paia Inn to anyone staying in Maui. The hotel is beautiful! The staff is amazing! The attention to detail makes staying at Paia Inn a comfortable and upscale experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and convenience - a great jumping off point to see all of Maui”
Reviews.Author: Naturegirl09
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near the airport, this is a comfortable and luxurious boutique hotel, with lovely staff, a gallery downstairs, and a short walk to a nice beach. There's a yummy self-service breakfast, where you can bring your own bowls and cups from your room, the town has nice restaurants (and an amazing ice-cream shop next door), and with a rented car, you can reach any of the best restaurants on the island. We wanted variety for our honey-moon, so we spent four nights in Paia, enjoying the laid-back attitude, and going on day-trips. Then we went to Hotel Hana-Maui for a few nights, for a more secluded time.

Reviews.Title: “First class/ Paiia style”
Reviews.Author: coastaleddie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Inn this past weekend. I've spent some time in and around Paiia, but this was my first time at the Inn. Of all the many special qualities of the place (such as being in the middle of Paiia itself, the beach out back, the artwork, the bath products, beddings, the overall relaxed nature, etc) my feedback would have to start with the incredibly excellent staff. I had several phone and email exchanges leading up to my stay, and the responses were always exceptionally prompt and complete; extremely helpful. Once on site, you can immediately feel that the staff has a great deal of fun with their work and they take pride/enjoy working there. They answered questions, helped plan activities, were extra ordinarily helpful. We enjoyed the art hanging in every room, the bowls of fruit, the morning coffee and muffins, the lotions, and the extremely inviting beds. Their prepared suggestions and personalized help really made our trip out to Hana outstanding. If you want a fun/comfortable/thoroughly enjoyable homebase just minutes from the airport for exploring the sites around Paiia town, or just a spot to walk and shop the neighborhood, the Paiia Inn should be your first consideration for lodging. They have high standards for everything about the place and I recommend it whole-heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Made my first trip to Maui a memorable one”
Reviews.Author: ameser
Reviews.Content: I did some minimal research on the internet about where to stay on Maui, if not for a giant resort of condo, since I had never been to this island before. I came across a handful of positive reviews for the Paia Inn, and decided this seemed like my kinda place. The location was ideal for me for sure. Right in the heart of Paia town, the more low-key/local side of the island. Seemed to be a central starting point to reach any other part of the island. Had free on-site parking, so no parking hassles if you happen to have a rental. The private beach access was ideal, and the Inn provides you with everything you need for a pleasant & hassle free day at the beach. The room I had was fabulous. And what little time I did spend in my room, I found it to be private and very comfortable. The staff was the best! Friendly and willing to help you with any question or inquiry you may have. Everyone working there was warm, and sincerely friendly. I look forward to staying here again upon my return to Maui. And would for sure recommend it to any colleagues or friends.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Paia & the Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: mouseRD
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 2 night stay at the Paia Inn; not a Four Seasons & doesn't pretend to be, but offers a great location for Haleakala & Hana plus we loved the little shops & restaurants within walking distance, really nice rooms (we had room 9 which was a 1 BR w/ full kitchen secluded in the back of the property which made it very private), and AWESOME bath/hair products (Love Inside Out), bought some to go which we used throughout the rest of our trip & I have since ordered more! The staff were all very nice - we had the most contact with Carly (hope we didn't bother you too much!) who was very helpful with everything from printing off directions to Haleakala, helping with a activity reservation in Hana, & restaurant recommendations. Places we ate in Paia (I think all were good) included Paia Fish Market (twice for lunch - once on our return from Hana - my husband's favorite!), Milagros, Flatbread Company, Anthony's for coffee & a late breakfast, & shopping at Mana Foods for our 3 nights in Hana. Later in our trip, we had a lovely mid-afternoon lunch/dinner at Mama's Fish House. We'd easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Right from the start we knew we were in for something wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Mama-Loo
Reviews.Content: Right from the start we knew we were in for something wonderful! The lovely woman at the desk immediately came out to show us where to park and walk us over to our accommodations. First we entered a private garden paradise with a big ol' tree, picnic bench, vegetable garden and lush foliage. Then we made it to the fully furnished Balinese motif covered patio. Upon entering the suite our 5 year old daughter skipped through the house squealing "I love this place" before we even had a chance to take in the bounty of thoughtful details and modern amenities. It was perfect! Beautiful, classy and just the kind of nest we desired. The town had grown so much since my last visit 10 years ago, but the central location and privacy of Paia Inn is ideal for experiencing the vitality of the area when we wanted and quiet seclusion when needed. Best of all the "secret path" they have created leading to the beach only amplifies what is by far one of the most magnificent ocean experiences on the planet! Everyone who works at Paia Inn is genuinely generous & laid back...like meeting up with friends you've known for years. They have thought of everything in advance but made the effort to think of things that would be perfect for our 5 year old daughter - playground, safe swimming spot, even lactose-free frozen treats (Melissa at Penguini is a jewel of a gal!) We can't wait to return again - thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Alternative to the Resort Experience”
Reviews.Author: CAPTKAB
Reviews.Content: We were greeted pleasantly and shown around this small in-town property, located right at the start of the Road to Hana. While the rooms are a little small, the bath is roomy and the decor & art are local and inspired. The always friendly staff made several dead-on suggestions on local dining and points of interest. We were looking for a non-resort experience on Maui, with better access to the whole island and we found it in Paia at the Paia Inn Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time at the Inn. Wonderful pepole and place-we will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: honeymoon200971
Reviews.Content: Thanks again for a wonderful stay. The staff was great and very accommodating to our needs!! We will be back and bring friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “staying here gave us the feel of living with the locals”
Reviews.Author: Oklahomatravler57
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The Inn was more like a B&B (W/O the breakfast) than a hotel. Our room had a covered patio, which we enjoyed tremendously. Our bathroom was outside under the covered patio/porch, and at first we wasn't sure about that, however, we immediately fould that we liked that. The South shore was so touristy and crowed, we were glad we stayed on the North Shore in Paia. My wife and I have traveled to all 50 states and we found the staff at the Paia Inn to be as friendly as any we have experienced. There were two things about Paia Inn that potential guest should be aware of. The noise level between the rooms(some of the worst we've experienced), could really be a problem if your neighbors were on a different schedule that you. Secondly, the Paia Inn has limited access to the Beach. There is a small walkway from the Inn, across private property, to the Beach and there is no access before 8AM or after 7PM. Yes, you can walk down the highway for a distance and get to the beach, but who wants to do that on a regular basis. We went to Hawaii as much for the Beach as anything, so we were somewhat disappointed we couldn't do sunrise or sunset strolls close to our room. People should also know that the North Shore is where the big waves are. That means few people(compared to the South Shore) go here to swim. The waves are so big and undertow so strong, swimming could be dangerous. The up side though, is you feel you have the beaches to yourself. When we checked-in at the Inn and were told of the limited beach access, I was really aggrivated. I believe the Paia Inn should disclose this fact, after all, people stay in beachside accomidations because they want access to the beach . I understand why they don't, if my wife and I had read this fact on their website, we probably would have stayed somewhere else. Believe me, I'm not trying to be negative here, I just believe people need to know exactly what they are getting. That being said, I'm still glad we stayed at the Paia Inn. These sacrafices were still better for us than staying in the large, crowed and touristy resorts. "Rubbing elbows" in Paia with the locals, instead on all tourist at the big resorts, gave us a good idea what it would be like to live in Hawaii. In closing, we really enjoyed our stay. The staff and accomidations were great and we do reccomend Paia Inn. It would definately be a top consideration if we were to go to Maui again.

Reviews.Title: “Open the gate and enter a haven of comfort, right in the middle of Paia.”
Reviews.Author: QueenPalmyra
Reviews.Content: You enter the parking lot first, having noticed the sign Paia Inn, but can't imagine this might be it -- this sweet little hotel friends keep telling you about. Where is it? Then a staff member comes out of a gate opening onto a courtyard and takes you by the elbow, smoothly thru checkin, showing rooms, you choose yours, and voila. You're in a tranquil, spotless, tasteful, beautiful suite! Equipped with just about everything, even a stocked -with-goodies fridge. The staff were extremely attentive and friendly, never in hiding. The location couldn't be better, right in Pa'ia, close to great little shops and restaurants and beaches. Free parking, important for Paia. Breakfast complimentary, scones and pastries, GREAT coffee, all to go or eat there in the orental-feeling courtyard and garden. I was able to take care of my business in just a few days, so my stay was short -- I would have liked to stay there a good long time!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: AlohaKB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paia in as the first part of our trip in Maui, and I was hoping everywhere else we stayed would be just as nice! (And clean, and comfortable!) This awesome little Inn is right in town and you have plenty of options for restaurants(literally across the street). The beach is nice and close, it's quiet, and you just sort of have to relax. The complimentary coffee and muffins on the porch are a great touch too. This is where you should stay if Paia is one of your stops.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location and a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: emmaeAustralia
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several hotels during our 2 week tour of Hawaii (included 3 islands) my favorite place was Paia in Maui and the place we stayed made it all the more perfect. The 3 bedroom option with a wide balcony that looked over the ocean and tree tops with beach front access and a quick walk to good places to eat and shop was our favorite by far. Suitable for a couple or in our case girls holidaying together. We kept pinching ourselves as the place is set up with everything you need (from forgotten suncream, chairs & towels) and the service is outstanding! The girls at the front desk made our stay. Don't let people convince you that Paia is just a "hippy town". Instead its an understated oasis that embraces all things organic and has a really relaxed atmosphere and beautiful beaches. Staying at the Paia Inn is definitely the best place to stay!! From a world traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with 2 young kids and another family”
Reviews.Author: Mayadog
Reviews.Content: We are staying in the Veranda unit of the Paia Inn. It is a very comfortably furnished 3 bedroom with great art, a large flat screen, modern kitchen and a fabulous veranda. Even though we are steps from town it feels very private as all we see from the porch is tropical vegetation and the ocean. Our friends rented the ocean front unit which was also great and had a big yard that accessed the ocean. We debated sharing our unit with the other family, we are glad we didn't. It could have worked but each has only one bathroom and our bedrooms are small and close together. Having the 2 units to go back and forth was perfect. We cooked several meals of fresh fish and vegggies thanks to the very close natural food store which is wonderfully stocked and carries a variety of high grade fish. We stayed at the Sheraton Black Rock earlier in our stay and coming here was a wonderful change from the crowds and commercial feel of Kaanapali. Our boys did mourn the loss of a pool but have thoroughly enjoyed nearby Baldwin Beach and adventures on the road to Hana (just short of 2 hr drive w/o stops.) Nearby shops are very cute and the Flatbread Pizza Co. next door has great salads, pizza and local beer. Extras like the fresh coffee and muffins delivered each day, use of beach gear and boogies boards, in room first aid kits and bug repellent plus wonderful bath products were nice bonuses. All staff were very friendly and helpful There is a clear commitment to sustainability and the environment which is most appreciated. Caveats--There is not daily housekeeping, though they gladly give fresh towels upon request. Depending on your taste, a night or two here may be enough. We stayed 4 nights which was perfect for us but some may tire of Paia. Given that the rest of Hawaii is "on sale" due to the economy, we felt Paia Inn was on the expensive side. However, we have previously stayed at Mama's Fish House down the road which we liked less but is more expensive. We will come back and heartily recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in a great little town”
Reviews.Author: rockchalk78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night in Maui. Paia is a great little surf town at the start of the road to Hana. Our room was great! there was an enclosed bedroom and bathroom with an outdoor living area, great for lounging around and having a few drinks. They have beach access and are super close to the airport. a completely different experience than a major resort and definitely worth making part of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I will stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: fcpaloha
Reviews.Content: My son and I took two days to windsurf and stayed at the Paia Inn. We love Paia and enjoy everything the town has to offer plus the close proximity to windsurfing. The staff at the Inn was exceptional my personal thanks to Tina and Nina who were very accomodationg and helpful. The room (#9) was extremely comfortable and very well stocked, I also like the fact that beach towels, chairs boogie boards etc. were all available. A big plus when flying from Oahu. I look forward to my next stay which will be soon. Aloha, Fred Paine

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel with excellent service, in a hip little beach town with a great vibe.”
Reviews.Author: Paia_Maui
Reviews.Content: Everyone at Paia Inn goes out of their way to make you feel welcome, but it's not forced, they are just truly lovely people. The location is great for a quick trip from the main Maui airport, and it's fun to watch all the wind-surfers and kit-boarders off the north shore. The town of Paia has amazing restaurants, and cute shops, all within 100 yards in each direction from the hotel. We have vacation ownership elsewhere on the island, but make it a point to stay here on the front, or back end of each trip now. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff, a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Lilikoi09
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed by the elegance of this hotel and by the quality of customer service. Tina and Nina were great! The beach access and the grounds were really beautiful! We will definitely stay here again and we recommend this place to anyone! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “The staff is very friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingCamel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paia Inn 7 nights from Oct 1-8 2009. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They greeted me every time I passed through the lobby. The facilities are clean and comfortable. Coffee, tea, etc. and muffins, provided by the coffee shop across the street, are available for free. A bowl of fruit is also available in the lobby. They offered me a glass of wine (white). The main building houses the lobby downstairs and 5 rooms upstairs. There are also some cottages. My room, for 1 person I got the smallest, was small but comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. Even though my window overlooked the main street, the noise levels were low due to good insulation. They have a nice patio, where I met and chatted with a few people. They have one unit directly on the beach, and for the rest there is a path to the beach. They provide beach towels and have beach chairs and water toys you can use including boogie boards and a couple surf boards. The beach is actually 3 beaches in a series. The 1st beach is directly accessible by the public from the parking lot of a youth activity center with a skateboard park. The 3rd beach is directly accessible by the public from Baldwin park. The middle beach not directly accessible from the main road, but is reached from one of the other beaches. Due to its relative isolation, the 2nd beach is a nude beach. Paia is located on the north-central coast, 10-15 minutes from the airport. Nothing on the island is very far away (within a couple hours), and the location provides an excellent opportunity to get a jump start on the traffic to Hana or Haleakala. The town of Paia is not large but it is quaint There no big box stores (though they are not far away, in the main town Kahukui, 10 minutes), but there are several little shops. It has about a dozen restaurants and one grocery store. It is cool and laid back. This is a very different experience from what youâ€™ll find at the resorts on the south or west coasts. Parking is limited, so they have a small lot where they double park cars. Guests leave their keys in a box in the lobby, and the staff shuffles cars as needed. If you need to leave early in the morning, tell the staff and theyâ€™ll make sure your car is on the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: rrallan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six night trip to Maui. We spent the first two nights at the Paia Inn before heading out to Hana and then Wailea. My boyfriend and I agreed that if we had known just how wonderful it was at the Paia Inn, we would have booked out entire trip there! The rooms are gorgeous, though small if you are used to big hotel rooms. They have classy, modern decorations that are a welcome respite from the ubiquitous pineapple and palm tree with wicker themes you see elsewhere. I appreciated the common room with the computer, books, games, chairs, etc. It felt like a really nice, super fancy hostel, in the best way possible. The bed was comfy, and though the window faced down over the main intersection in Paia, it is such a small town that we weren't bothered by street noise at all. We loved all three of the desk clerks that we met during our stay- all of them were friendly, outgoing, helpful, kind of entertaining. I LOVED that they provided cups of organic chilled white wine in biodegradable cups in the afternoons on the gorgeous patio! I really appreciate the Inn's commitment to sustainability. The beach nearby was spectacularly beautiful and practically deserted in the mornings. I thought it was very thoughtful for the Inn to provide boogie boards, beach chairs, etc for guests to borrow. We ran in to Michael, the owner of the Paia Inn, a number of times on the beach and hanging out on the Inn's patio, and he seemed like a genuinely kind person who was happy to have us as guests and made us feel very welcome. I have been to Maui a number of times before, and driven through Paia, but never stayed there before. I will absolutely be going back to the Paia Inn! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: HeadKahuna
Reviews.Content: A slice of paradise and a refreshing place to stay. All the staff were very friendly and seriously concerned with our comfort and needs. The rooms were very clean and comfortable.We would return again just to visit the staff and be treated like family/royalty.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: haunjmf
Reviews.Content: we flew into maui at 9am, collected the car and drove to paia to find the hotel. although we were hours early, the receptionist (very friendly) offered us the opportunity to check in, immediately. we upgraded to a junior suite, which has a bigger bed, discussed where we should go / eat with the receptionist and headed off. the breakfast place (moana bakery) was excellent and we were able to follow the directions to the top of haleakala without a problem. we returned and the receptionist showed us the path to a beautiful little beach and pointed out all of the equipment we were free to use (sun loungers, snorkels, fins, body boards). we ate next door at the flatbread pizza place and then headed to the beach. in the evening - after checking out the hotel - we took advantage of their free wine and chilled on the beach as the sun set - simply fantastic. we ate at the paia fish market and returned to the flatbread place for some cocktails to end the night. this wasn't such a good idea. places like paia are small and quiet and so certain residents make their own entertainment by attempting to regale tourists with their tales. we encountered some boring fella from the former east germany who was at pains to let us know how hard his life had been. jeez, dude, shut up! we then returned to the hotel and used the free internet access - and printer - to check in for our flights back to oahu and slept like logs. the room was beautiful and there were a bunch of details - including provision of a beach bag and towels - which added to the experience. the next morning we enjoyed some of the delicious (free) coffee and muffins before heading to the beach for a really relaxing hour or two before heading off. we were really pleased with the paia inn - the service was brilliant, the hotel itself cool, and the location excellent. it's not a four seasons experience, with overpriced drinks, etc - so much more relaxed and cool.

Reviews.Title: “You Get MAUI when you stay here”
Reviews.Author: NOLARenovate
Reviews.Content: Comfortably renovated jr. suite I think they call it was totally comfortable with a small kithen. Nicely renovated and with a comfortable bed - I haen't slept this well in months. Oh, and the staff - Pure Paia. The sweetest most caing people who get why Maui is so grand. If your a golf type, the resorts are great. If you like laid back frendliness, Paia is a great place to stay. pecial thanks to Tina whose simple kindnss really helped make my 5th anniversary grand.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: SCFamilyoffour
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the room with the grand veranda (three rooms with an ocean view) and had an amazing time. Great indoor and outdoor shower, incredible hip location, located right at the base of the road to Hana. So many curiousities along the way - all within a few steps of the parking lot. If you like to run, turn left out of the parking lot and run with the waves and shoreline to your left. Along the way you'll see a variety of beautiful sea flowers (mangy pangies, gardenias and some other ones I've since forgotten), the wonderful Mama's Fish House, and then the local hotspot for hundreds of talented surfers. Without any trouble at all, you'll reach mile 9 (two miles from the Inn) and the amazing hidden cove on your left. What a view - and an incredible place to stop and contemplate the meaning of life. Back at the Inn, take an outside shower, get dressed and walk across the street for a wonderful muffin and great coffee. When you're done, grab a boogie board from the outdoor closet and head to the very private and secluded beach - complete with wonderful sand, token lava rocks, and great waves for body or board surfing. Pinch yourself while you look around at your good fortune. If you're lucky, you'll meet Michael the owner, pretty Janelle and the wonderful folks at the Inn - always ready to help or send over a smile. If you see any of them, tell him and them thank you for our Friday night adventure... While in Paia, you must take the road to Hana. Visit the beautiful waterfalls, eat the fish tacos at the local stands, find the wonderul lady with the homemade coconut milk ice cream (super yummy) and try all the flavors (served in a coconut). When you return to your room, grab a drink or make a nice meal in the accessorized kitchen. Great knives, great glasses, big refrigerator. Sit on the veranda and pinch yourself again. Toast your friends with your cocktail. Look at the water. Take a deep breath - taste and feel the mauiian air. If you want to head into town, go everywhere - but don't miss the fish tacos at the fish market or the gelato from the mysterious and beautiful dark haired lady with blue eyes (next to the Inn's main office). At night, leave your french doors open to feel the off-shore breeze. Take comfort in knowing you are still in Maui - living the life and living the dream. I wax meloncholy on purpose. The Paia Inn puts you smack dab in the center of a great little town. Close enough to the airport, and far enough away from both the Crater and Hana - to make both trips and wonderful half to full day excursion. The ocean view veranda was super clean, super trendy, comfortable, functional, airy and superbly outfitted for a party of more than a few. Heck, it couldn't have been better. I could not imagine a better place to spend a week, a month or a lifetime. I am actively thinking of how to make it back sooner than later. You will not be making a wrong decision by choosing this accommodation. If you do get a room - or the room with the veranda, please start counting the minutes until you get there. All the anticipation in the world is worth it - you'll love the Inn, the people, the town, and every little adventure you get yourself into. Don't be surprised if you find yourself falling in love with everyone and everything. I know I did. p.s. Mama's Fish House (if you just have to go) has two bars and apps. for a fraction of the cost of the meal. Check it out and drink an incredible Maui Tai (complete with unbrellas!) or two. Again you'll see more incredible flowers. I was fortunate to go with a floridian botanist - who was quick to show me the free growing aloe bush/leave/tree thing. Nice trick - and wonderful for sunburns...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hawaiian Get Away!”
Reviews.Author: jjd03d
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn was a perfect place to stay for my first trip to Maui!! The private beach is absolutely beautiful as well as the accomodations!! The staff is super friendly and willing to cater to your trip! Even the owner of the hotel was out and about introducing himself to the guest and it was obvious everyone loved working at the Paia Inn. Very relaxing little town with great shops and restaurants all within walking distance! Must eat at Flat Breads!! It is amazing, especially after a long flight!!! Overall the Paia Inn is a MUST (ask about there private beach villas..they arent on the website but well worth the extra $).

Reviews.Title: “Island Ambience with Style”
Reviews.Author: Logansmom6
Reviews.Content: The Inn is tucked into the surfing & artisitic town of Paia. It is independently owned by a long time local. There is private access to a small sweet sandy beach. The Inn was remodeled with inviting colors and a feel of relaxation. It was comfortable and clean. Staff seemed extra friendly . And there is even a pingpong table for guest use. I reccommend this to anyone who wants something off the resort beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paia”
Reviews.Author: Windsearcher
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff and a great location on the North Shore. Kiting, surfing and windsurfing all within a 10 minute drive. Staff and owners go out of their way to be helpful and nothing is too much trouble. A special unique place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel - great end to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jdsager
Reviews.Content: A friend of ours recommended the Paia Inn to my husband and I for part of our honeymoon and we could not have been happier with our decision to follow through with the recommendation. We were impressed with the staff, the grounds, the room, the cleanliness, and the location (close to airport and last stop before road to Hana). The service was great - we felt welcome right from the start. All members of the staff that we interacted with were friendly and eager to make the stay pleasant - we took there advice for local restaurants and enjoyed several excellent meals. The eclectic decor was very nice quality and inviting - even in the smaller room (we stayed in two different size rooms and both were very comfortable and clean). The beach access was perfect with nice places to sit on the shore or swim. We overall felt very comfortable there and truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, fantastic staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: atomic123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights after a week in Napili Bay...we wanted a nice hotel in this location so we could be closer to Haleakala and the Road to Hana. The best thing about this hotel are the staff who were super friendly and keen to make sure we had everything we needed at all times. The atmosphere is really chilled out, with a nice ambience. There's a nice garden to sit in for breakfast and in the evenings. The rooms are well appointed, decorated and the bathrooms are great too...good shower! All in all a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful spot!”
Reviews.Author: JBJG33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Paia Inn for 3 nights while honeymooning in Maui. We had a wonderful time! The staff were absolutely incredible - unbelievably friendly and helpful - each one nicer than the next. We stayed in a junior suite, which was decorated well, comfortable and incredibly clean. The Inn was the perfect place to stay and relax. Paia is definitely worth a visit, and if you're going there this is the place to stay. We enjoyed getting takeout from Flatbread and eating in the Paia Inn courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place! The Paia Inn was everything that we hoped for and much more!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Paia is an amazing small town on the North Shore of Maui. Unlike most of the South Shore, Paia does not have big resorts... which for us was a good thing. The Paia Inn has private access to a spectacular stretch of beaches with tons of opportunities for surfing, swimming and just walking along the beach. The Paia Inn is just steps away from great restaurants and a wide array of shopping. I have never visited any place with so many great eateries in such a small area. The Inn itself is stunning. Great staff, great amenities, great rooms... everything was perfect. Highly recommended! Andrew in Edmonton

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Poeticalbob
Reviews.Content: I write a newsletter that goes out worldwide at the end each month. What follows is a brief synopsis of our experience at this centrally located inn in the small community of Paia, Maui. "...The Paia Inn is relatively new on the tourist map and is situated in the heart of Paia. You are very near a beautiful beach and have a guaranteed parking place, which, trust me, is a real plus in this small town. The rooms are tastefully decorated with original art. The cottages, which cost a bit more, offer a spaciousness that I believe is worth the extra expense. Nina, a lifelong Maui resident, and the staff will do everything possible to make your stay an enjoyable one as well as offering knowledgeable sightseeing ideas..." Though I have visited Maui twelve times, Nina provided us with ideas and places to visit that were true fines. We had stayed at the Inn just after it opened. We were extremely pleased to see the finer touches that have been added during the last year. A fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Spree
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this was our first trip to Maui. Before our trip, I spent hours reviewing everyoneâ€™s comments. I was a bit obsessive, but it paid off. We loved every second of Maui and Paia Inn! I am very picky when it comes to hotels and will shell out a little extra money to insure that my husband and I are comfortable wherever we stay. When we decided to travel to Maui our main goal was to have the experience of a lifetime and to relax. Paia Inn was perfect, simply romantic, just what we wanted and needed. Paia is true Maui or its laid back cousin! As soon as we arrived; there were â€œno worriesâ€�. We booked one of the suites for a three night stay, and I will admit, I wondered if I was making a good call going off the beaten path. Even after such rave reviews and booking our stay, I almost chickened out, twice! Like I said, Iâ€™m picky. Iâ€™m so glad I trusted my instincts. Our three nights in Paia, set the tone for our entire trip. We just loved Michael (the owner) and the Paia Inn staff. When do you ever get to say that about a hotel? They were all so helpful, welcoming, and the nicest people ever. One evening my husband went to the front desk to borrow their wine bottle opener and after several minutes Iâ€™m wondering, where is this guy with the wine already? Turns out, heâ€™s outside talking to Michael. Heâ€™s sharing stories about our trip and getting suggestions for the rest of our Maui adventure, ha! I canâ€™t say enough about the people or the suite! The website doesnâ€™t do this place justice, because the suites are super cool. The room we were in had a luxurious outdoor shower for the adventurous and an indoor shower for the rest of us! The suite felt like our little home away from home. It was peaceful and most of all quiet. The beach is nearby, too, so you could walk down the private pathway, and enjoy a nice stroll on the beach. One of the reasons I chose Paia Inn was because of its proximity to so many great restaurants. Flatbreads, Moana CafÃ©, and Paia Fish Market all wonderful! After a trip to Hana, sunrise atop Haleakala, or a day at Ka'anapali Beach (yes, we got around) it was always nice to travel back to the North Shore, walk to a restaurant, and just relax and unwind. I wish we had more time to try the other restaurants nearby. I was so sad to leave after our third night! For the rest of our trip we stayed at the Four Seasons at Wailea, and we loved it there, too! However, Paia Inn holds a special place in our hearts and we wish Michael, his family, and staff the best! Kia and Bruce

Reviews.Title: “Big thumbs up for Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: 2Cycle
Reviews.Content: The photos and reviews don't do the Inn justice...the staff and property are TOPS! The location works for so many things...Mama's Fish House, sunrise on Haleakala, beach, etc. etc. Very tastefully decorated, relaxing, and convenient!

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: mbonser
Reviews.Content: From the time I walked in the front gate, this inn felt like home and I was welcomed like family. With a great location in Paia, adjacent to the beach and right in town, this is an ideal location. The inn itself has comfortable gathering spaces as well as very nicely appointed rooms. I can't wait to make my next reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in Paia- don't miss out on”
Reviews.Author: IslandHopper76
Reviews.Content: Fabulous boutique hotel in great location! The beach is just a few minutes walking distance, good location to several restaurants and shopping! The staff made us feel so welcome and were willing to do anything to make our stay enjoyable. We hope to visit them again when we return to Maui! Thank you all for making our experience in Paia so wonderful! Kim & Brian - your fellow Texan friends ;-)

Reviews.Title: “style by the sea”
Reviews.Author: skadforlife
Reviews.Content: I am always somewhat skeptical of online reviews but in this case all the accolades are well deserved. 6 of us booked the 3 bedroom suite which was beautifully appointed with a huge verandah overlooking the ocean. The beach was only a couple of minutes away and access was down a privtate pathway where beach chairs were hung on hooks for residents of the inn.it felt like your own private cove and was great for bodysurfing. The inn itself is very intimate and stylish and is situated in the charming little town of Paia , which despite it`s size has a great selection of cafes and restaurants plus an excellent wine shop and the biggest whole food store in Maui. Of the places we ate in we can recommend the Mambo Cafe ,the Flatbread Company and Jacques which also is a fun spot for dancing on a friday night. The staff of the inn are very friendly and well informed. If you are looking for a quality experience away from the typical impersonal resort hotels this is the one in Maui and it`s right on the doorstep for the lovely coastal drive to Hana

Reviews.Title: “When you visualize the perfect island vacation, your reality is Paia Inn at Paia”
Reviews.Author: surfingduck
Reviews.Content: Amazing staff members, all who are incredibly friendly. The morning coffee from anthony's hit the spot after a happening evening at the FlatBread Company. I have made lasting memories through amazing surf, SUP, Yoga, and friendships. I highly recommend this place. The only hard part is leaving!!! A special thanks to all who made our trip the BEST trip we have been on.

Reviews.Title: “A funky, modern space with class and incredible staff. A must!”
Reviews.Author: Happylight34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove into Paia for 2 nights for our honeymoon and fell in love with the place. It has great and modern decor, amazingly close to white sand beach (in the backyard) and friendly staff. Paia Inn is nestled in the heart of Paia with shops and restaurants within walking distance. Units include a fully functioning kitchen and maid service each morning. The most amazing part of this hotel (apart from the yummy blueberry scones served each morning) was the beach that was just a stone's throw away. Lawn chairs, boogie boards and more were complimentary and provided by the hotel. A place that has paid attention to detail. An incredible place and we will definitely return to the Paia Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: BNY17
Reviews.Content: We missed the Inn during our first pass through Paia on the way to Hana but were very happy to find it on the way back. The staff was charming and very helpful thoughout our stay. The rooms well decorated, extremely comfortable and very quiet -- even with Paia's bustle. Best of all was the Inn's beach which, although public, felt like our own private spot.

Reviews.Title: “This is Paradise...Awesome location, staff and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BACDallas
Reviews.Content: This is truly a "Hidden Gem" right here in Paradise! First of all when I go to Maui I love staying over on the North Shore side of the island and missing all the tourist crowds and that is where the real beauty is in the island. The owners have done a wonderful job with this little paradise and I would say stay here whenever you have the chance. They have very lovely rooms with an exceptional staff always willing to assist with information or suggestions for local things to do. They have access to a lovely little gem of a beach and you can do lots of beach hoping from one to another on long walks. Great place to have a glass of wine as the sun is setting! The rooms were lovely with all the great amenities and touches, we had the 2 bedroom suite and it had a full kitchen, great wireless internet, lovely bath products for your use and nice flat-screen televisions as well (who watches TV in Paradise). Wonderful coffee and pastries in the mornings await you on the patio which is a lovely place to gather and relax or have a glass of wine in the evening. All of the staff is really nice and friendly, thank you Angelina, Jonelle, Nina and most of all Sarah. Paia Fish Market just across the street on the corner is the best place to get the fresh catch of the day from the local fishermen (one of the best meals for the price on the island) and lots of other great cafes and bars in Paia as well. Make sure to make this your place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: moflacon
Reviews.Content: Doesn't look like much from the outside, but was modern, comfortable, and exactly what we needed after a long day in Hana. Staff was courteous and helpful. Wish we could've stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Paradise on Maui's North Shore”
Reviews.Author: PeterJerrod
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent three nights at the Paia Inn and we could not have been more pleased. We stayed in Room 2 from August 28-31 and had an absolutely wonderful experience. It is easy to see why everyone raves about the hotel. Our room had a comfy queen bed with 4 pillows (two firm, two soft) and a small ensuite bathroom. We booked the room back in April and were pleasantly surprised to find that it was written up in the New York Times travel section the following month! We were so excited because we scored a gem! Yes, it is expensive for the price....I believe each night came to $233 with tax....but it was soooo worth it! Our room was not ready when we arrived...apparently they were having an issue with housekeeping and our 3:00 pm check-in was delayed until 4:30. Nonetheless, we spent the time walking around the cute little town of Paia. When we returned, we were greeted warmly by Janelle who offered us a glass of wine or local brew. She then showed us the bath to the beach (about a three-minute walk down a tropical bath between some residences) and set us up with a beach bag with towels for our stay. Everything in the hotel is considered....free wi-fi and use of a computer/printer in the family room, umbrellas for tropical showers, chairs and snorkeling equipment for the beach, and complimentary muffins and coffee in the morning on the patio. The pastries came from Anthony's Coffee Shop across the street -- how do these people not get fat? The muffins and scones were amazing! There are travel books to take with you on your excursions and board games to play during downtime. Each room had a plasma TV and iPort to listen to your favorite tunes. I was worried that the rooms would be a bit noisy and we would hear our neighbors in the other four rooms on our floor, but it was relatively quiet. Our room overlooked the Hana Highway, which was a little noisy in the evening and in the morning with truck traffic, but the hotel provides ear plugs in case you need them! By the way, the bathroom was somewhat small but the shower was decent and I LOVED the bath products that we were given. When the housekeeping failed to restock them on Day 2, Janelle was kind enough to hand us a few days' worth of shampoo, conditioner, and lotion! We loved them so much, we bought a few to take home! I can't forget to mention how wonderful Tina and Nina were as well as Janelle! It's nice to be greeted by the staff in the morning or when you come home after a long day of touring Maui! The only drawbacks were that the room was not as clean as it could have been when we arrived (stained facecloths and food leftover from the previous guests in our mini-fridge) and the hotel floor is kept very warm in the evening. I apologize for touching the thermostat and freezing my neighbors, but trying to fall asleep when the room was close to 80 degrees was quite impossible! If you are looking for a great place to eat, may we recommend two superb restaurants in walking distance. The first is Flatbread Company, which is basically in the same building as the hotel...right around the corner from the entrance. The food here is fresh, fresh, fresh and is made with as many local organic ingredients as possible. We actually ate here two nights, splitting a fresh salad and a flatbread pizza, which is perfect for two. The best part is that the staff (who are extremely friendly) allow you to split the type of flatbread -- we enjoyed the buffalo chicken on one side of the flatbread and eggplant parmesan (yes!) on the other side. Both were perfect! Check out www.flatbreadcompany.com. We also loved the Paia Fish Market, right up the block. The food here is amazingly delicious and fresh. My boyfriend enjoyed a plate of Mahi fish & chips (delicious!) and I had an "Obama Burger" which was made with fresh ono and served with wasabi butter and coleslaw. Heaven! Check them out at www.paiafishmarket.com. According to everyone we met, this was such a better bargain that the expensive Mama's Fish House up the road. What you sacrifice in the view (no ocean vista....more like a picnic) you make up for in service and quality. Add a local beer to your meal to make it even more appetizing! (But skip dessert and head to Ono Gelato down the street.....truly wonderful!) We will definitely be back to the Paia Inn.....it's one of our favorite places to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Small Town Feel of Paia”
Reviews.Author: RiverPlace4
Reviews.Content: We loved the little town of Paia and were very pleased with the Paia Inn Hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a two room condo which was just right for our family of four. Our trip to Paia was a perfect way to start our adventures on Maui. We traveled about 10 hours from Austin, Texas with our two daughters (ages 7 and 11). Our objective after a day of traveling was to hit the beaches and start relaxing once we arrived. Paia was very conveniently located to the airport which reduced any further travel time. We were able to eat lunch and enjoy the beach within walking distance of the hotel. I loved this beach and it may have been one of my favorites on the entire trip. It was great for boogie boarding (Paia Inn provides boards) and splashing in the waves. At low tide there were small pools near the lava rocks were small fish and crabs were hanging out. The girls loved checking this out! The beach was not crowded at all and this was quite nice when compared to some of the other more tourist beaches in front of large hotels. We found several wonderful restaurants, quaint shops and a local grocery store. Another reason to stay the night in Paia is that it is located at the beginning of the Hana Hwy. and helped reduce some of the travel time for us in driving to Hana. We loved it and would definately recommend this hotel to others and we would love to come back on our next trip! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “A place to fill up your lost energies - a relaxing chillout to feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Energyseeker
Reviews.Content: We are still here and enjoy every single hour. The moment you get here you just feel cosy and wouldn't want to change it in the world with one of the big 5* hotel chains I have been to before at Kapalua. This is the place where you really feel welcomed and are not just only a number on a lare opulent hotel floor. The staff is not overdone friendly trained - they are the real thing: charming, honest, very friendly and make you feel beeing at home the minute you get here. The whole place has a beautiful atmosphere, a great spirit and good vibes which you feel in every single corner. We will be back for sure. steffi ortmann [--], from Hamburg, Germanz

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - the quintessential North Shore experience :-)”
Reviews.Author: VerdeVista
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn uniquely delivers the best of Mauiâ€™s enduring North Shore spirit. A sincere mahalo nui loa to Michael and the team (Nina, Janelle, Angelina...) â€“ we had a wonderful experience during our 6-night stay. This beautifully renovated small hotel is perfectly located in the middle of, and integral to, funky Paia town. Everything (shops, dining, entertainment) is within a few minutes walk â€“ yet the Inn provides instant access to a quiet, gorgeous, and nearly private beach. For us, the Paia location was perfect â€“ all the benefits of Paia itself, plus only minutes to Hoâ€™okipa Beach Park, Haiku, or other solitude/playgrounds as appropriate. Or (if you must) ten minutes to the â€œbig cityâ€� accoutrements of Kahului and the Central region. The personality of the Inn is at once refined and yet incredibly laid-back, approachable, and comfortable. The tone is set by a local hands-on owner/architect, superb design (which blends masterfully with the overall feel/flow of the town), careful attention to the small details, and an engaging and helpful staff. This is the best of North Shore charm and lifestyle, in so many ways the happy antithesis of a typical resort experience. We felt as if we were visiting with friends, not paying for accommodations. We recommend the Paia Inn highly, and we look forward to our next visit. Aloha,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic across the board”
Reviews.Author: DJCenturion
Reviews.Content: Very accomodating, aware of what I needed and wanted every time I spoke with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Visit”
Reviews.Author: MauiTurtleFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of their 2 br units and it was great - clean and modern, full modern kitchen, nicely decorated. Very easy beach access, they lend you beach toys & boogie boards, plenty of beach towels. Staff was very friendly. This is a great place and close to the start of the the road to Hana and also your trip up the volcano. Their free parking was easy to use. I would live their if I could!!! The 2 BR unit was plenty big enough for me, my wife, and 3 kids.

Reviews.Title: “The Paia Inn is an absolute gem....!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerAsia
Reviews.Content: I really loved my stay at the Paia Inn and look forward to the next visit. I should preface this by saying that I have stayed at a number of fantastic hotels on Maui....from the Kea Lani, The Ritz Carlton, The Marriott Wailea (well, not so fantastic!), the Grand Wailea and I even got married at the Four Seasons. But of these hotels, the one I most look forward to returning to is the Paia Inn which is absolutely charming From the moment you walk into the Paia Inn, you are greeted by a fantastic staff who greet you like you were an old friend. The staff was so nice that you actually wanted to take them to dinner (I mean that). Thank you Nina and Tina! They couldn't have been more helpful. And the owners are around a lot. I watched one guest try to tip the cooly dressed "bellman," only to discover that the bellman was actually the owner (no, he wouldn't take the tip!). The hotel rooms are very comfortable, but not extremely large, but they are really well appointed with iPhone docks, large plasma TV's, and had extremely comfortable beds with great linens. All the rooms had rather cool art on the walls, all original and the furnishings throughout the hotel help give it a distinctive feel. This is not a cookie cutter hotel.
