I was able to try a few different rooms as the hotel was sold out on two of the nights I was there, so I had to check out of the hotel before I came back, so I ended up staying both in upstairs rooms and also in one of the one bedroom suites along the side of the hotel that had a very handy kitchen (there is a well stocked market a half a block away). The hotel has a private pathway to the beach, so from your room to the beach is less than a one minute walk which is great for someone like me who always forgets something in the room which I don't realize until I get to the beach! The hotel is nestled right in the heart in the charming town of Paia which is filled with great little stores and restaurants and coffee houses. You can walk next door to Flatbread restaurant for a meal (really great pizza!) or go to the Paia Fish Market (across the street), or go to Jacques for sushi and a good bar scene, or walk directly across the street to Anthony's coffee (which has to be my favorite coffee houses anywhere and they serve a great breakfast and lunch). And even though the Paia Inn serves complimentary coffee and muffins from Anthony's on the hotel patio every morning, I also loved hanging out at Anthony's some mornings for coffee as it offers great people watching. The town buzzes with tourists by day, but in the mornings and again in the evenings, it reverts much more to an old town feel but with a really interesting locals mix. Two Thanksgivings ago I was in Maui and ended up passing through Paia, where I caught Willie Nelson playing a full set at a local Paia honky tonk bar, which he is said (??) to own a piece of (I forget the name of the bar/club but it's still there, right next to Jacques). And just ten minutes or so up the road from Paia is Mama's Fish House Restaurant, where we seem to end up on most trips.... It's touristy, but the food is always excellent. I see why the New York TImes recommended this hotel, as it's the kind of hotel where if you come here once, you'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Trip”
Reviews.Author: Rakar
Reviews.Content: A very beautiful hotel in Maui. The rooms were beautifully decorated. Easy access to the beach. The staff was very friendly. Many good restaurants nearby. Priced appropriately for the Luxurious enviroment. You may just want to relax at the hotel and the beach. I agree with NY times Article. It is a quite a place to be.

Reviews.Title: “the friendliest place you'll ever find”
Reviews.Author: RazzMarlborough
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paia Inn for five nights during August 2009. While the room was well appointed it was a bit on the small side however the cheerful and funky way the whole place has been decorated gives the place a very comfortable feel. But it is the staff who really make this place come alive. They are so friendly and amenible and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. We cannot say enough about them. Even the owner, Mike, pops in on a daily basis to make sure everyone is happy. The other point is that Paia itself is a great place to base yourself while in Maui. It is a trendy little town with a number of good dining options and some good cafes. it is also well located being only a ten minute drive from the airport and at the start of the Hana Highway. We highly reccommend Paia Inn and Paia itself to you. Steve Riley and Leslie Hamersley Marlborough, New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Simply Exquisite in every aspect.”
Reviews.Author: nevans2004
Reviews.Content: Tucked inconspicuously behind an art gallery, the Paia Inn reception area hints at its elegant interior. Arriving early, and ill from the high altitude of sunrise at the crater, Janelle at the registration desk, with the owner's encouragement, was able to have the room cleaned at once, allowing us much needed rest and recovery in our room's cool, calm, and comfortable surroundings. King size bed, full couch, tall armoire, flat screen TV, and more fit easliy within the spacious unit. Two sets of French doors, one opening onto a foliage enclosed porch, bring the outside in. Uniquely set up, blending antiquity with modernity, spiced with original works of art, Paia Inn is Maui's hidden pearl. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfortable. Felt like home.”
Reviews.Author: lekilinebraska
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. Researched on line and found Paia Inn. What a find. Very quiet and small. It was very romantic. We loved the location and Paia is a very neat town. We just walked around in the evening and enjoyed all the little shops and restaurants. The only draw back was getting to the beach. Very narrow walking path and steep slope to get to the beach. Not easily accessible. Staff was very friendly. Made you feel right at home. Highly recommend Paia Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: travelers98
Reviews.Content: My husband found the Paia Inn on the internet. We needed a place to stay for two nights before returning to the mainland. I was a bit skeptical but was pleasantly surprised. The inn is a small boutique hotel in the middle of Paia that understands the meaning of customer service. From the minute we arrived we were treated like kings and given everything we needed with a smile. Nina was fantastic. We stayed in the junior suite which was very comfortable. It was great staying in the middle of town, never had to move the car. The beach is beautiful. We highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable boutique Inn”
Reviews.Author: IndyCyndi
Reviews.Content: If you have done the Maui resort experience or don't desire the masses, this is THE PLACE to stay. My husband and I live on Oahu so we have made several trips to Maui. We had two couples flying in from the mainland and one of them found the Paia Inn so we all met up there for a weekend. To say this hotel is charming is selling it short. The rooms are chic and comfortable, staff is incredible and this is the first hotel in years where I have actually taken advantage of the mini bar because everything is reasonably priced. Already planning a trip back in August to stay at the Inn and drive the Hana Highway. Trying to squeeze in as many stays as we can because once the masses know about this place, it will be impossible to get a room.

Reviews.Title: “truly a hidden gem in the heart of a true beach town...”
Reviews.Author: LauraFresh
Reviews.Content: We loved the Paia Inn - while searching for a place to stay near Maui's local yoga shala I discovered this true hidden gem. With only five rooms, we got first class attention, service...and privacy. Nina was terrific in helping us find ideal snorkel spots and beaches - we loved the hotel's location right in the center of the town and that we could access the wonderful places to eat and visit right from our front door. The room we stayed in was rather tight, so next time (and there WILL BE A NEXT TIME!!!) would opt for a larger suite - if you are traveling very light, however, our small room was economical and perfectly acceptable. Paia is not for everyone, though, so if you are looking for the kinds of amenities a resort has or the tourist spots for eating/shopping stick to the other side of the island. If you appreciate more of the homespun, real Maui surf-town experience, do not miss a chance to spend a night or more at the Paia Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly laid-back, friendly and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Smurf62
Reviews.Content: Was great to have found a lovely and affordable place to stay in the vicinity of wonderful seafood - the Mahi Mahi was the highlight!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect "dream home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: MMarve
Reviews.Content: We had an unbelievable time at the Paia Inn Hotel! How they managed to create the perfect balance between a resort get-away vacation and the comforts of home is perfection! The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating. The room was cozy yet luxurious. The beach was was truly your own! And the details...from the local artwork hanging on the walls, to the beach gear conveniently hung along the private beach walkway. Without giving it all away I can say that anyone who stays there will be more than impressed! We also took stand up paddling lessons with Dao...She was great! Thank you for an amazing stay and giving us a key to your place in paradise! Mahalo Nui Loa, Kathy & Rich Ryan, New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “A+++ Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kgoff
Reviews.Content: This was EXACTLY what my wife and I wanted. We arent ones for big resorts, where folks wait on you hand and foot, and you spend most of your time on campus. Instead, we like to venture out and explore. And of course, Maui is the perfect place to do this, and Paia Inn was a perfect home base and launchpad. Paia is gateway to the amazing Road to Hana (free advice: rent a CONVERTIBLE! And have the deli next door pack you a nice picnic lunch). Its at the base of Mount Haleakala (and only crazy people visit Maui without driving up the 10,000 foot volcano). Its a short hop to stunning Iao Valley, and not too far from the aquarium, snorkel trip marina, and Kihei resort area. However, its a bit of a haul over to the Lahaina resort area (gorgeous drive, though). As for Paia Inn itself, we LOVED it. Very hip atmosphere, artwork, and decor. Squeaky clean. Ultra-comfy bed. Friendly, helpful staff. Nice quiet beach out back; but be aware its on the windward side of the isle, okay for swimming but not a placid lagoon-like, snorkel-friendly beach like those on the other side. Rooms are small, but we had the suite and were completely comfortable for 9 days straight. Parking was can-of-sardines tight, but the staff takes care of that for you. Understand that this is a VERY small hotel, in the center of a very cool little town, with swell shops, wide variety of restaurants, fabulous food. If a giant seaside resort is what you want, this aint it. Otherwise 5-star, no lie.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable elegance with an amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Polishgal7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paia Inn for a wedding and had a great time. The staff is very helpful and Paia is a great place to stay to enjoy the local culture.

Reviews.Title: “Charming. Intimate. Casual. Welcoming. Cozy. Contemporary.”
Reviews.Author: austinboomerang
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Hawaii so I wanted to sample a few different sides to Maui and Oahu. This little inn in this little town won our hearts over, hands down. What may be surprising is that competition to win our favor is the Ritz on the west side of Maui and the Outrigger on Waikiki Beach. The price at the Ritz was more than double the Paia Inn, and yet the Paia delivered better service and a much more welcoming ambiance. When we arrived, we were shown to our room and immediately were reminded of the quaint offbeat hotels that we stayed at during our honeymoon trip to Italy many years ago because the building is somewhat narrow but the space is well used. On the second floor, there is an open area with comfy charis, IPod dock (in our room too!), a computer desk with free computer access, guidebooks and games free for borrowing, and interesting art. The best part is that when someone else is coming to/from their rooms, you are likely to strike up a conversation. The same goes for the welcoming area at reception area and the courtyard where evening wine and morning coffee are offered gratis. We met a few interesting people there which only makes the experience richer. Our room was all that we needed in a hotel room. It struck me as odd that there is a large flat screen t.v. because I couldn't imagine that someone would want to watch t.v. but my husband saw it differently and was grateful to have something to watch while I got ready to go to the beach/go to dinner, etc. There is a wonderful coffee shop across the street which we didn't discover until we were on the way out of town (we stayed only 2 days). It is the shop that supplies the Inn with the morning goodies in the courtyard as part of your stay at the Inn. The scones, muffins, and coffee were all delicious. The stock was not plentiful (hint) and we were conscious at not eat more than one small scone lest someone else awaken hungry. We had plenty of food choices--tapas menu at a Mediterranean restaurant, fish market, etc, but we opted both nights to eat at Jacques. The first time was by luck of the draw; the second time was by demand. Along with very generous portions, they offered something I had not found for a very long time---squid in ink sauce. yum! The biking excursion down the mountain began and ended in Paia, so it was awfully convenient to stay at the Inn when we had to crawl out of bed to meet the others at the biking place at 3 a.m. (sunrise watching at the crater required us to awaken this early). Although we had plenty to keep us entertained (including down time at the beach), if you plan to stay for more than 2-3 days, I recommend renting a car. This way, you can go about the island as you please and return each day to this wonderful gem in the Pacific. p.s. To give a balanced and fair review, I have to mention the only noteworthy bummer I could recall and that was beach access (from the Inn to the beach is a path that leads you past the cottage that is in between the Inn and the beach, so there is no ocean view from the hotel). It is limited to certain hours. Sure put a damper on our desire to sit on the beach and watch the sun rise :(

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!!”
Reviews.Author: PaigeRichey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as one stopping point on our honeymoon. The location is fabulous if you want to get a taste for the locals. We enjoyed many of the restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The staff was extremely helpful. Everything was clean and spotless - we will definitely be coming back when we are in Maui again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: drsoul
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews here on TA, and the arguments about whether the posted reviews were real or fake, we decided to do the smart thing and see for ourselves by booking a few nights at the Paia Inn Hotel. We travel annually to Maui and generally stay at the Four Seasons Resort or, if we feel like making the drive, the Hotel Hana-Maui. We wanted to get a different feel for the island, and we really enjoy spending one of our days on the island shopping, eating, and hanging out in Paia, so we thought staying there before moving on to the Four Seasons would be a nice way to break up the trip. We stayed at the Paia Inn Hotel for five days. It was an absolutely wonderful time. We booked the larger of the rooms available, and that was a good idea considering the number of bags we had. Some rooms are smaller than others so if you have a lot of bags, or require a lot of space, make sure to book the suite or a larger room. Everything about our room was great - the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable - perfect for my taste (not too soft or too hard). Small bottles of shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel are provided and replenished throughout your stay. The products are excellent. There is no elevator, and since the property feels like you are staying in a B&B, one has to walk up a flight of stairs to get to the rooms. Not a problem for us, but something to consider if you don't like stairs or have a lot of luggage. The lobby is a great spot to relax and gather. There is a large LCD television with a rolling montage of photos of the property and "Island" music playing in the courtyard and in the lobby. The staff is friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable of the area and things to do and places to eat. Two restaurants I recommend are the Paia Fish Market, across the street, and Flatbread Pizza Company, just two doors down. There is a stocked mini-bar in every room, scones, tea, and coffee provided in the courtyard every morning by Anthony's Coffee House (which is just across the street and also provides room service), and, as I mention above, great restaurants nearby and a fabulous natural grocery store a block away (Mana Foods). A couple of days we went to the grocery store and got some things to eat in the tree and umbrella-shaded courtyard of the hotel. Wonderful. Paia Inn Hotel also offers private access to a beach just behind the property. They have beach chairs for use and a shed that has body boards and other beach-related paraphernalia for use. One can also store a surfboard or paddle board in the shed for safe-keeping. Speaking of safe, this property is safe and secure and we felt very much at home here. Each guest room has a parking space right on property and there is a surf shop with an excellent instructor (Tom) right next door. Other things of note about the property - hardwood floors throughout, excellent and prompt housekeeping, complimentary wireless access throughout the property, a computer, printer, and fax machine with Skype set-up; iHome in each room and an upstairs "living area" with magazines, travel guides, a business center, and music playing on a separate iHome system from an iPod. Also provided is a weekly rundown sheet of daily activities in Paia at surrounding galleries, shops, and nightclubs so that guests can get out and explore the town and all that it offers by the locals. And while they don't have a fitness center on-site, they do have a relationship with a gym nearby for those needing such facilities. The front desk is staffed until 10 PM, but a manager lives on property and any requests can be immediately attended to. As an example of the lengths the front desk will go to to assist its guests, we had a foot injury while surfing one morning. The staff called a convenient care facility, called another doctor, went to a store to purchase medical supplies, and followed-up with us later that day to insure that we were ok and that we did not need further medical attention. Definitely above and beyond the call of desk duty, particularly for something that happened off property through no fault or involvement of the Paia Inn Hotel. I would highly recommend Paia Inn Hotel to anyone looking to stay at a new, urbane, hip property with attention to details, friendly and young staff, and one who is looking for an experience that allows you to "live with the locals", as one can in Paia. It's an especially lovely place for solo travelers and couples of all ages. I really like this property and will definitely return the next time I am on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “awesome boutique hotel with best vibe in maui”
Reviews.Author: hyperion1978
Reviews.Content: This great boutique hotel is very different to most of the big resort type accommodations elsewhere in the more touristy parts of Maui. Service is fantastic, staff and owner are very friendly and will go out of there way to be helpful. The hotel itself was brand new when I stayed (for 6 days) having been open for less than a year. The room I stayed in (the deluxe one) was a bit on the small side (it is an old building that was completely renovated) but was beautifully laid out and furnished. The hotel is right next to a fantastic beach which was not busy at all when I was there (there are no other hotels in town so only a few locals were using the beach). Paia itself has a chilled surfer vibe to it with some great restaurants and bars. Having stayed in Wailea before I can say that Paia is the best town on the island and is not just tourist orientated. Its also brilliantly located for watersports - I was there for kitesurfing and surfing - the hotel can recommend some great instructors for both of those. The only slight issue I would highlight is that the cheaper rooms are on the front of the building which is right in the middle of the town. The location is a plus point for me as it means you are really close to restaurants etc. but light sleepers would be better off going for one of the more expensive rooms which are set back from the road and would be totally sheltered form any noise. Overall highly recommended and is good value compared to the prices of some of the bigger resorts in Wailea

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss it!”
Reviews.Author: avisantabarbara
Reviews.Content: This was a true find! We were not aware that Paia offered a perfect place to stay only 15-20 minutes from the airport, with its own beach access, and a ton of charm! This is a perfect place to stay for an entire visit to Maui or to access the beaches near Kihei, go upcountry to Kula or Haleakala, or head off east to Hana. We suggest avoiding room one which is a bit claustrophobic and airless, but the other rooms are gems.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!! Friendly, helpful staff, great room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: nardo2323
Reviews.Content: My fiancee, Kristen & I had the pleasure of staying in one of the Jr. Suites a couple of days ago, and I just had to write my first review ever. It was so nice! I had called ahead and arranged for an anniversary surprise for my lady, and the staff came through with flying colors... And so Reasonable!!!! Moet Chandon on ice waiting for us, bouquet of gorgeous local flowers, flower petals scattered on the bed... Just so special... The suite had a separate living area w flatscreen, the bedroom was clean with a super cozy bed... Just great!!! Thank you guys so much for an incredible time!!! Next time, I plan on staying a LOT longer.

Reviews.Title: “If you go to Maui, dont Miss Paia and the Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: Lainba
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the paia Inn and loved every minute. The location is fantastic, great access to a beautiful beach. The staff are so friendly and helpful and will set you up with any equipment, gear, whatever you need to enjoy the beach or explore Maui, The patio is a great place to hang out in the evenings, breakfast is laid back and casual. The rooms are charming, and have all very best in linens, technology and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: maxsmart_9
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for activities, beach time, shopping and dining. Great restaurants within steps of the hotel. The best beaches on Maui right in the back yard. Everything you need and want in a hotel, AND the best service in town.

Reviews.Title: “Paia Inn is the best combination of a resort, B&B and home!”
Reviews.Author: billina16
Reviews.Content: Paia Inn is the place to stay in Maui! Not only is it located right downtown, where you can walk to dinner, art galleries, the beach, etc, but Paia Inn is chic, has all the amenities of home, and employs an incredible staff. What I love most about the Paia Inn: â€¢ Friendly, resourceful and cheerful staff â€¢ Flowers left on our bed pillows â€¢ Delicious body lotion, wash, shampoo and conditioner in the room â€¢ Private beach access with cozy lounging chairs and umbrellas â€¢ Attention to detail in common areas and the rooms My husband and I only stayed at the Paia Inn for one night and regret the short stay (we stayed the night before driving to Hana). Next time weâ€™re on Maui, you will find us at the Paia Inn for closer to a week! If you are planning a trip to Maui, staying at the Paia Inn is a necessity! It was our favorite part of our trip! I wish there were Innâ€™s just like this one in every town in the island!

Reviews.Title: “If you appreciate style, beauty, and serenity...you REALLY have to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: marissaruns
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn provided, for my husband and myself, the most unique hotel experience we've ever had. The place itself is full of style, hip and comfortable furniture, local artwork, great music, and the most gorgeous, helpful cast of characters; ranging from the housekeeping staff to the proprietor. We had planned to stay only one night on our way to another hotel, but changed our plans to stay the remainder of our vacation right there, adding 5 nights! We had everything we needed/wanted and more. The beach is so close, so perfect, and we fell in love with the eclectic, laid-back town. Can't wait to go back, truly heartsick about leaving.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KiteWindSeeker
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Paia Inn while kiteboarding in Maui. I can't say enough good things about my experience. It deserves high praise. The location is ideal, right in the middle of a great little surf town that has miraculously escaped the sprawl of many other beach towns and only 10 minutes from Kite Beach and 5 minutes from Ho'okipa Beach. Guests enjoy easy walking access to 10-15 restaurants and cafes, along with a similar number of stores with art, craftwork and clothing. A quiet beach is easily accessed from the property by a private walkway. I found the staff bright and cheerful, exceeding expectations and looking for ways to enhance my experience. It was like I was a guest in a friend's home. I commend Michael, Tina, Angelina, Nina and Sarah for their warm hospitality - it was refreshing and appreciated. The Inn has been well appointed with a decorator's attention to detail and modern comforts. Bold and colorful local art works hang on the walls. Spa quality bath products from Maui's own Love Inside Out are provided and smell great. Linens and towels are also high quality. Tropical Plumeria flowers are placed near the sink and windows, giving the room a gentle and relaxed island feeling as the trade winds cool the room. WiFi access is robust and simple, and a pair of workstations with printer are provided in the lounge area should you need them. Coffee and muffins are provided in the courtyard lounge each morning (a great way to start the day early if you're still adjusting to the timezone) I also enjoyed breakfast at Cafe des Amis and Anthony's, just across the street. A number of options are available for lunch and dinner. I particularly enjoyed Jacques and Flatbread Company, both just steps away. I have stayed in many grand hotels around the world but none have matched the relaxed and friendly character, comfort and hospitality of the Paia Inn. I highly recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome gem in wonderful, quirky Paia”
Reviews.Author: Mauilover_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 9 days in Maui and Paia was our favourite. I had booked 2 nights there, before driving to Hana for 3 nights. Our original plan was to use Paia as our base for hiking in the crater at Haleakala (incredible). Paia was such a fun little place, we wished we had booked longer. This beautiful little boutique hotel is perfect and I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else. Michael, the owner, leads by example. He is attentive to your every need, providing information on where to eat, what to see and when to do it. His stamp is on everything, from the beautiful relaxing courtyard, with soft jazz playing in the background, and romantic lighting in the evening. The plants, waterfall and intricately carved door all add to the ambience. The staff at Paia Inn are equally attentive. Our room had everything you need. The kitchen was well stocked. There is a flat screen tv, not that we had time to ever look at it. Loved the complimentary shampoo and conditioner, made right here in Maui. The hand written note welcoming us to our room was a nice touch, no doubt one of Michael's ideas. Coffee, tea and muffins are available every morning in the courtyard. There is wireless internet for those of us who can't completely get away from work, also cool for staying in touch with the kids back home. The beach was lovely. Unfortunately we only had time for a quick peek. I highly recommend staying here but try to do it for at least 3 days. This will give you time to visit the volcano and unwind in this fun little town. We enjoyed Cafe Des Amis, excellent shrimp curry, but you have to ask for the hot chutney. They charge extra for this, not nice in my opinion. Lovely little coffee shops to enjoy as well. Plus your usual tourist shops. Mama's Fish House is nearby. While our fish was surprisingly and dissappointingly bland, the whole experience was worth it, and one we will do again. Expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “best little Hotel on the North shore”
Reviews.Author: tumbledownColorado
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night. The staff was very freindly. They took time to give us a tour of the Hotel and the beach. The location is great. It's on the Main street of town. The rooms are small but comfortable. The street side might get a little noisey on the weekend but the rooms have double pane windows and sound insulation. There is a great beach just a short walk from the Hotel. it has a great lobby and internet room. They have parking and that's a must in Paia. We'll surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Paia Inn: Awesome Hip Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NatureCat
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a long weekend and drive to Hana. First, we wanted to make a stop in Paia. We love this little beach town with all it's charm, cool restaurants & shops. We are SO glad we chose to stay at the Paia Inn. We stayed in the Junior Suite, which has a sitting room with a loveseat, flatscreen tv, fridge, sink & dishes. Right outside our room was a common area with comfy chairs, desktop computers & travel books to read. This hotel is spotless & very comfortable. The bed was so great that we both slept like rocks. No noise at all. Every room is decorated top notch and includes gorgeous paintings by Avi Kiritary. In the morning, you can sit outside in the quaint courtyard and enjoy complimentary coffee & muffins from Anthony's Coffee House. During "beach hours" you can walk the path behind the hotel right to a great beach. After hours, it's just a 10 minute walk down the sidewalk from the front of the hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed this boutique hotel so much that we were kind of disappointed when we checked into a "higher ranked" hotel the next day. If you are considering visiting Paia, I would definitely check out the Paia Inn. Not only does the town have a lot to offer, but the Paia Inn will make your visit even more enjoyable. We felt completely relaxed there & will go back many times!

Reviews.Title: “Paia Inn Hotel-Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: wavehunterz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Junior Suite in the Paia Inn with our 10 month old baby last weekend and it was fabulous! It's a GREAT location right next to tons of great little places to eat, wonderfully designed (really well thought-out with a private walkway to the beach, a great place to lock up surfboards, nice morning snacks/coffee/tea, totally casual atmosphere yet everyone is super nice and helpful). They have many room options that we got to tour. We would highly recommend it and hope to stay there longer and try out the 1 bedroom cottage on our next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more friendly.”
Reviews.Author: RandBTravelers
Reviews.Content: Paia is cool all by itself, but this hotel brings it to a new level. We were greeted by a friendly staff who rushed to help us with our bags. There was a hand-written note in our room making sure we knew we should ask if we needed anything at all. We only stayed two nights, but that was enough time for Grant to give us the low-down on the town & Jonelle to share her ice cream while we relaxed in the lovely courtyard. The owner even let us use a room after check-out so that we would have someplace to hang out before our late flight back to Austin. The hotel itself is very clean & new. Very modern & chic yet not at all intimidating. We will be back & recommend this town & hotel to everyone. Thank you for a wonderful few days!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't possibly ask for more in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kboyer16
Reviews.Content: This hip, trendy boutique hotel in sleepy Paia is a real find! The decor is an eclectic mix of Asian and Pacific Islander and it totally works. We were greeted in the parking lot by the front desk attendant who directed us to a spot in their small lot. She then escorted us inside and got us checked in quickly and efficiently. We were offered water or a glass of wine, which was perfect cause we had just completed the 4 hour return trip from Hana. Our room was cozy, but bright and airy at the same time. There is a great common area in the middle of the 5 rooms that has internet access and a variety of travel guides. We spent some relaxing time in the courtyard after dinner and shopping in Paia, everything was just steps away. Management has truly thought of everything to make this a charming and attractive property, right down to the coffee and muffins that are delivered each morning. Will definitely recommend to friends and family and will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel in Paia”
Reviews.Author: TrippyDallas
Reviews.Content: We wanted to experience the â€œhippie surfing townâ€� of Paia, so began our trip there. Our initial evening was booked at the Paia Inn right in town â€“ a spiffy little â€œboutique hotelâ€� with only about five rooms. It is tiny but immaculately clean, with interesting art work, luscious linens, wood floors and good attendance by the staff. A continental breakfast is available in the morning in the lovely enclosed zen-like patio, and private beach access is also a plus. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ksmith19
Reviews.Content: Incredibly friendly staff, great location close to really good restaurants and beach. Hotel has lots of extras that make a difference. Room is very comfortable with high end linnens, towels (including beach towels) and shower stuff. Minibar fridge with good stuff. Small bathroom. Off location gym access 15 minute drive away. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel - Best Hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: mrbeachpad
Reviews.Content: Super Hip Hotel with features you usually only hear about from your best friends. This is destined to become a sure favorite for the stylish and adventurous traveler looking for a pleasing, superb vacation. Outstanding design, lavish artwork from renowned artist Avi Kiriaty. This perfectly placed hotel oozes with personality, passion, and authenticity. It is sure to become a cult favorite for the experienced traveler wanting that something unique, something special. We stayed in the Junior Suite and loved it. Top quality beds, linens, antiques, quiet, 42 inch LCD, ultra clean and comfortable. Gorgeous staff, Chic rooms, quality in every detail. From the front desk welcoming us with Smiles, to the housekeeping asking us personally what special needs we had, the ultra personalized vibe and suggestions on where to dine, to the world-class beachesâ€¦. The Paia Inn has Flair with superb service. We have already booked our return for next month. Thank you Nina, you have a wondeful staff, thanks Jonelle you are fun, thanks Tina for all the laughs. We have already booked our trip back in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Chill Out at the Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: jce711
Reviews.Content: We have been to Hawaii numerous times and stayed in large resorts. Our stay at the Paia Inn surpassed all previous trips in terms of rest, relaxation, and fun. We felt we were in the "real" Hawaii, not a corporate idea of what a tourist to Maui would desire. The inn is on the main road in Paia, a super cute town on the windy side of the island. All of the staff were friendly and helpful, showing us to the beach, getting extra towels, and replacing a lightbulb. We stayed in room 6, a suite with a kitchen and sitting room which was spacious and comfortable. My ONLY suggestion is more towel racks (to save towels that don't need laundering) and lots of hooks for bathing suits and rain jackets. The decor is chic, like how your hip, world-trotting friend would decorate her cottage by the ocean. They have chairs, mats, and boogie boards for guests to use, and tea and coffee are available in the lobby most of the day. Virtually steps away are many good restaurants to choose from: Paia Fish Market (I daresay we liked it as much as Mama's Fish House!), Flatbread, Mambo Cafe, Moana Cafe and Bakery (don't get too lazy to walk the extra block to get there), OnoGelato (once a day, just like in Italy) and Anthony's (open at 6am for those up early on mainland time). Also close by is Mana Foods, a cool supermarket with lots of organic fruits and veg, as well as some tasty looking prepared items. Our room had two wall AC units, but we never used them, the ceiling fans were perfect. The kitchen was equipped with dishes, pots, pans, etc in case one wanted to cook. Our bed was super comfy after our days of snorkeling, swimming, and hiking. If your idea of a good time in Hawaii does not involve standing in lines, swimming up to a pool bar, paying for a lawn chair on the beach while people walk by to sell you drinks, then consider the Paia Inn. The most fun thing we did was take a stand up paddle board lesson with Maria Souza. Her pamphlet is at the hotel and the staff endorsed her enthusiastically. She called us right back to schedule and called again before the lesson to make sure we wanted to do it even though it was raining on and off. We warmed up on the beach, then went out on the boards in a protected cove about 5 minutes from the Inn. My husband and I both got it: we were standing on the boards, paddling and turning. Maria is so passionate about the ocean and teaching people how to get out there. It was an inspiration to meet her and I would encourage Everyone going to Maui to take a paddleboarding or surfing lesson with her. So: Paia Inn + paddleboarding with Maria = perfect vacation Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “attention to detail boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: flasp
Reviews.Content: After one week in Hana, this was our best choice for an overnight staying since it's close to the airport. The Paâ€™ia Inn is the perfect definition of a boutique hotel: A very friendly and kind staff; Small but very cozy bedroom and free internet, plus a printer for your boarding passes. On one side, a pleasant stroll through a "maze" to a beautiful white sand and laid-back beach; and, on the other side, hip shops, cafes and restaurants. I loved the decor and the total attention to detail, especially in the bathroom - and you can tell a lot about hotels and restaurants just looking at the bathrooms. I also was delighted with their made in Maui products for the bathroom: â€œLove Inside Outâ€�. We certainly recommend the Paia Inn Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: twomaruns
Reviews.Content: This was a delightfully surprising gem! The inn is centrally located with private beach access. While the rooms are more European in nature, the beautiful electic decor with original artwork, free internet (pc and skype too!), free breakfast, and friendly, helpful staff more than make up for the small size. A truly great find!

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ccht
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Our two bedroom suite was nice. The bedrooms were too crowded with the free standing closet. We had to dress outside in the living room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking was not convenient. Trying to access our room with my 93 year old mother was difficult. She was fearful of walking at night on the stone path, so she elected to stay in the room and not attend the rehearsal party. We tried to park in the back for just 10 minutes so she did not have to walk so far but the neighbor complained and the staff moved our car. When I arrived with my mother, the car was moved so we had to return to the room and start over. Parking is going to continue to be an issue for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Maui needs more places like the Paia Inn!”
Reviews.Author: dutchy7
Reviews.Content: It seems so rare to find stylish hidden gems right by the beach on Maui. As far as I can tell, most near-ocean real estate is taken up by the big resorts, so the 'boutique' hotel revolution hasn't been able to exist much on Maui. Enter Paia Inn! The hotel and rooms are tiny (don't come here expecting expansive suites!), but almost every detail has been thoughtfully designed and executed. The rooms are tranquil, stylish, and comfortable. The staff is great! There's not a lot of room for parking, so cars have to double up and then the staff moves the cars around when someone needs access. Constant valet service! Not to mention the gracious answers to all our questions and helpful recommendations. Everyone was wonderfully hip and casual, but perfectly professional at all times - We felt like we'd been invited to stay in the guest quarters of the most 'with it' friends-of-friends on the island! Honestly, Paia was the most fun of our whole trip. Forget Whaler's Village and the other malls, the town of Paia has the best shops and restaurants and galleries around, plus it feels like a real community where residents and tourists mix happily - and, I assume, profitably. The concentration of good, interesting, and affordable places to eat in Paia has to be the best on the island. The gelato place a couple doors down is fantastic too! No, Paia Inn is not right on the sand, but a 30 second walk down a lovely private path will take you to beautiful beaches with lots of great surf. We loved it. I only had two teensy complaints: The room needed a wastebasket in addition to the tiny one in the bathroom; and there was a very bright streetlamp right outside our window that the blinds couldn't eliminate. I suspect only our room (rm 3) had the streetlamp problem, though. Both not a big deal, and easily fixed. Overall, we had a blast at the Paia Inn, and in Paia in general. We'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Posh boutique stay in a true Maui town!”
Reviews.Author: snik1983
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 month old and myself found the Paia Inn while roaming through Paia, a gorgeous and vibrant little town on the Road to Hana. It is located behind and above an art gallery, which sets the tone for the hip and eclectic nature of the hotel. You enter through a courtyard, filled with trees, and a few tables to hang out at. The courtyard has many beautiful accents including a water feature and some sculptural pieces. The lobby is set up with a luxurious sofa and a side table set with breakfast goodies and a ton of Maui info. The hotel staff is THE most helpful and courteous I've ever dealt with. These ladies went out of their way to give us good suggestions, and to ensure that we were as comfortable as can be. The room we had was a bit small, but sumptuously decorated, with ultra modern furniture and a huge flat screen tv atop an amoire. The mini fridge was fully stocked, and the bed was plenty high enough to stow luggage under. We were pleasantly surprised by the high end toiletries we found in the gorgeous bathroom attached to our room! The shampoo and conditioner was so yummy, I bought extra in the lobby! We had such a good vibe from the hotel that we decided to forego the fancy dinner and instead grabbed a pizza from Flatbread Pizza (around the corner, MUST check it out) and we ate in the courtyard. We set ourselves up with dirty martinis and had the lobby girl put on some soothing jazz. The setting was romantic, just the sound of the bubbling water and the cooing baby. It was a great night. After checking out, we were already on the Ferry when the lobby girl from Paia Inn called to tell us that the housekeeper had found a burp cloth that we had left behind. When I explained that we couldn't come back for it she offered to mail it to us! Sure enough a week after leaving, the burp cloth came back in the mail along with a little note letting me know that they had washed it. How nice!!! Paia Inn is first class all the way, especially when it comes to service.

Reviews.Title: “What staying in Maui should be like”
Reviews.Author: tbryant80
Reviews.Content: This is the place that I will stay every time in Maui given the opportunity. The staff was super friendly, the town of Paia is so laid-back that you can't help but slow down and relax. We stayed in the Veranda House which was just perfect - huge deck on the back (hence the name) that we took our coffee and scones up to every morning with a sweet little view of the water. The decor was very nice and modern, free wi-fi, ping pong table, and great cheap (for Maui) restaurants right across the street and down the block. Only bummer is the weather can be more dicey on the north shore, so we had more rain and wind then I'm used to. Small gripes through for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “You never stumble over anything good unless you are moving.”
Reviews.Author: mrmalibone
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff. Friendly, family atmosphere, like old friends. Cooperative attitudes and a big smile every where you look. They make up for any "opening jitters" with a great sense of humor, style and kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, cute boutique hotel in quaint town”
Reviews.Author: lwong76
Reviews.Content: Cute little boutique hotel tucked in a quaint town. Staff was extremely friendly - front desk had a petite red-head all too eager to help me carry my luggage up the flight of stairs. Gave me and my friend a tour of the amenities, free internet. Nice communal area but could use a coffee table or two to make it more user-friendly. Rooms are quite small but are fully-stocked (and well labeled) with extra supplies - beach towels, paper towels, toilet paper. Housekeeping staff was very prompt! Loved the extra hands-on service. Only drawback was that it was slightly noisy as you can hear foot and road traffic from our room - first morning there and I was awake at 7am.

Reviews.Title: “Fun alternative accoms on Maui's North Shore”
Reviews.Author: rlf_vancity
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn is the polar opposite of the big tourist hotels on Maui's West and South sides....if you are looking for a pool scene and a traditional hotel, keep looking. On the other hand, if you are independent and want to experience something real in Maui...stay in Paia at the Paia Inn. Paia is a strange little town with interesting people, a mish-mash of shops and restaurants, and is more Maui than Wailea, Kaanapali and Lahaina added up. All of my favorite restaurants in Maui are located nearby...Hailiimaile General Store, Flatbread, Mama's, Ono Gelato and Paia Fishmarket. The town is noisy, busy and has life. There is not an ABC store in sight (!!). The Paia Inn captures the Paia's vibe perfectly...it is hippie-shabby chic modern, new, unpretentious and over the top when it comes to service. Yes, the rooms are small - if you have traveled to Europe you will see similarities. However, the rooms are comfortable, new and modern. Great fixtures, lots of natural light and comfy bedding. The public areas make up for the lack of space in the rooms themselves (free internet! great muffins and coffee! good advice!), and beach access is only metres away. Parking is located behind the building, is ample and is free. The beach is quiet and pretty, and the hotel provides comfy beach chairs and towel service. If your idea of Hawaii is plunking yourself on a beach chair beside a pool and ordering $15 maitais...move on. If you want a fun, independent experience without an ounce of pretension, stay at the Paia Inn.

Reviews.Title: “felt like one of the family”
Reviews.Author: piratesofnebula
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a half a dozen hotels/BBs/cottages on three of Hawaii's islands. We loved them all - from the luxery of Wakiki beachfronts to the rustic Volcano village cottages; Paia Inn Hotel was hands down our favorite. We made last minute arrangements and got the last room available - it faced the city street so we could watch the hustle and bustle of Paia - an experience in itself. The room decor was gorgeous - more like a guest room than a hotel room. The hotel staff were personable, upbeat, welcoming - going to extra lengths to make sure we enjoyed our stay. We felt like one of the Paia Inn family. I loved the no-TV lounge with internet and computer. We only stayed one night so we missed using the beach, but wandering down the path to take a look at it (for the next time we stay) was a sensory delight. Loved the beach - can't wait to stay again and use it. We came as a couple, but we could imagine bringing kids and grandkids - what a great place to see the best of Hawaii - far from the condo forest of the other side of the island. Too bad about the parking and that Paia stoplight....

Reviews.Title: “A trendy place with great staff”
Reviews.Author: mstegfellner
Reviews.Content: We want see Maui without Resorts and Tourist-Crowds. We find it in Paia an espacially in The Paia Inn. The entrance trough a little garden with chairs and tables to the "like a living room - reception" show you the philosophie of this good place. We had the standard-room, this is a real little room. But you spend the most time outside in the villiage, the beach or the garden. Here is a very helpfull and friendly staff - we had much fun, also with Michel, the owner! Thank you for 2 good days!

Reviews.Title: “Why stay at an airport hotel when you can stay here?”
Reviews.Author: Tarpi
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn is a very stylish, adorable, little hotel in the heart of Paia. We loved the decor and art, the rooms were comfy, and the staff were great -- welcoming us with a glass of wine when we arrived and running out to buy us fresh muffins to go with our coffee in the morning. We did not have a chance to visit the beach by the hotel, but we very much enjoyed being in the heart of Paia's great, artsy shops, cafes and restaurants. If you have a flight that arrives in the evening, staying at this Inn in Paia is a fantastic way to kick off your vacation. No reason to stay in an ugly hotel by the airport when Paia is just a short drive away. You can even start your first morning off with an hour drive to view the glorious sunset at Haleakala Crater and still be back at the Inn in time for fresh coffee and muffins followed by a hearty breakfast down the street at Charley's. I'd definitely recommend this spot!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, beautiful rooms, easy access to secluded beach”
Reviews.Author: pipsycar
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Maui and we decided to do things a bit off the beaten path. After reading the reviews of Paia Inn, I booked 3 nights here and then 4 nights at the Guest Houses at Malanai in Hana. Everything was perfect! I called the Paia Inn to make reservations and spoke to Nina, who was very friendly and gave me suggestions about Hana. Even though they only have 5 rooms in the main building (they also have a couple of cottages), they had a generous cancellation policy (simply 24 hours notice). Upon arrival we were greeted with glasses of white wine and shown to our room. The room is on the small side but very tastefully decorated. We don't mind a small room because we usually spend most of the time out - afterall we're on vacation! The location is superb - it was very centrally located for the places that we went - Lahaina for one evening for dinner at Mala Ocean Tavern (yum!) and a show at Warren & Annabelle's (which I HIGHLY recommend), Maalaea Harbor for a sailing/snorkeling trip to Molokini on Trinity, and Haleakala National Park. And it was also the perfect starting point for the 2nd part of our vacation, the drive to Hana. When we told Jonelle as we were checking out that we were going to the Lavender Farm and then to Hana, she suggested that we drive the back way to Hana (going counter clockwise). We took her suggestion and it was amazing! The drive is so gorgeous and we saw lots of rainbows. Thanks for the suggestion! The beach is beautiful. We went every day - there is a 2-minute walk on a private path to the beach, which is not on the tourist track. Twice we went in the morning and we were the only ones there! I really appreciated use of the beach chairs as well. Water was great for boogie boarding and for watching the locals surfing. Paia Town has so many great places to eat and a fabulous grocery store - Mana Foods - where we stocked up prior to our trip to Hana. Complementary perks/amenities that really make you feel welcome and not nickel & dimed: - Wireless Internet in the rooms - A lovely central lounge area with music playing, and a computer with Internet access and printer (again free) - Complementary coffee and muffins in the morning - Beach towels, beach chairs, and other equipment like boogie boards available to take down to the beach All in all we loved our stay and couldn't have been happier with it.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews don't lie”
Reviews.Author: boomgoesthedynamite
Reviews.Content: Despite reading some great reviews on this site, I still wasn't sure what to expect. Firstly, there were not that many reviews and secondly, because many seemed to be exaggerated. But I heard Paia was less touristy place and we often like to check out these types of places while travelling, so we went ahead and booked at the Inn. We were not disappointed. Paia was exactly what we were looking for and Paia was the perfect place. It was just my wife and I and we stayed in the Junior Bedroom Suite. The suite had a bathroom; a living space with a couch that pulled out into a bed, a microwave and a mini refrigerator; and a bedroom. The bed was very comfortable. Both the living room and bedroom had a flat screen TV, which were useful at night when most things were shut down. Overall, the room was excellent (side note: room service is available in the day time, as well). Random notes: - The people at the front desk were always extremely helpful and friendly. - High speed internet was a plus and helped in a business-related pinch. (But try not to ever use it - just relax out there!) - Parking was convenient. - The hotel is not beach front, but it was a very short walk to get there. In fact, I could get to the beach five times faster than when I was staying at the beach front Sheraton in Kaanapali. - We had a great time just relaxing, strolling down the street, and taking in some good food and drinks. There are several good eats within walking distance. The prices are much more reasonable than at the larger resorts. - Hassle-free hotel stay - everything needed was within walking distance, parking was available when necessary, someone was always available and knowledgeable to answer questions. - My wife bought a blue strawberry. - Several artsy places with locally made items were very nice. - If you're more comfortable in a touristy area, then you may not care for this place. - We stayed 6 nights at the Sheraton in Kaanapali. It was a very nice hotel, and I enjoyed my time, but in a very different way. Overall, I favored Paia Inn's personality and charm over the very impressive, but more sterile Sheraton complex.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and stylish”
Reviews.Author: ISMLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights and really liked it. The staff were great - and helped me find a salon and a running track! The room i had was stylish, relatively small but fine for single traveller and had some sensible design points, eg the bed was high enough for me to stash my luggage under! also lovely toiletries (works every time). i had no trouble parking or any trouble with the noise (my room was to the side over the car park). beach access was great and it was great too to be able to borrow boogie boards and beach chairs. breakfast was fine although one morning one guest at least was rather too hungry and the muffins had all gone. but really handy for coffee shop over the road. you could easily stay here and not use the car for a few days too. also great that they had free internet access and skype set up for guests to use. my only real issue - and it wasn't a disaster - was that i was in one of the rooms which shared the air con controls with other rooms. this meant i couldn't turn it off. the temp was fine but i like to turn the air con off at night and i couldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in a small town on North Shore”
Reviews.Author: Lv2Trvl
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this little gem of a hotel in Paia. The town is lined with shops and restaurants and thereâ€™s a beach right by the hotelâ€™s property. From the moment of our arrival we were welcomed like old friends. Our suite was the deluxe room with a very contemporary feel to it. Actually our suite was 3 rooms facing the front side of the inn. We had a separate sitting room with a big screen TV and mini kitchen adjoining our bedroom and a small bathroom beautifully tiled and fully complemented with plenty of towels and local toiletries. The hotel was immaculately kept and we were very comfortable. The common area on the second floor was equipped with a computer and printer available to the guests. Paia was approximately 20 minutes away from the airport and a great option if you want to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience - will return”
Reviews.Author: johnnybSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in at the Paia Inn for one night in early February before leaving Maui the next day and loved it. It's located in the middle of town and essentially on the beach (through a private pathway), which provided for easy exploration of the nearby restaurants and shops as well as somewhat exclusive beach access. The rooms were very nice: comfortable beds with ample storage for luggage underneath, modern fixtures, air conditioning, proper insulation from exterior noise, nice electronics, etc. The coffee and pastries provided by the coffee shop across the street were a great touch. One thing that we were particularly pleased with was the state of completion of the property. It definitely didn't have the feeling of a brand new hotel still working out the kinks - everything (construction, service, etc.) was representative of an established hotel. Off-street parking was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Energy at the Paia Inn”
Reviews.Author: Halifaxjake
Reviews.Content: After spending 5 days at a large resort in Wailea we headed north to Paia. I had booked 2 nights at the Paia Inn online based on the location and reviews. We were thoroughly impressed with this little gem! It is easy to find (really only 1 street in Paia!). We were met by the very friendly Nina who gave us a tour of the hotel and property. The hotel has 5 rooms situated around a central common room/computer room/library. Its a great set up! The decor is modern and tasteful. The whole place gave off a positive energy that we welcomed after our previous stay at a standard-style mega-resort. From the live goldfish in the room, to the Travertine tiled bathroom, to the private beach access- everything was great! The room was small, but with the adjacent common room, downstairs lounge, and courtyard, it didn't seem cramped at all. We wished we had booked here for longer. Would definitely come back again! Jason Williams Halifax, Canada

Reviews.Title: “A Fresh New Alternative to a Stay at a mega-resort”
Reviews.Author: Kendotm
Reviews.Content: The Inn is a great hub to visit and explore the fabulous North Shore of Maui. It offers something less tangable but more feel good than the mega resorts on Maui's South Shore and West Side. Something much more than expected. "Exceeds expectations." A personalized stay is crafted by the attentive and friendly staff. In the Bahamas the term Potlatch is used to describe the little bits of extra attention to detail that makes your stay special and memorable. Paia Inn, You Got It!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Retreat”
Reviews.Author: MaxTaylor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went over to Maui for a business meeting and we took 3 days ahead of time for ourselves. We wanted a no-fuss relaxing 3 days. We were pleasently surprised with how quickly we relaxed, the whole town had a relaxing vibe, and the fact that we didn't have to get in a vehicle to have fabulous food was a plus. As for the hotel - we are going to go back to Paia just to stay at the Inn! I felt like I was in the world best kept secret - details and quality are the words that come to mind. Yoga by the ocean. The owners and staff made us feel like honoured guests, my list goes on. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo, Mahalo, Mahalo”
Reviews.Author: intltrvlCalgary
Reviews.Content: Thank you, thank you, thank you! Is there a boutique style, reasonably priced, amazing place to stay in Maui? Yes there is! Upon our late arrival, we were greeted with a glass of wine. In the morning, coffee and treats from Anthony's and the smiling face of the staff set us in the right direction for our day, every day. We grew fond of our goldfish, Newton; the staff that truly enjoyed working there (it shows in their service) and the owners. I could go on all day, but have to get back to work. ps. If you get the chance, challenge Sarah to a game of outdoor table tennis. If you are really good, you can take on Michael. Thanks again, Two very satisfied travellers from Calgary, Alberta.

Reviews.Title: “Magic - Best Hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: romanticpeople
Reviews.Content: From the moment we called and booked our reservation the Staff was Magic. When we stepped into the Lobby it could not have been a more Magical place. It had everything we could have asked for in a small luxury hotel located right in town and also on the beach. The Staff goes out of their way to make sure you are taken care of. We loved the beach, the many interesting shops and restaurants nearby. There is a terrific pizza place next door and a vegetarian vietnamese restaurant across the street. We worked out at the Hotel's nearby fitness center which is a great addition. The beds are super comfortable and the rooms have a designer feel. Excellence. This is the Best Place to stay on Maui. Magic Magic Magic.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: denise_evans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paia Inn in mid-December. We were delighted with both the hotel and the staff. When we arrived, we were pleased to find that we had been upgraded to a cottage which was just lovely - very private and beautifully decorated. The staff were extremely helpful. We went to some fantastic waterfalls which we would have never found without the extremely detailed directions we were given. From the outside, you would never realize how nice the hotel is inside. It fits perfectly with the town of Paia.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, cool, comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: soitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Paia Inn on our way back from Hana towards the more popular western side of the island. We loved Paiai so much we came back our last afternoon before we flew out of Maui. The Paia Inn embodies what is so wonderful about this town - it's very welcoming (the owners and staff are great), low-key and just plain COOL. Each room comes with its own pet goldfish, which is cute. The decor is modern and beachy (the owners are interior designers). The rooms have an iHome in which you can plug in your iPod or iPhone for music, as well as flat screen TVs. The rooms are small, however, so once you've got suitcases open on the floor it can be a little tricky to move around, but since the town and beach are so delightful, we weren't spending time in the room outside of sleeping and showering. Some of the rooms have the sink inside the bedroom (instead of the bathroom), so if this is something you don't like, make sure to try and get a different room (Room #1 does not have this problem). The only other "funky" aspect is the parking situation. The inn has 5 rooms, but only three parking stalls, so tandem parking is used to accommodate the additional vehicles. If your car is blocking another guest, you'll need to leave your keys at the front desk so your car can be moved if needed. If you are staying for more than a couple nights, ask about their cottage, which is right on the beach and looks much more spacious for a multi-day visit.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy little Inn!”
Reviews.Author: FrenchFryDog
Reviews.Content: We returned from Maui a few days ago. I did have a chance to check-out the Paia Inn about one week ago. The Inn is cute - very much looks like a B&B. The rooms are small, updated & quaint. The little outdoor courtyard is nice but very small. The Inn is located on the Hana Hwy in the middle of a bustling community and conveniently located next door to a gas station. This is not a luxury or high-end destination but a nice, clean place if you want to stay in Paia. The art gallery beneath the Inn was terrific!

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Heiman5
Reviews.Content: The Paia Inn is the must-stay location on North Shore Maui. The location is ideal- close to restaurants and directly on the beach. The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. I have been coming to Maui for 30 years and this hotel lifts the island to another level. Note: Watch-out for celeb-spotting- in this small hotel there is more glitterati per inch than the Hotel Matinez during Cannes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Staff!! Extremely friendly! A great addition to Paia...”
Reviews.Author: lyonbyte
Reviews.Content: From now on, when I have to work on Maui, I will always stay there. The staff was extremely friendly. The rooms were the best that Ive stayed in. That includes all of Hawaii. This is coming from a frequent business traveler from Oahu. Once I find a nice place to stay at on the outer islands, I always come back. As far as Maui goes. This is my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Topograph
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because I was working nights 5 miles up the road. They noted this on my reservation, and when I checked in, told me they had upgraded me to the suite since it would be quieter for me during the day. The bed was divine, the breakfast muffins were fresh, and the coffee strong. I plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: dprider
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Maui without any accommodations reserved, as we sometimes like to wing it. While having a lovely lunch in the lovely town of Paia, we engaged a local lady at a table next to ours in conversation and she recommended the Inn. While the prices are higher than we usually like to pay, we decided to go for it when realized it was located right in the heart of the town of Paia within walking distance to everything, including the beach. They have their own private beach access, despite not being directly on the beach. The location was key here - particularly because my boyfriend was still using a cane after ankle fusion surgery, so keeping walking distances minimal was very important. As parking in the town can be difficult and the traffic congested, it was the deciding factor. We were really pleased with the accommodations, which although small, are very comfortable and well considered. The sheets and beds are GREAT! And we slept like babies. In the morning, there was coffee, tea and pastries from a breakfast place across the street "Anthony's". They were delicious and made getting going in the morning a lot easier. We could skip a larger breakfast and hold out for a early lunch (which I'm sure saved us some $$ in the long run). We were a little bit concerned about noise the first night, as that afternoon there was a lot of noise from the restaurant under the Inn, but our concerns were unfounded, as each night when we turned in early, all was quiet. There is some noise from the street first thing in the morning, but the town seems to stop moving at 8:30pm every night. The staff were very accommodating and even let me use the laundry inside the Inn when the outdoor dryer seemed to be taking too long. If I have any complaints, the only one would be that the water in the shower was not sufficiently hot despite turning it up all the way. I'm sure they have already done something to fix this.

HotelInfo.Name: Paia Inn Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 93 Hana Highway, Paia, Maui, HI 96779
